The caramelized cheese crust is to die for. I could eat just the crust and be satisfied. The pie as a whole has a great balance of crust, cheese and toppings. The sauce is delicious and I love that they are open late. There was no wait when I visited around 11pm.
Service was great. Food was great. Definantly a place to go for great pizza !!!! I got a personal deep dish lunch special, it was amazingly delicious.

We had to come taste the hype!! This place did NOT disappoint!!! The crust was not super thick which is a good thing for us , the sauce was very flavorful, just the right amount of cheese with just the right amount of toppings! Our server Sinai C was excellent!!! This is a must if in the area!!!

After seeing all the rave I had to try. Sat at the bar upstairs...no fancy by any means but I'm there for pizza.Staff was crazy busy yet friendly.  My pan pizza was delicious.  The crust is not doughy or overly thick.  The burnt cheese edges are heaven. The days could be thicker for me but I ate it all and would go it again

Since this place is right by the theatre we went there to grab food before our movie. The food was amazing!! I'm definitely not a deep dish person, like I eat it but it's not something I love or crave. But after I had their cheese deep dish pizza I fell in love I've literally been thinking about going back since then. This is now my favorite deep dish place. The service was also really good. The only suggestion would be to keep the place a bit more cleaner? Saw some random paper pieces on the floor.

I totally understand why so many reviews and why so many great reviews.  The Chicago Deep Dish Pizza here is amazing.  They put a ton, and I do mean a TON of high quality toppings on this pizza.  The sausage chunks were like miniature boulders.  I love when a restaurant endeavors to do nothing but the best and at a great consumer value.  This will be a repeat destination on my journeys to Chicago.

Amazing stuffed crust pizza. I was told this is where the locals eat. Place is small but they have a hard working and friendly staff. Had pan pizza sausage and mushroom. Would definitely go back next time I'm in Chicago.

This pizza is fantastic! We were seated very quickly given the size of the room in the place. Seating downstairs is a little cramped. My one complain was how hot it was in the room. This was my only time here so it could have been a night where the AC was malfunctioning. When ordering a pizza, they let you know in advance to expect at least a 30 minutes wait time!

I don't care how good your pizza is... if you're rude to first time customers and make them feel unwelcome, you get one star.  We were fully prepared to wait, but being told it would be 45 min to get a buzzer and then 3 hours after getting a buzzer is insane.  That isn't even accurate, it is simply an attempt to drive business away. Shame on you for having such an elitist practice.

Pequod's is consistently my favorite pizza in Chicago. Their pan pizza, while not typical "Chicago-style," is sheer perfection. The sauce is tangy and delicious however the real show stopper is the cheesy crust. Pequod's lives up to the hype.

I was born and raised in Chicago and pride myself on knowing good pizza. I want to give this place 5 stars but I have had better so it wouldn't be fair. We had the pan pizza and our fav part is definitely the caramelized cheese edges, although one side was more burnt than caramelized. The bottom part of the crust was nice and crispy but the middle was on the doughy side. The sauce and sausage is a good flavor. We opted for green peppers as well. The size of the peppers were very random. A couple of huge pieces mixed with some smaller diced pieces. A more uniformed piece would add a consistent flavor and texture. Our waitress was very attentive and friendly. It's a small place with exposed brick. Definitely busy and a little on the crammed side so it's loud. I would definitely recommend this place. I really want to give this place 5 stars. Perhaps our next visit will yield a more evenly cooked pizza.
Among the best.  You must like dough to enjoy the pizza because it is thick and crispy at the same time.  Not too much cheese which lightens it a bit.

The wait for this place was craaazzzyyyy. But not crazy enough for me not to give it 5 Stars. This was on our list of places to visit during our weekend in Chicago, and it did not disappoint. Medium pizza is more than enough for two people, and it was definitely all it was hyped up to be. You get to pick your own toppings either full or half, which is convenient when sharing. Staff was friendly and attentive. I would recommend everyone to go here at least once.

People seem to really love Pequod's but personally I think it's a bit overrated.  I would rather go to Art of Pizza.  The lines at Pequod's can be a bit out of control and the pizzas aren't that great.  I think the reason I don't like their pizza has something to do with their crust but I can't quite identify what ingredient in it I don't like.  Also, the space is really dated and small.

While visiting Chicago, I knew we had to have some deep dish pizza.  It came down to choosing between Pequod's and Lou Malnati's.  After reviewing both places, I chose Pequod's because of it's unique crust.  The atmosphere is wonderful, homey, cozy and everyone was friendly.  Even though it was pre-dinner (around 4:30), the place was packed.  We sat, had a pitcher of beer while we waited for our pizza.I have to admit I was pretty disappointed.  While I'm not a deep dish connoisseur, I have had it on plenty of occasions.  I felt the pizza here was a little flat and thin - it didn't have the unctuousness of a deep dish pizza.  The crust was basically just blackened/burned cheese.  It was interesting and chewy for the 1st bite, but the novelty wore off after that, and I began to crave the traditional flaky crust that I associate with deep dish.While I do take responsibility for choosing Pequod's, and I appreciate the traditional twist on the crust, I wouldn't go back.

Sooooooo good. I say this place is a must try when in Chicago! The caramelized crust was awesome and it hit the spot just right.We didn't order anything else except our deep dish and patiently waited till it came out. I recommend coming here hungry and patient. We got lucky and got seated right away but usually it gets busy with a wait. WORTH A TRY! Everyone ends up picking their favorite though depending on their different taste.
Are u kidding me? The best pan pizza on earth hands down!!!! Parking sux but what ya you gonna do.

We had read a couple good reviews of Pequod's Pizza recently, so we headed into the city to try this award-winning pizza.  It was okay but not as cheesy as I had hoped! We had literally just watched videos of slices of this pizza being served and this amazing stretchy cheese...I felt like ours was missing so much cheese.

If you woke up this morning and were like, "Dang, I wish someone on the internet would tell me where I could get the best pizza in the world from," good news - I'm here!Pequod's is amazing. The pizza, the crust, the toppings, the atmosphere. I love it all. I especially recommend going with children because they will think that the caramelized cheese around the rim of the baking dish is "burnt" and will give it to you and your mouth and face will rejoice. There is quite a wait here (or has been every time I've gone there) but the good news is that there's an overflow bar next door where you can sit and enjoy a free non-alcoholic beverage. Good thinking, pizza people!

At the end of my second and final full day in the Windy City, I am reflecting back on my dining experiences in the last 48 hours. I knew before coming that I wanted to be super touristy and try at least one deep dish pizzeria.  Asking for recommendations, I was told about 2 places: Giordano's and Pequod's.  Being the gluttonous Texan and street food connoisseur that I am, I said to myself, "This seems like a good excuse to eat pizza 2 days in a row!"  So naturally, I had Giordano's yesterday and Pequod's today.Listen to me carefully: Giordano' is milquetoast, moderately halfway decent pizza.  Pequod's on the other hand, is a divine medley of sauce, toppings, and a metric ton of melted cheese practically bursting out of the buttery, garlicky caramelized crust that so precariously holds it all together.  Holy hell is this good pizza.  I ordered the same thing at both establishments--personal pizza with pepperoni, sausage, green pepper, and pineapple (shut up, it's meant to be, and you know it)--and Pequod's just absolutely blew Giordano's out of the water for the same price point.  Everything from the ambience to the friendliness of the staff to the quality of the food was just way better.Pequod's, thank you for putting your goods in my mouth.

One of the best pizza's in Chicago! Its definitely  a must! The crust is the best part. My personal go to is : Italian sausage with giardinera extra well done. There is usually a wait but that is expected - especially on weekends. Delivery is also an option - totally worth waiting.
The absolute best meatball sub ever invented. Somewhat impossibly, it's even better than their pizza. Been going here for years.

Of all the Chicago pizzerias I would say Pequods is definitely top 5! If you want to try them during their non busy times, go during their weekday lunch special!! It's $5 for a personal pizza with 1 topping and a drink. What a steal! So far I've had their:- pan pizza with sausage - pan pizza with pepperoni - appetizer plattter (mozz sticks, fried mushrooms, fried zucchini, jalapeño poppers)- wings I like their fried mushroom and the pan pizza with sausage. The only reason I didn't give them a 5/5 is because as a native Chicagoan, I assumed it was deep dish, maybe it isnt and really is a pan pizza? There's more dough than cheese, sauce, and toppings. But as a PAN PIZZA, it's good and has a tasty crust

Best deep dish pizza in Chicago, IMO!! I always recommend eating here over Giordano's and Lou Malnati's to out-of-town friends. Everything about Pequod's is significantly better, especially the fact that their crust is seasoned so you're not just eating unflavored cardboard like the other restaurants. Definitely recommend eating here if you're looking for deep dish.

I figured I should try all the pizzeria Chicago has to offer so this was next on my list. The wait - wasn't too bad considering we came in on a Friday night at 7pm. We only had to wait 1 hour before being seated. The food - we ordered immediately after we were seated knowing how long the pizza would take (about 50 minutes). Ordered a medium which is about 6 slices and perfect for 2-3 people. It's kinda ridiculous that each topping is about $3 so if you want a combo pizza that's about $15 extra for 5 toppings! We got pepperoni, mushrooms, and basil. It was nice that they loaded the pizza with pepperoni and mushrooms considering the price we paid but next time, just skip the basil because it was nonexistent.  Also order the cheesy garlic bread which was mediocre, no marinara sauce to dip. Lastly, a pitcher of beer on tap which was only $18, worth it. The service - our server was sweet and would check in on us every so often but not too much that it was annoying. However, the ones who brought out our food (busboys?) were kinda rude.. when he brought the cheesy garlic bread he dropped the plate on our table, didn't even bother to look at us and just walked away. Overall, it was a different kind of pizza experience but I don't think I will be back. My favorite part of the pizza is the crust but I couldn't eat it because it was so burnt, the whole crust was black.

They hardly need another review from me, but if you're looking for deep dish in Chicago, this is definitely one of the top two. The wait is usually on the longer side, but grab an appetizer and a beer and it'll be more than worth it.

It was ok. Not some where I would return to when going back to Chicago. I had to try to see what all the fuss was over deep dish pizza, personally not a fan. If you are then you will probably like it. The best part was the toppings . The atmosphere was great old brick building. parking wasn't that bad found a spot on the street.

My first deep dish experience and thank goodness I went to Pequod's! WOW! It's definitely worth the 40 min wait to get your piping hot pie customed to perfection! The lunch deal made it suuuper cheap! I added additional toppings and a salad as well. The crunchy cheese on the sides made the pizza superb. A meal I won't forget!

I wouldn't call myself a deep dish connoisseur but I've tried my fair share of deep dish chains and pequods is by far the best. That being said, i think many people agree with me and I've always had a long wait (1-2 hours). The bar next door, whale tale, is the perfect place to wait for your table-you can enjoy apps and drinks while you wait too! Once you're seated you normally wait 45-60 mins for deep dish to be made so i recommend getting an appetizer sometime in the process if you're really hungry. But don't worry, the wait will be worth it! The pizza is EXCELLENT. I would say the service is so-so but considering they're always packed, I get it. I try to come here as much as I can when i come to Chicago!

I think I have found my favorite Chicago deep dish. I am not a native of Chicago and my list of deep dishExperiences are not intense but I have tried a few and this pizza is at the top of my list. Bar like atmosphere equipped with radio and sports playing on TV's. However, it also has an intimate vibe with the variety of guests (families, bar patrons, all ages, etc) and the warm service from the waitresses. You can tell the bar is a staple in the area.Pizza is mostly crust but the crust has a great airy texture. Cheese and toppings are still the main attraction and they are generous with the toppings. Tomato sauce is fresh and you can see traces of actual vegetables in the sauce (my fav). Best crust I have ever had on a deep dish- bye bye to regular butter crust! Loved my visit, wish there were more locations!
Line was crazy long. Pizza looked amazing. 40 minutes wait even for take out. We left and went somewhere else. We will be back and try again but since so many people were there and waiting outside...

Pequod offers a hybrid type Chicago style deep dish pizza, the pizza is more of a really thick pan pizza than the traditional deep dish. They are also famous for laying cheese all the way over the crust so you get that really crispy burnt cheesy crust on the edge which is amazing! We had both the Lou malnati and pequod back to back within the two days Chicago trip and comparing the two, pequod is a more hearty and rustic. All in all it's a must visit spot in Chicago.

Delicious pizza, less cheese than the usual Chicago deep dish pizzas. We got a deep dish green pepper, onion and of course gardiniera which is always an essential when you eat pizza. Pizza took about 50 minutes and came out piping hot just like I love it. Will definitely be back soon.

Amazing deep-dish pizza! The caramelized crust is perfect! The pizza itself is not too cheesy and baked to perfection. We ordered a large pizza for 4 people and it was more than enough, I would recommend skipping out on any appetizers just to make sure you have enough for 1-2 slices. The service is phenomenal and the wait time is reasonable (15-20 to get seated and 50 minutes for the pizza). It's a little out of the way but definitely worth the drive.

We spent the weekend in Chicago in from South Florida and figured we would need to find the best deep dish pizza while we were there. We came to Pequod's as we had multiple friends from the Chicago area recommend this as the best Chicago pizza. We came after Cubs game and were quite hungry. I was impressed as to how inexpensive the pizza was, we ordered one large pizza and between three of us we only finished about half. The pizza was brought to us in a cast iron pan,And it had a nice caramelized crust. The main reason that I would not choose this location as the best deep dish pizza in Chicago is due to the fact that probably 75% of the pizza was due and the other 25% was toppings and sauce versus other locations which had significantly more toppings and sauce. The pizza was still very enjoyable. If I am ever back in Chicago, I will most likely choose Giordanno's or Lou Malnatti's over Pequod's.

If this review were based on the pizza alone, it would hands down be 5 stars. Absolutely the best deep dish I've had in Chicago, although I seem to be in the minority that loves Giordano's and only somewhat enjoys Lou's.Went here on a Wednesday night, the wait for a table was only about 20 minutes and the wait for pizza was only about 30. Service was great. Caesar salad and mozz sticks were nothing special whatsoever, but I was only there for the pizza. I raved about it to my parents, so I came back with them on a Friday. BIG MISTAKE.We got there around 5:30, were told the wait was 60-90 minutes and we could hang out at the bar next door and wait. We obliged, got some drinks and wings and patiently waited. When we finally got sat around 60 min later, we obviously wanted to order right away so we could get ta' eating ASAP. The server then informed us that by the way, the wait for pizza right now is 90 minutes. I absolutely believe that this needs to be told to guests as soon as they put their name down to wait for a table. They do have a laminated piece of paper up front saying "the current wait for pizza is __" but it said 40 minutes both times I was there, which was overestimated on my first visit and way underestimated on my second.So all in all, if we had waited for a pizza (we didn't - we left), we would have been waiting a total of 2.5 hours to eat. I have waited at Oven Grinder for that long on a weekend night, but I KNEW what to expect because I was told that from the beginning, and once sat the food came out very promptly. If your food is taking 90 min to come out, you either need a bigger kitchen or you need to stop seating tables. Simple as that.Basically, come here early on a week day night or don't come at all.

I've ordered from them a few times, and I like the "caramelized crust" they are known for - but in general, I think the crust is too much bread.  It still all tastes good & you can tell they use good quality ingredients, but I'd only get it if my friends want this one in particular these days.
Love this place. True to Burt's original recipe (from the original Morton Grove location)

Traveling to Chicago to see some family- wifey and I decide to hit a new pizza spot. This time we landed here. We were blown away by all the reviews and the photos that we we knew we couldn't miss. We ordered a medium sausage, pepperoni, and damn near all the veggies creating a monster pan pie. The positives were the toppings were premium and quality. The pie was extremely heavy. Now let's get to the negatives- to me the pie was just Average at Best. It lacked flavor and seasoning. It was good trying a new spot, but this spot isn't for me.

In the ongoing battle of the best Chicago deep dish, I made my way over to Pequod's on a recent trip.What I like about this place is it's not located in the middle of the The Loop tourist trap. You get to see more of Chicago as you trek out here.The restaurant is simple and to the point. It's set up like a classic pizzeria with small tables scattered about and condiments on the table. Read the menu immediately upon sitting as the servers are quick to  take your order since the pizza takes quite a while to cook. I went with a pepperoni deep dish pizza.The pizza was very good, but honestly not as good as I was expecting. Flavors were good so was the sauce, but I have to say that I think Lou Malnati's is better. None the less, I plowed through as much of the pizza as possible and left there full and satisfied. Great pizza, but in my opinion, not the champion of Chicago deep dish. Still Lou Malnatis.

1/2/2018Came in from LA decided to do my typical foodie run and try a bunch of different Chicago specialties including PizzaAfter sampling Pequads Malnatis and Giordanos The winner is PequadsThe crust is super thick toppings are excellent I love the char around the edges just a great pizza overallPhoto of Pequod's Pizzeria - Chicago, IL, United States

I'd really rate Pequod's as 3.5 stars, but can't justify giving them four. We ate there last week while in Chicago. Our wait was about 40 mins, which is not too awful, and I was excited to try this place after reading all the great reviews.In SF we have a damn fine deep dish place called Little Star pizza. I am more of a NY style pizza fan, thin crust, not too oily, with a dough that is firm but with a little "give" when you bite into it. Deep dish and pan are very different animals from that. Their pan pizza was good, but I was kind of put off by the volume of the doughy pie. It was like eating a slab of Italian bread with sauce and toppings. That said, the sauce was tasty, a touch of sweetness complimented by some acidity. The sausage topping was excellent. The waitress did try to overcharge us for two other toppings, as we asked for half toppings and were charged for full, but they quickly sorted it out, albeit with some odd explanation about how their "system" can't take into account half toppings being spread over the entire pizza, as opposed to half the pizza. Huh? That would seem to be an easy concept to explain to the line cooks. Nonetheless, all's well that ends well. Would I return? Meh, only if someone else insisted.

I had been wanting to go there for a while now to see what the hype is about. I get there with a couple of friends and they were super quick get us seated and get our drinks. We did wait quite a bit for our pizza, but that's completely normal so no big deal. I was so excited to try it, since it looked so good especially with all the toppings (they were not stingy with the toppings, AT ALL). However, once I actually got into the slice it was just ok, which definitely disappointed. I will be giving it another try since I don't think my first time did it justice.

Nice location and very busy when we went. But they were able to accommodate us in a reasonable amount of time. They were able to seat us upstairs. Pizza was bready with a good amount of tomato sauce. Gave it 4 stars considering we were able to experience Chi-Town pizza there.
This place was awesome! If you are looking for some great deep dish pizza, check them out!
Delicious pizza. The crust isn't soggy in the least bit, they caramelize it and it adds a nice contrast to the rich flavor of the cheese and sauce.

Definitely worth the wait (for a table and the wait for the pizza to cook). It's different than the traditional Chicago deep dish, but in the best way possible. It has a caramelized crust and a pan, thick crust pizza. I don't know how they make the crust thick AND crispy, but they have. Note that a medium pizza is a MEDIUM pizza, and if there are just two of you, you should probably plan on leftovers or order a small. Waiting tip: the buzzer works in the bar two doors down, so you can enjoy a drink while waiting... the time flies by!

This is a pretty good place if you're craving a pan pizza. It's not a deep dish as many of us probably imagine (like Giordano's) but is instead a really thick and fluffy crust topped with cheese and sauce. It also has a carmelized ring of cheese around the outside for which it's famous. We got a pizza to go and ate it relatively soon after. It was pretty large so it lasted us a few meals. Overall, I felt that it was just average.The crust is thick but light and the sauce is tasty. It reminded a little of pan pizza from Pizza Hut.  It was a pretty good, if a little forgettable, pizza.

2 hour wait for a table, then 1 hour wait for pizza.We were soooo hungry that we ordered French fries at a pizza restaurant. Don't do that...Pizza is the main course and it's the highlight of this place. You can order half size toppings to create two different styles of half pizzas. Just remember it's very long wait and the restaurant itself is very crowded. I'm almost sure I'm gonna order take out only next time.
I used to think numero unos pizza was best till i had a pizza at pequads Amazing! and staff was great, when in town its a MUST!!!!!

I love Chicago style deep dish and was eager to try this place out. Pizza itself was decent, although it was nothing to write home about. I do prefer Giordanos and Pizanos. The service was absolutely terrible. Shawna S was our waitress and was pretty rude while ordering because we made one minor modication to the order 10 seconds after she walked away from the table. She acted like it was such a chore to simply go in and modify it and gave us an attitude about it. Then, after politely asking why our appetizer took more than 30 minutes, she immediately came back from the kitchen and literally dropped it on our table, causing the sauce to drop all over the bread, while rudely saying that it always took that long for that particular appetizer to be made. The rest of the experience was suppar at best. Really disappointed in this pizza joint and will not be coming back.

**Vegetarian Friendly**This place is always busy! Definitely a good amount of wait time. Also be prepared to wait for your food because it does take about 45-60 minutes to make one pizza. This is a pan-style pizza as opposed to the traditional Chicago deep dish, but it's equally good. Really enjoyed it because the crust had a nice crisp to it, as opposed to something more soggy/chewy.

Deep dish!! Yassss!! The pizza did take about 40 mins, but totally worth the wait. We ordered 2 large- add the italian sausage, the pieces are huge. 2 pieces will keep you full all day! Amazing stuffed crust too!

AVOID DELIVERY at all costs...Let me preface this review by saying that I love Pequod's pizza. It's one of my favorite (if not my favorite) pan pizzas of all time.  However, their delivery is horrendous.  I've ordered delivery about 6 times from Pequods. 3 of those times, there have been major issues with the delivery.First of all, delivery takes a while. But they're up front about it. I can live with that. The issue comes in when there are problems with the order itself. Usually when someplace makes a mistake, they own up to it and fix the problem as quickly as possible. Pequods does neither of those things. Let me elaborate on this with respect to today/tonight. From start to "resolution" was almost 5 hours. I placed the order at 4 and was told that the order would come in about 2 hours.  It came in a bit less time. Great!  Unfortunately, the salad I ordered was missing.  I called back and eventually got through to a manager who was fairly dismissive and gave me the choice of voiding the salad or having it delivered. I opted to have it delivered, to which she responded by saying that they were very busy and she wasn't sure when we'd get it.  Ok.  This was 6 pm. Fast forward to 8:45. Still no salad and no update.  So I called back and after waiting for about 10 minutes on hold, I finally got an update. The first salad wasn't made (we knew this otherwise, they would have just brought it).  The second was made but the delivery person forgot it on his way out.  This seemed a bit suspect to me, and of course no one will fess up as to whether the salad ever did exist, but what can you do.  In the end, I got through to another manager who offered comping the salad and a $25 gift card for the a future order. I told her that I wanted the entire bill comped given the trouble I'd had. She said that half the bill was the best she could, and I accepted. I told her that I'd never order from Pequods again, to which she responded ok, we're sorry to lose a customer. It seemed insincere.Long story short, Pequods needs to improve their delivery significantly.  50% success is not acceptable and no one should feel like they've done something wrong when they haven't. The bill should have been comped.
It's the most overrated pizza place in Chicago - no matter how good the pizza is, I would never wait over 90 minutes for my dinner. Period. My last time there.
The best pizza I've had, period! The pan pizza style is delicious. I cannot wait to go back :D

I'm not a big fan of deep dish pizza, it's too heavy. But Pequod's is the exception. Somehow they manage to get a crust that's light and crunchy, with a great caramelized touch. Skip the tourist traps on Michigan and make the extra effort to come here, it's worth the trip and the wait (yes, you will have to wait, but unlike the other deep dish places, you won't regret it).
Perfect savory/sweet balance on the sauce.  Caramelized cheese on the crust.Best deep dish pizza OFYOUR  LIFENo lie.  That is all.
We were waiting for two hours to be steated and one more hour till we got one of the deep dish pizzas. Pizza was just soso and definitely not worth it to wait three hours.
Far and away my favorite place to take out-of-towners for pizza. The crusts are amazing. If time is an issue, I would recommend calling ahead with your pie order
Ordered pizza and I was delivered a burnt pizza. My first time in Chicago and everyone praised how amazing they are so I ordered and I got this charred pizza!
Fantastic deep dish. No gimmicky atmosphere. Quick service and reasonable prices. Would recommend as a deep dish spot if you have people visiting from out of town.

Came here on a Sunday afternoon around 2pm after the chicago marathon. When we arrived, we were given a buzzer to let us know when our table was ready. There was also a sign at the hostess stand that said pizzas will take 40 min after ordering them. No big deal...we headed to the bar and ordered a drink while we waited. The buzzer went off 10 min later (even though it was supposed to be 25-30min) and we walked to a table upstairs.It was pretty hard getting our waitress' attention once we sat down. We had to ask 2x for waters that finally came 30 min after we originally ordered them. We ordered the jalapeño poppers to start and then got 2 personal 7' deep dish pizza (one meatball/extra sauce and the other with sausage, pepper, onions). Mind you we are fro NY/NJ so are used to eating thin crust or brick oven slices. We enjoyed the deep dish experience but just felt like it was a casserole vs. a slice of pizza! Nothing against pequod's...that is just our own personal preference. The "pizza" was super tasty and I'm sure better than the others in town.3 stars not because we didn't like the food but because of the subpar service. It was almost impossible to get a hold of our waitress. I understand it was a busy Sunday after the marathon and with football games, but tolerance only takes you so far.

Best deep dish pizza ever!!! I've had Pequod's 4 times now (3 being in the restaurant, 1 delivery). If you can, eat inside the restaurant because delivery order just does not taste as good. Ok, let's talk about the pizza. And THE CRUST! The caramelized burnt crust is amazing. It's the best part of the pizza in my opinion. These are my go to toppings:Pepperoni, pineapple, green pepper, mushroom, onion Ordered sausage before and it was just too much on my opinion. As for appetizers, I've gotten the mozzarella sticks and bruschetta. They are both good but nothing special. It's nice to eat some light appetizers if you're waiting 40-50 minutes for your pizza.

On vacation from California and I was recommended to Pequods from all the locals. This place is delicious, and the the vibe is great. Perfect after a game since they're open late. Only thing I recommend is that you come in with an empty stomach!

After a year of living in the Windy City, I've finally gotten the chance to try Pequod's to see what the hype was all about in regards to "Chicago's Best Deep Dish Pizza!"Then I realized that everything is relative to what you like in a pizza. is it the sauce, the cheese, the dough, etc. If you are a bread fan, then this place will certainly live up to your expectations. But if you're like me, then you'll just find this to be another great deep dish variant, but not the most "amazing" one that I've ever bitten into.For starters, Pequod's reputation means that it gets busy no matter the time or day. My friend and I came here for a New Year's lunch, and luckily called in to "get priority." We essentially skipped to the top of the line once we arrived because we called in early to make a semi-reservation. I suggest that you do the same!We were seated at a booth and I really loved the layout of the restaurant. I felt like it had just enough space without feeling overcrowded, and loved the brick walls and sports bar vibe.Our meal started with their Fried Sampler plate which was bomb. Loved the mozzarella sticks and jalapeño poppers the most. About 20 minutes later, our large deep dish pizza came out with sausage, Canadian bacon, green peppers, and basil. Each topping was an additional $2.50 on top of the pizza price.Right off the back, the pizza smelled real good and I could tell that it was a lot of bread! Pequod's is known for its quality dough, and I can see why! The thin tomato sauce layer held together some amazing pieces of meat. I would say that the best sausage on a deep dish pizza was definitely from here.Personally, I prefer a deep dish with more cheese, sauce, and toppings rather than the dough itself. Because of this, I can't really call this the best deep dish pizza in Chicago, but it truly is one of the best I've had. If you're into bread, then this is surely for you!

Ok so I'm just going to get right into this:The pizza is so disappointing. If you're in Chicago for a few days and are in the mood to try deep dish I would avoid this. The reason I'm saying that is because it is seriously just all crust. So much bread and very little topping. To have an equal balance of both is preferred but the proportions were way off. They bring it out in a skillet and honestly it was over cooked. I don't want slightly charred pizza at all. Maybe I'm being a snob about this since I come from NYC and we are all about the pizza (albeit thin crust or "regular"). The sausage was good but the pieces were so thick that they had only put 3. Instead of spread it around by cutting it into smaller pieces.The seating was ok, there are two large floors which is helpful although the wait to sit was about an hour and the wait for our pizza almost another hour. Half of our floor was empty for good reason since there was no AC! So a hot kitchen putting off hot air onto the top floor of a building is not fun at all. I do like that you get to customize your pizza in terms of size and toppings. That's wonderful. I also loved the Whale Tale next door. The service was also wonderful and a good selection of drinks. But I will not recommend this place unless someone I know is really in the mood for a lot of bread.
The crust. Yum. I get why people talk about it. Cozy family friendly place and my kid loved the food as well. We will be back! Plus they take reservations so that's a plus!!

My husband and I were disappointed by the pizza here. After going to Lou malnatis (which was so delicious!)  we were told by the locals to go here saying it was amazing and it's where all the locals go for deep dish pizza. Honestly, the wait itself wasn't bad. We were told the wait would be 20-45 minutes then another 60 minutes for the pizza to be made. I think we waited 15 min to be seated and maybe 40 minutes for the pizza to come out. And this was Sunday night around 530. They also let you wait at a bar two doors down the block if the restaurant bar is full. We ordered a small sausage mushroom pan pizza. The pizza was not hot at all. My husband and I were actually able to touch the pizza pan with our whole hand and it felt just warm. I don't know why they had to carry it or with the special tong things. The pizza dough was so THICK. It's like a 4:1 ratio. I'm not even sure it was baked fully cuz I thought it tasted a bit soggy. The sausage tasted overwhelmingly of fennel seeds. The only compliment we had was that they used real mushrooms instead canned. We walked out agreeing we liked the broccoli cheddar bites we had at the bar next door while waiting for our table.
My favorite deep dish pizza in Chicago! They usually have a long wait, so either go early or plan to wait 1+ hours. Worth it though!

This place really was as good as I've heard. The service was nice and the pizza was so good. That caramelized cheese crust is to die for. I've always been a fan of the burnt cheese on any pizza, so this place really hit the spot. The only bad thing is the wait. And because the pizza is so good, it makes waiting all the more annoying.
My favorite pizza in the city so far.  The personal pan had plenty of caramelized cheese.  It was worth the 40 minute wait and I can't wait to go back again!
Loved my first experience at Pequod's! Very casual, non-imposing atmosphere with killer pies- check it out!!

The pizza is good. Very good. It's my favorite deep dish, and the caramelized cheese crust makes themagic happen.  During dinner hours, the wild wait is worth it only if you're trying to drink a lot of beers with buds next door or if you've got an out of town guest visiting. The golden deal is their lunch hour weekday personal pan, which comes out to around $10 with a drink. It's on the short list of places to hit up when I'm playing hookey from work during the week.

So normally this place is on point when it comes to pizza (thin and deep dish) but I ordered a thin crust last night (7/28/17) and I think the cook was mad at life or something and took it out on my order. I ordered fried mushrooms, a 12 inch thin crust with meatball, mushroom, & onion, a can of Coke & a can of Sprite. -1The Price: First of all that all came out to $40 prior to the tip (yikes) so I expected the normal magical unicorn dust flavors that Pequod's produces for the price. Nay kind Sir or Madam reader, here's how pizza night went downhill fast...-1The Appetizer: Well the mushrooms had breading that was too salty, and the mushrooms themselves had a weird after taste; like someone spit cinnamon Big Red gum in them before breading them!-1The Pizza: The pizza itself was a whole other hot mess: too much flavorless sauce and an ABUNDANCE of onions. I like onions...but I don't know anyone who likes them this much. I mean they were under the cheese, in the cheese & then for the piece de resistance, on top of the cheese. It looked like someone loaded a tee shirt cannon with onions and shot it on the pizza dead center. As for the meatballs (which should have been the star) it looked like someone took ah(uno/one) meatball chopped it into millionths and then placed the meatball dust on the pizza. The crust was thick and soooper dry. It sapped all the moisture out of my mouth like a 3ply industrial paper towel once it hit my tongue. The abundance of sauce should have helped the crust situation but again if you recall it was flavorless & tasted tinny. It tasted almost as though the sauce went from can to pizza. This all made for a terrible Friday pizza night. I know you guys get busy but everything is still usually always at the top of the pizza game. I don't want to believe that Pequod's is slipping because it's normally fantastic, but the only thing that tasted right in this order were the cans of pop! So one of you guys need to pop back into the kitchen and give the dude (or dudette) that preps your pizza a hug & a raise or something before this type of quality becomes a Pequod's standard.

The first dinner of the bachelor party was Chicago deep dish at Pequod's. I've been to all the other places in Chicago, so I saved this one for the party. There were 14 guys, and we ordered two large pies. Order a few pitchers of beers, and that's enough for all. We ordered one pie with sausage and pepperoni and the other was a cheesy garlic pie. I'm getting hungry just writing this review, but they were both great. Caramelized crust, and delicious toppings. Next time I'm in Chicago, I'm coming back here for more.

I've tried Giordano's, Lou Malnati's, and this. I think after these three experiences, I have to say that overall I'm really not a deep dish pizza fan. In terms of ranking, I'd say that Giordano's goes at the bottom for me (I gave them a 2/5 in my review). Lou Malnati's would come second best with a 3/5, and if there were half stars, Pequod's a 3.5/5. I was starving by the time I got to Pequod's, and everything tastes better when you're hungry. For appetizers, four of us split the combo which came with zucchini slices, mozzarella sticks, jalapeno poppers, breaded shrooms (not the drug kind), and onion rings. they were okay- the veggies were pretty juicy, the batter was crispy, and the dipping sauce paired well, but it's nothing memorable. and again, I don't think they would've tasted as "good" if I hadn't been so damn hungry (I'd give it 3.5/5).We split a large pan pizza with pepperoni, sausage, mushroom, and green peppers. The reason why I rank this place above the two others is because the whole pizza actually had some flavor and the crust was nice and buttery-tasting compared to Lou Malnati's and Giordano's which I thought both fell flat in terms of just being tasteful- I don't know what they lack, salt? butter? the sauce doesn't have enough spices? the dough just tastes like bland dough? not sure but what they lacked in their deep dish, Pequod's made up for it a bit better, and the browned cheese was delish. I'd still give a 3.5 to Pequod's deep dish pizza though, cause it came out mostly burnt on the sides (don't eat burnt stuff yo, it's cancerous) and deep dish just leaves me way too full to feel good about myself. It was okay and I'd recommend this above the other two but still not something I'd go around raving about and saying it's something you HAVE to try.
The best pizza in Chicago!  There is always a wait unless you get there early, but well worth the wait.
Everything u heard is true! Good pizza and even better appetizer's. Go during off hour's- after lunch Tuesday - Thursday ENJOY!

It was deeeeeeeeelicious. I loved it. I ordered a spinach, garlic, onion, and half sausage and it was a perfect ratio of ingredients. I was a little concerned because I read a lot of reviews complaining about the "breadiness" of the pizza but it was a classic deep dish. I will definitely be back. We went on a Sunday for lunch and I enjoyed it because it wasn't crazy busy and didn't  have to wait.

I mean, like, honestly. You know what's going on here. You're getting cheese gooey crispy crunchy caramelized pizza. And you're probably with someone who's visiting from out of town. Expect to wait for a table, then expect to wait for the pizza to cook. Some of, if not the singular, best Chicago deep dish available without the rigmarole of Burt's (RIP, you pioneer!). Love on the sandwich menu where it says "There's no beating our meat!" They know what they did there, and I saw it.

Awesome pizza and a great location. Perfect for after the movies because it's right across the street from Regal. And after 10pm it is not so busy, you don't have to wait at the door, so it's a win-win!

Worth the hype. I'm not a fan of deep dish pizza at all, but this was seriously the best pizza I have ever had!!! My friend and I ordered a small pan pizza, which was perfectly filling for two. Choice of toppings is minimal, but I'm sure even just cheese is more than satisfactory. My friend and I had half vegetarian and half pepperoni and sausage. If you have never been here, you're missing out. If you plan on coming here, be prepared to wait during peak times. Most people waiting at Pequods end up waiting at the bar next door. If you ordered drinks or food at the bar next door and you are called at Pequods, the bar will actually call Pequods to hold your table! My friend and I waited for 1.5 hours and didn't eat dinner until almost 10 pm since it takes time for the pizza to bake, but it was worth it! If I lived in Chicago, I'd probably make weekly trips.
Ordered it delivery. I thought I didn't like it... reheated leftovers next day ..knew it was fantastic pizza. The crust is the difference...it is delicious...as is the rest of it.

Great service and great ambiance.   I had requested quite a big table for a birthday party and they accommodated us quite well. For having such a big party they were quite efficient and the servers didn't lose their cool for having to serve so many people with so many different requests. Their pizza is amazing and I would def recommend coming here if you are in town.

Not sure what all the hype is about. Maybe we just got a not-great pizza the one time or it's just generally not my cup of tea. Nothing horrible- just kind of burnt and average. Know that people love this place- our delivered pizza was just so-so.

One of the best places to eat deep dish in Chicago hands down. This pizza somehow feels lighter than the rest of the deep dish I've had. The caramelized crust, sweet sauce, and quality ingredients make it a place I love to eat at when I'm in the area.The wait here can be pretty long during peak hours so definitely expect it when trying to eat here. The good thing is that there is plenty to see around Pequod's as well as a bar next door that you can get a drink at while waiting to get a table.

We ordered several deep dish pizzas for take away last week and were told they would be ready in an hour. When we arrived to pick them up they had not even begun cooking our order -- so had to wait another hour. When we brought the pizzas home, we were again disappointed -- the crust was over an inch thick and tasteless -- I could have done a way better job for a fraction of the cost. I doubt I will bother with Pequods again.

Crust: 5 stars!!! Taste/Toppings (sausage, ground beef, basil): meh 3Service: averagePricing: 4 stars - competitive pricingTip: Call day of to get moved to "top of the waitlist" which in my case, meant that when I arrived, instead of a 2 hr wait, I had a 1 hr wait for 3 people.Imagine you're sifting through your laundry, determining what to load in the washer next, do you pick your underwear? your stacks of stinky tshirts post-gym? or perhaps, those slacks with food stains? Now, apply this logic determining what you value in pizza to determine which deep dish place is your favorite. Pequod's ain't perfect, but it can be perfect depending on your pizza preferences. In my college heyday, I gorged myself with quite a bit of Giardano's and Lou's, but never got around to trying what many deemed to be the "best deep dish" in town aka Pequod's. What I got: Personal size half sausage, and half ground beef + basilCrust: PERFECTION. Described to be a "caramelized" crust and boy, can you see it! Giardano's has the soggy cardboard crust of death. Lou's crust has great taste but still can get dry or mush in the middle. Pequod's has a beautiful crunchy crust THROUGHOUT including the middle bottom. Tell me thy saucery!Everything else: sausage was pretty bland, Lou's sausage is by far superior. I also like the ground beef itself by Giardano's better. Passing grade for the cheese. I did like the fact that the sauce is not too watery.Atmosphere: very casual, has seating upstairs and downstairs, 45min or more to get your pizza cooked depending on how busy it is. Bar and hockey type of atmosphere.Bottom line: If perfect crust is what you desire - this is a must go. Too soon to call it for me in regards to the superiority of this to Lou's, definitely better than Giardano's and Uno's. May not be worth it for an extra long wait though. Will be back to try other toppings!
Great place for a group! We had friends visiting from out of town and we shared two pizzas and two pitchers and everyone paid about $10!
I came with high expectations! The pizza was ok but was not mind-blowing. I tried their original and added ground beef & veggies.

We came all the way from New York. We were recommended by a local friend who said that this place has the best Chicago style deep dish pizza. First impression - wait time is extremely long. We have been waiting for 2 hour and 45 mins. The hostess at front kept telling us that you are next. However, we 5 people, were standing right next to her and saw another group of 5 just came in. And the same hostess led their way to seating. We were shocked and felt it was very rude. She still kept saying that you are next and the other group has priority seating - which we never heard of or you forget to tell us?? If we are not next, please just be honest. Because the other group are Caucasians, and we are Asians? You honestly treated us differently because we kept seeing people behind us were seated. Second, after almost 3 hour wait, you give us the table for 4 people. We are group of 5. We seated - very uncomfortable and crowded. We saw the table behind us - which can fit 5 people, we politely asked the waitress - can we switch to that table? Because they are done. The waitress says that she has to ask the front. Shortly she came back and said to us that - that 5 people table need to give for group of more people. Excuse me? We saw 5 people just sitting there and they left. And you told us that table need to wait for more than 5 people? So the entire time we were sitting at 4 people table and we saw the table behind us - which can fit 5 people was empty the whole time. This is unacceptable and the worst dining experience. We never ever receive this service at New York ever! This is very disappointed.

Baby Friendly: 5 starsKid Friendly: 5 starsWe had lunch here last week on a weekday, and it was good.  The lunch special is a great deal!Pequod's isn't my favorite pizza, but it is a solid Chicago pizza (and that is saying something).  I wasn't impressed with the salad or garlic bread, so don't order those.  Get the deep dish pizza.  We had a deep dish spinach lunch special, and a large deep dish spinach and onion.  Both were great.The staff was really friendly and helpful.This place is very kid friendly.  We brought our baby in his car seat.  They have wooden high chairs for kids, and they flip them upside down to hold the baby car seat.  This is super helpful.  They were friendly to the baby.  There were other tables with young children, and they all seemed happy and well treated.  The place that make's Pequod's super family friendly?  The family bathroom!  We were seated upstairs, and the women's bathroom was small so I asked if there was a place to change the baby.  The server pointed me to the family bathroom and I was so impressed.  The family bathroom is big, has a sink in it's outer part and a stall with a koala care changing table in it.  So either parent (or both parents) could bring all of the kids in together!  That is fantastic!  Way to go Pequod's!Also, what kid doesn't like pizza?

I love this place. Im from Dallas and when I come to Chicago, Pequod's is a must eat place! It's hard to get in. Check the Blackhawks schedule before you come... if there is a game, there will be a longer wait! Also, don't ask to change the TV to another game unless perhaps it's Monday night football and then they may oblige. The food here is amazing! The pizzas take about 40 mind to make... in fact there is a sign that tells you that when you check in... but they are worth the wait!The waiters are super friendly! They have a great pretty decent beer list with a little bit of everything on it.

There's not much to say about this place that hasn't been said before. Everyone has their preferences and gripes about deep dish pizza.What I will say is that deep dish isn't something I can eat as often as thinner crust pizza. It's a special kind of thing, which is what I like about Pequod's. It's got that feeling of an old-style dine-in pizzeria that makes me feel like I'm a kid again, coming to a pizza joint with my friends after soccer practice or something. It's got TVs, goofy shit on the walls, but serves beer. It's like Chuck E. Cheese's out-of-work uncle who smokes Pall Malls and buys underage kids booze. That being said, these guys card so stay away y'all delinquents. To quote Melville, "It is not down on any map; true places never are."
It's all about the crust here! Best part of the pizza. They do a great job of sauce cheese and topping balance so you get enough in each bite. The wait is worth it.

Came to Chicago for the first time and was craving the city's famous deep dish pizza. While I heard many different recommendations as to who was "the best" - Pequod's was definitely at the top. Trusting my fellow foodie friends, I ordered a small pepperoni, mushroom, and jalapeno pan pizza.HOLY MOLY was that pizza good. The caramelized crust is out of this world - I could slice off just the outsides of the pizza and eat it by itself. BUT enjoying the pizza bit my bit and getting to the crust at the end of each slice is just as good of a reward. Overall, a very solid, delicious (and filling) pizza.While I can't speak to the other "bests" out there, I'm not sure that I need to - this place was amazing and I highly recommend it.
Awesome Chicago pizza.  We stopped at Girodano's, and while good, didn't quite hit the spot.  Pequod's certainly did!

This is my favorite deep dish of all time! I would make it a priority if visiting Chicago. You can get a beer at the bar and order ahead when you're waiting for a table. Lou Malnati's is good but Pequod's is way more authentic. I'm vegetarian so I just get my pies piled with every single veggie they offer and the crust is good enough to hold them all.

I don't get the hype at all. Maybe my experience was uncharacteristic but this pizza had about an inch thick crust with barely any sauce or cheese. They were generous with the pepperoni, but honestly it was too dry and sad of a pie for that to save it.

By far my favorite pizza place. Every time I come here for work I always make time to stop by for the deep dish.  Get there as early as possible because it always fills up. Pequod's is also way better than any of the deep dish chains around town.  Zucchini slices are a great starter as well.

I'll start off by saying I'm a huge NY style pizza fan. I've had Lou's in Chicago and honestly I don't get the hype. I decided to try this one out my next time in Chicago because it seems as though it's more of a Sicilian pizza than deep dish. For starters the wait was an hour on a Thursday night, which is fine I don't complain about lines especially when the place is actually packed and all seats are being used. The pizza, something was great about it and something was lacking. While it comes out looking beautiful, it just didn't have A TON of flavor. But then I loved it because it was a good Sicilian pizza. I'm not sure, tbh I really couldn't put my finger on whether or not I loved it or it was decent. I think next time I visit I'll go again during a time it's not as busy.
Had to come here as I'm visiting from Calif. Best deep dish pizza ever, crispy crust and heavy on the toppings. So glad I paid them a visit, delish!

Pequod's is what visitors and tourists think of when they hear Chicago Style pizza! These guys do an incredible job, have an amazing lunch deal an deliver top notch pizza at every visit. It's tough to say which Chicago Style Pizza is the best in town... but Pequod's competes for that title every time we visit.A "must have" in Chicago!!
Best pizza in Chicago. Hands down! SThe sauce to cheese ratio is right where is should be.
Lou Malnotti's who? You want great pizza, this is where to go! I did take out, so I don't have anything to say about the service or location, but ordering take away was super easy and such a delight!
Awesome pizza. Worth the wait and you will wait. Even with a reservation. Recommendation: bar seat. Great service and no wait! I mean, you still wait 45 min for your deep dish, but that's a given!

I went to this place on a recommendation knowing how good deep dish pizza is in Chicago, we had to try it. It was a great experience, however, we tried the traditional deep dish pizza and some appetizers. The pizza was very good, but our wings came out cold and soggy. We sent them back and they apologized and gave us new ones. They didn't comp us, and the wings came out 20 minutes after we sent them back, so by the time we got them back, the pizza was coming out too so it was annoying. The food still tasted great, just disappointed on how it all went!
My favorite pizza in Chicago. The cheese lined crust is what sets it apart. Homemade toppings make for an incredible slice.

If I was a huge fan of Chicago style pizza, this would be my favorite.  I prefer a thin crust but for years have heard people rave about Pequod's.  It's good, really good.  The crust is so crispy, they put the perfect amount of sauce on too.  We went on a Saturday and surprisingly were seated within 10 minutes of our arrival.  Our server was really pleasant as well.
Dear Pequod's, I love you. Sausage and giardiniera pizza every time. And they have ginger ale fountain soda. Magical place.

I couldn't give Pequod's less than 5 stars. I've been here on multiple accounts and received nothing but great service and quality food (BIG PORTIONS). I love deep dish and I love cheese pulls. Each slice of these pies are solid cheese pull slices. I think what makes their deep dish different (and my favorite part about the pizza personally) is the burnt cheese crust. It's a surprisingly amazing taste and unfortunately something I'm craving most days. Don't be turned off by the "burnt" description because it couldn't be done any other way. The deep dish is delish! 5 STARS PEQUODS!! Side note: you will most likely be put on a wait. Don't give Pequod's 4 stars because you had to wait 45 mins-Hour to be sat down. This place is televised and is truly a Chicago gem. Tourist and locals flock here. Worth the wait so just keep that in mind when writing your own review!

SoCal native just visiting the area.Had to try the famous Chicago deep dish!The crust is the best! Sauce was a little bland, and the basil was hardly noticeable. But overall the pizza was worth a try. Visited pretty early on a Saturday (1pm) and it wasn't packed. I think they had about 6 beers on tap. Noticed a Sculpin IPA-- little taste of my hometown San Diego, ha. Pretty good, stomach-filling pizza!

Never order delivery from these idiots.   They screwed up the order by putting jalapeño peppers on my pizza.  Then when I called the manager tried to give me a credit for a future  pizza and assume that I should just eat pizza with jalapeño peppers.  I explained these would make me sick.  He said they would send another pizza in an hour.  It has been 90 minutes and no second pizza.  They do not answer my calls.  Note that drivers have no change.  Another reason not to do business with this disreputable company.  I've eaten in the restaurant several times and the pizza is great.  When it's busy they fail at customer service.  To be fair, a manager contacted me Video yelp to try to straighten this message out. However his efforts were pathetic. He stated that he wanted to resolve the issue but stood with his manager who banned me.  Then invited me to return. When I pointed out that I did not want to go in there and then be asked to leave, he did not continue the conversation.  While I understand that yelling and using profanity is no way to resolve a situation, they seem to think nk that people should just quietly take being ignored and mistreated when they make mistakes.  I did not get angry until my second or third call three hours after the ordeal began.  Their system has no way of tracking mistakes and service recovery efforts. So I stand by my original advice to not order delivery from them.

We enjoyed the pizza here.  The downfall is it is overly crowded, our table was right in the middle of the restaurant.  The staff was slow and obviously overwhelmed.  The food was good I would stick to carry out for this pizza place

Visited here for the first time with my daughter lastnight for a half order of bbq wings (I'd get a full order next time), medium thin crust sausage and pepperoni pizza, and a Miller Lite. It's a no frills place with great service. Although it was almost 11pm, the atmosphere was great for families and couples alike. The pizza was delicious! I'll definitely return if I'm in the area!

Best. Pizza. In. The. City. **When creating your personalized pizza's, I recommend less toppings and let the delicious crust, sauce cheese combo perform the way it should. The more 'watery' veggie toppings you add to the pizza doesn't taste as good.

This is the place where we take all of out of town guests, and every single person loves it and hasn't been disappointed. Great take out, and the pizza is unbelievable. Be prepared to wait, it's well worth it!

After see Pequod's featured on the Food Network as one of the best pizza places, we had to stop by on our visit to Chicago. We came here for lunch and enjoyed a deep-dish. I liked that they use a cast iron pan for the pizza.
Damn good pizza, I'll be coming here for life.

It was okay. I'm a Chicago native and their restaurant was an average sports-related jock place with fairly good pizza. I wasn't super impressed the way some people are. But some people are also garbage. I must stress that I did not DISLIKE this place, but it also was not interesting or wildly unique. It brings the Southwest side -- where I grew up (by Midway) --to the Northside, which is why I posit that people up here love it and think it's amazing. Whereas it's just the same stuff I grew up with.

We came here at 11pm right after we landed at O'Hare. It was a great treat to have our first meal in Chicago be what it's most famous for, the deep dish pizza! And I have to say that Pequods didn't disappoint. We ordered a small deep dish to share, which was huge! It was enough for both of us to have again for breakfast one morning. The pizza came out very fresh and hot, and you definitely know it was made to order since it takes 45 min to wait for it! The wait was a little long but worth it. I would definitely recommend to come here!

I grew up in the Chicago area, so Pequod's has had a special place in my heart for a long time, and I've gladly eaten it like 6 times in the past few months. However, last night was the last time I'll be there. My group of 5 arrived and was told there'd be a 30-45 minute wait, so we eventually took our buzzer and went to the bar next door to wait. After a period of less than 5 minutes, in which no alcohol was consumed (because we'd barely even been seated), our buzzer went off and we took our seats at Pequod's. Some of my party members wanted beer to start off, and our whole table was refused alcohol service, eventually citing one of our friends as the reason after we pried for justification. As everybody there had years of restaurant experience we understand the rules and procedures. The problem is that the basis for their claim that we were over-served was our friend's speech and movement, which is actually her regular speech and movement and is related to physical trauma from months ago. After explaining this to management, they stuck to their decision and offered no acknowledgement that this may be offensive or discriminatory. Our friend was saddled with the guilt of being the reason we all left the restaurant in anger. This could have, and should have been handled with much more tact. It is situations like this that often get hospitality businesses into legal trouble, and Pequod's management needs an attitude fix to avoid this in the future. It's a real shame we all grew up loving this place, but now there's a stain on our memory of it. The manager we dealt with gave us the name Joel.
Best deep dish I've had thus far. CanNOT beat the lunch special! Would definitely recommend.

A place that gives Lou a run for their money. I love Chicago deep dish and Pequod's style of crust is awesome. We got in quickly, which was awesome... and the service was A+. Will definitely go back, but with only one location in Chicago... I will likely have to pass a Lou to get there. Go here and give it a go. You will not be disappointed.

Been here twice now and can say it's officially my favorite deep dish (or pan is what they call it or stuffed etc... the crazy excessive fat delicious chicago style pizza!). To me it comes down to the crust. It light, buttery and crumbly with the caramelized crust. Our favorite topping is with sausage and giardiniera Mmmmmmmmm.First time came on a Saturday night, it's a nightmare, 2 hour wait then 45min wait for pizza once you order. Went today Sunday lunch at 1pm, walked right in, no wait for a table. So I'd recommend lunch time for sure to not have the wait dampen the experience!

I understand taste and preference is an individual experience, but I have had better pizza.  I prefer Due and that type of crust.Don't get me wrong, the pizza was good, it's the management that is a problem.  My assistant booked a reservation for me and a few clients - one just in from Scotland that very day.  We arrived 20 minutes early.  We were told we would probably not be seated for more than an hour.  When we pressed that we had a reservation, we were told that we were put on a list, but the seating time is not guaranteed.  I assure you, this was not communicated when the "reservation" was made.  An hour later, we were still seated outside, waiting.  My assistant called and asked to speak to the manager (I didn't force her or anything, she was upset with the whole situation - I had also talked to the management myself).  The manager told her we were not there. She had to describe what we were wearing.  Now, the manager had already been outside, called our party's name and we replied accordingly.  He walked back inside.  So, he knew we were there, told my assistant we weren't and it was officially an issue.  Twenty minutes later, the manager came out, said he was sorry for the confusion, assigned blame to my assistant and we were seated.  Unless you have all day to wait or just don't mind, Pequod's has tasty pizza.   Personally, the management's ruined the experience and we won't be back.

If ya like Deep Dish this is the place...I'm a NY Thin Crust guy but when in Rome right..there's lots of choices for deep in Chi-town and I have sampled a handful this is tops only because of the crust, the outer is a glazed burnt cheese wonder...little chewy but its thick crust so go and be hungry

Dined here a few times. Waited way to long to be seated, just to fine out there were plenty of seats that seemed to be available on the 1st and 2nd floor. The food isn't great. Pizza isn't great. The first time I dined here the vegetables taste like they were canned, and the pizza tasted a little odd. I gave them the benefit of the doubt and went again. The poppers taste like they were bought from a frozen pack as well as the marinara. The pizza didn't taste any better this time. Since my boyfriend likes their pizza we ordered again for pickup, this time the pizza was much better and I enjoyed it. No veggies this time around, perhaps that's why. Chicago has much better pizza options but I guess this place is worth trying.

If I ever crave deep dish, this is my go to spot. When I have out of town visitors, I recommend this place over anything else. The pizza is delicious, thick and I dare say JUICY (with cheese). The absolute best part is the crust. It's hard and chewy and delicious. It's so good a lactose intolerant person like me thinks it's worth the pain to come once I'm done. Typically I order sausage for my toppings, but I've also had giardiniera (yum) and green pepper mixed in. It's hard to go wrong. One or two slices are filling, so this place is great for groups OR for someone that's extremely hungry. Speaking of groups, there is an upstairs space for seating if you have larger parties. I've also tried their meatball sandwich, tasty, but I wouldn't make a trip out here for that. The only con is that the wait times are so very long, so this isn't a spot I come to without planning for a wait. Keep in mind, you also have to wait a while for the pizza since it takes a while to make it (like all deep dish). I recommend doing priority seating online, which isn't really a reservation, but it does help with the wait sometimes.

Order the deep dish To Go and the pizza was 95% all crust-very little cheese and sauce. It was good but due to the overwhelming amount of crust I would have to say this is my least favorite Chicago deep dish pizza. My first experience was dine in and we loved it so not sure if dine in vs pickup is the difference.  Are they skimping on the cheese and the sauce totally or only pickup?  The whole group was disappointed and especially me for suggesting.
Anytime i come to chicago Pequods is a must the best deep dish pizza in chicago dont waste your time going anywhere else
Voted best pizza so had to try and I agree....This is a must go place ... gotta go back again soon

Long wait, less than average burnt taste pizza, horrible slow staff. I was so excited to try but left in much disappointment. It started as a 20 minute wait that actually was 1.5 hours. Bartender was more interested in getting the single guys number over serving drinks. Then to wait another 50 minutes for bad burnt pizza. I won't be back.

I was prepared for a wait, so when I called for delivery and was quoted an hour and a half, I was cool with that. 2 1/2 hours and multiple phone calls later, our pizza arrived.And if the pizza was amazing, the wait would have been mostly forgiven. But it was not amazing. I'm sure the fact that it had been sloshing around in a warming bag in the delivery guy's car for an hour didn't help, but the pizza sucked. The bottom crust was super thick, super flavorless, and a mysterious combo of crumbly and mushy. The sauce and the sausage were good, but the rest of the toppings were generic, boring, and in the case of the garlic, still super raw. If you have to eat here, I'd recommend eating in the restaurant, but I've had significantly better pizza at a number of other Chicago places, so I'd give this one a miss.

Five star for sure!This pizza is amazing.  I find some deep dish style pizzas to be a little much - I'm more of a thin crust guy, but this really hit all the marks for me.  Toppings were plentiful and nicely toasted, crust was absolutely incredible and there was a good overall balance between sauce, cheese, and crust.I'd go out of my thin crust comfort zone for this any time.Service was good as pizza places goes, no complaints there whatsoever.  Will definitely be back!

Chicago has so many options for deep dish or pan pizza, but that caramelized cheese crust sets Pequod's apart from everywhere else. I usually like to save my crust for last to dip into whatever fallen toppings are on the plate, but that crust is just too good to wait. Eating at Pequod's means that you may wait for 45+ minutes for a table, but fresh in the restaurant is the best way to eat it. I've ordered it for pick and delivery and while it's good, it doesn't stand to the excellence of dining in. Their sauce is so well seasoned, the crust is crispy and they have fun toppings to choose from (pineapple, variety of olives... what can I say, I'm easy to please) and it even tastes good reheated. Waiting to dine in or delivery can be a little tedious, but once you're eating that pizza it's easy to forgive and forget.  Pequod's is a vessel filled with crispy, cheesey, gooey, oily goodness and my mouth is Moby Dick and I'm gonna destroy and consume everyone and everything on board.

Delivery Review Only! I had a pretty bad experience with Pequod's recently. They delivered the wrong pizza (it was the delivery guy's fault, my name wasn't even on the receipt), I rang them up and they said they'd replace it with the right one. Great, right? The next delivery guy shows up and demanded a $3 delivery fee?!?!? I'm like, dude I already paid that fee for the first pizza and you guys messed it up. He wasn't having it so I told him to take the delivery fee from the other driver who messed up. At the very least, Pequod's could have handled this...I don't know if it's because I was upset, but as I started in on the new pizza I realized it's pretty much just bread...you don't even really get the carmelized crust with delivery.I think it's better at the restaurant because they serve it in the pans and the bread it warmer, but I will never order delivery again and I may take a long term pass on the restaurant due to the bothersome interaction.

Stellar deep dish and different than the typical giordanos, Gino's, and Lou's. The crust here is different, and the sausage is made in house apparently. These differentiating factors make the pizza here unbelievably tasty and heavy! Great with a refreshing beer to wash it down. I also like starting with a salad, and their house salad is a great starter to the meal. Even super crowded on a Monday afternoon, so that tells you something about their delicious pizza.I wasn't a big fan of the service though I have to admit. This is probably the only reason pequod's isn't a five star joint for me, but excellent pizza and vibes nonetheless!

When in... Chicago, you must try a deep dish pizza. It is my first go at a Chicago style pizza & my friend picked the best place that offers generous portions of toppings, cheese & red sauce. We kept our pie simple with 2 toppings: mushroom & sausage. A good decision because the pie with 1 inch of all it's goodness was rich in flavor & filling after one slice. I can also taste the fresh ingredients, which makes this pizza a standout as well.

Whenever you're home in sweet oldChicago, you gotta go 45 min out of whichever way you are coming from to get that goodness that is the caramelized crust that is Peaquods. I tell everyone about this place if they are visiting our fine city because it's that good.
Thought is place was ok compared to other deep dish. I prefer Giodarno's. Our pizza was a bit burnt. Other ppl really like this place though. Leftovers actually tasted better the next day.
Super long wait, but the deep dish is great. Probably my favorite in Chicago to be honest.

You've got to be kidding me. Fucking seriously. LOL this "pizza" is a joke.This place deserves negative one star. I hate writing bad reviews because these establishments have real people working to make a living. But I am appalled by the number of fake positive reviews and inflated rating.None of these people here who give good reviews of this place have probably ever had real good pizza. I don't get the raving great reviews and horribly regret going here. Of all the good places to go eat, we went here and had to go out of our way to get here, in hopes the pizza would be delicious. It took us a 30 minute drive from downtown to come to this rickety area. That is usually a good sign but not for this place.There was a very slim layer of cheese on the pizza. It was 90% bread, 9.99% sauce and maybe close to 1 % of actual cheese. It tasted more like a burnt garlic bread, minus the good flavor. I shouldve went to the grocery store and bought some Texas toast. Would've been worth it more than this atrocious round bread.Please take a look at my pictures of the pie we received. It looks nothing like a pizza. And tastes nothing like one.To make a long story short: the waitress was so dismissive and oblivious half the time. She forgot we needed to order ( you have one job) then tried to be abnormally fake, extra sweet to our toddler. So much so that even he said he didn't want to be there.The atmosphere was more like a pub or bar. It reeked of stale liquor and was dark, and cramped. Such a joke. Not to mention THE 40 MINUTES IT TOOK TO MAKE IT.40 minutes??? To burn some bread?? LOL. okay.You want pizza???? Real nice, thick, cheesy, goey, delicious pizza??? Go to colorado and try the pizza at Old Chicago.I guess the famous "chicago" pizza is only good by it's name, not by the actual location.

Good pizza, good prices, good service. I'm not wild about the burnt crust, but I know good deep dish when I have it, and this is good. There's definitely better deep dish out there, but Pequod's fulfills my constant deep dish craving.

Not sure about all of the rough reviews, because Pequod's was amazing! We ended up here late on a Saturday night after the Patriots game ended from Tripoli's tavern. It was our first night in Chicago so we were looking for a deep dish fix and thankfully Pequod's had late night hours to accommodate us. Service was top notch from the moment we stepped in until we left. Our waitress was friendly and peppy and explained the menu, jumping us right to the page with the deep dish (she knew) and explaining how many servings/pieces each size of pizza was (whether you would have leftovers or not). She also indicated the 'wait time' as some are calling it or how long it takes them to make you an amazing pizza. Geez, people. We opted for the small pan pizza with pepperoni, jalapeño and Italian sausage and an order of cheese bread with homemade, I repeat HOMEMADE marinara. The marinara was amazing and the bread was also pretty great and came out quick after our order was taken. The wait for the pizza was probably less than what was quoted to us.  The pizza--came served hot, oh so delicious and flavorful. We loved the burnt, crisp crust, a different spin on deep dish. The Italian sausages were ginormous and it was stacked with pepperoni (worth that extra charge per topping). I was only sad that I couldn't finish my pizza in one sitting. And, prices were so reasonable-our bill was under $30. We also had Gino's on this trip, and while a classic staple of Chicago, it didn't compare to the food quality received at Pequod's. I would love to try them again next time I am in town.

Looking for good deep dish? Pequods is the best hands down. The carmelized cheese crust is amazing. Its what I reccomend to all our out of town guests.  However, go during lunch and avoid the long wait for the dinner rush.

If you want Chicago style deep dish (not from a chain) GO TO PEQUOD'S! We went to a Cubs game and wanted to grab some pizza after while we were in town. We happened to be with someone from Chicago who told us about Pequod's...as we were planning on going to a different place. So happy we changed our mind and went to Pequod's. It was a Friday night so we knew we would have to wait...luckily our friend called ahead and put our names down for call ahead seating. We ended up only waiting about 10 minutes for our table of 4. We got a large pan pizza...half pepperoni half italian beef and hot giardiniera. I don't normally like thick crusted pizza, but this pie was amazing. I also have never had giardiniera before - and that was life changing!

Solid deep dish option. A little less thick than other varieties in the area but just as food. The charred crust is definitely the most note-worthy part of the pizza. The small is huge and sauce is delicious. The anchovies are good with salty goodness. The best part is they deliver pretty far. Pequod's is a great option for late night eats. But give yourself an hour and half for sure if delivery.

We had unfortunate car trouble that kept us from going back home to MKE, so we did an intensive search to find Chicago pizza on Christmas Day! We were happy to find that this very popular place was open so late at night. It was pretty late (maybe already 10pm), so we were only picking up, but inside it was surprisingly very busy!
