While it may not sound great it is because it makes the pepperoni always done perfectly! If you don't like it crunchy the pepperoni just underneath will suit you. I have tried other toppings and from the ground beef , mushrooms, peppers and sausage everything maintains it's flavor but yet doesn't over shadow the sauce that is great in its own right. Now the very edge of the pizza comes out burnt so don't be alarmed!! This is a must visit for anyone in the area! They usually have a 45min. Wait on the weekends so I am a fan over the personal pizza lunch special!!

I'm a New Yorker and swear by NYC pizza. NOTHING is better. However I will say Pequod is nothing to play with in the pizza game. I came here looking for the best deep dish. I didn't have time to experience all the deep disp spots so I looked at a few reviews and narrowed my search down to two places Lou Malnati's and Pequod. Don't waste your time, money and calories going anywhere else but Pequod for deep dish. 4 stars because it's not NYC pizza.
I don't even like deep dish or meat and I tried both and it was outstanding. This blows Lou's away, easily!

Look, you either love it or you think its nothing special. The ingredients are great. Sure, sometimes I wish it had a little more sauce, though I've got enough to go around ;) But what sets it apart from the rest is the crust. The caramelized crust makes eating it a delight. It might be the best part. At the other well known Deep Dish Pizza chains in Chicago, more often then not, people don't eat the crust, and that's just sad and wasteful. Shame on them for making dry, thick, no-fun crust. Stomach real-estate is scarce. Fill your core with good crust. "Pequod's .. it's crust-have pizza." - me

Each time i've been here, the quoted wait time has been longer than it actually has been to get a table. I really enjoyed the pizza. I would describe this pizza as more "bready" than some of the other pizza institutions around town, but it was quite good. The pizza is well assembled and if you were really bold you could even eat it with your hands because the sauce and toppings are not overflowing like other establishments. This is a solid pie, I would put it in its own league!

Best Chicago pizza! I'm in from Miami during hurricane Irma and I am coming to my pizza spot! This place never disappoints me! Start delivery to Bay Harbor Island, Florida! It's the crispy crust, the oozy cheese and the sweetness of the sauce and all the sausage, peppers and onions!

I feel like I need to give Pequod's another chance because so many people have said good things. My first try though wasn't that great. I got a thin crust delivered, so that could be why the crust wasn't crisp. The tomato sauce didn't have flavor and I thought the crust was too thick for a think crust. The bread was a little dense too. I didn't eat much of that. I will give it another try and go for the deep dish next time.

When I have friends come in from out of town they always want deep dish. Everyone will tell you to try this or that. Here's the thing. Pequod's is my favorite deep dish in the city. I don't usually eat deep dish, just because it is a lot to handle. But this is where I go when I do. The way they cook the pizza in the cast iron truly traps in the best flavoring. Just writing this is making me want to go back there again.
This is it. Real Chicago, not one of those tourist traps.If you don't want to wait 2 hr for done in call for pick up 1hr

Let's imagine you live 1500 miles away and you see this joint on TV and think 'that looks great, but I'll never be there'.  Then, just a week later you are in an Uber heading to this joint. What a treat this place was - the pie was just as it was on TV and maybe even a little better. It takes a while, but they tell you that up front and well worth the 40 minutes.  In that 40 minutes, we had a couple beers and a chicken wing appetizer. The wings were very well done with ample sauce. When the pizza arrived, I immediate regret ordering a medium for two people. It could feed 6. The browned cheese on the outside of the crust was the highlight. I coulda eaten just that. The place is great. Good atmosphere, only one moderately grumpy employee (who isn't at 10:30 on a Thursday night?), clean and great food. Eat here, you'll love it just like I did.

One of my favorite deep dish pizza spots in Chicago and I live above a Lou Malnoti's (ps I still love you Lou). Of you're from out of town this place is a must to complete your Chicago pizza experience. Bon appetite!

You definitely have to wait in order to get a table, esp.on weekends. We were 5 people and waited for 1.5h. They have a good selection of pizzas; generally, you choose all the ingredients and size. So we ordered medium size with all vegetables, and another with meat. Too much dough at the bottom in comparison with Giordano's pizza. I would rate their pizza 4/5, was not "wow" personally.

Was an unfortunate let down.  After multiple, glowing reviews I was excited to enjoy this apparent pizza institution.  To the point, ordered lunch size 7" pie with sausage and mushrooms.   After first bite, added the salt and pepper.  Once halfway through, likened the experience to a "biscuit pizza".  I don't get it.  Dough was dry, not enough cheese, had to create a good bite rather than the meal supply plenty of flavor.   Server was polite.  Counts for one of the above stars.   Next trip back, not likely to hit this place again on the way to O'Hare.

One of my favorite pizza places in Chicago. A little different with the burnt cheese crust but it's delicious. They always have a long wait if you go around lunch time or dinner time. I usually get the pepperoni with mushrooms or hot peppers. They do have some limited beer selections. I would recommend anything really on the menu. I also like my pizza well done which add a crisp taste to the crust.

I frequent the Webster regal theater and my friends love eating here before or after a movie. I tried this place twice. Once for the pizza and the second time I got a salad because I wasn't feeling the pizza at all. I hear everyone talk about how great it is but to me it's just 'alright'. I don't really think their is anything special about their pizza or the taste. If you're looking for a unique taste don't expect to find it here but if you just want pizza and beer at a reasonable price for the area... Then go here!
I only managed to eat one slice because it was so filling. The wait is long but well worth it.
I totally don't get the enthusiasm for this place. Give me Due's (downtown) with sausage and pepperoni over Pequod's version any time.
Pequod's is just the best. You know you're getting a quality pizza each time, and that you'll have to wait a long time to be seated. Favorite pan pizza in Chicago.

I'm a big fan of deep dish pizza and Pequod's is definitely one of my favorites. I'm used to the suburban location, which is a lot smaller, but this location was larger and much, much busier, which was expected. Went here on a Sunday night around 7:30p with a pretty large group (11 people).  There wasn't a problem getting seated, which was nice, but we were a bit crammed in a round booth table. The server was really nice and very patient as she took our drink orders right away as we waited for some of the others to get to the restaurant. There wasn't that big of a selection but they had a decent sized list. We ordered two orders of the appetizer platters which was just enough for our large group. I really liked the fried zuchinni, but wasn't that big of a fan of the jalepeno poppers. We ordered 2 large and 1 medium pan pizza. It took about maybe an hour to arrive but it was worth it!. We had one with Italian beef and giardenera, another with just sausage, and the last with mushroom and spinach. Everyone enjoyed all of them! The crust was crisp to perfection. Definitely enough for 10 people! There were some leftovers but not a lotFor first timers--I recommend ordering an appetizer since pizzas take a while to cook, and if you are ordering the deep dish pizzas, go no more than 2 toppings, as it might get a bit overwhelming.

Saw this spot on the news looked so tasty I drove up north to try it. Walking in to put my name on the wait list there was a sign that stated your wait time for pizza was 50 minutes after you order! Okay no big deal, I ordered wings, which were pretty darn good, to kill the time along with a pitcher of beer. An hour later I started to question the pizza wait time just as a  manager came over to explain that my pizza was accidentally given to another table, therefore my wait would be pushed back another 30 minutes!! It was already about 11pm I was so tired, but nevertheless we waited. The manager sent over a complimentary order of wings and took the pizza off of the bill. However, the pizza was the wrong order but we were not going to send it back after waiting 1.5 hours

I love, love, love their pizza here. I'm not a traditional Chicago style pizza person. This place gets packed on the weekends and during Blackhawks games so either be prepared to wait to eat in or order ahead of time to take out.Their pan style pizza (I recommend to order with extra sauce) is amazing. Haven't tried much else on their menu but it all looks good.

Pequod's was pretty busy around 7:30pm on a Sunday night. We had a party of 11 and we were seated right away which I think was pure luck lol because this place is always packed. We were able to sit in the corner booth by the fireplace which was a nice touch cause it was pretty cold on that side. We ordered 2 appetizer combos which had breaded mushrooms, fried zucchini, mozzarella sticks, and jalapeno poppers. I liked all the options and it was cooked perfectly. I would def order this again to have a taste of 4 appetizers. I also think it was around $10 for a platter which isn't bad. We got 3 pizzas. 1 large sausage pizza, 1 large veggie (mushroom and spinach), and 1 large half giardiniera and italian beef. There was a confusion when we ordered the last pizza because we wanted the full pizza to be italian beef but only half of it have giardiniera on top. All the pizzas were delicious and cooked great. It did take like 45-1 hour for the pizzas to come, but it was well worth it. I'm very loyal to Lou's, but Pequod's is pretty up there. If you're visiting Chicago, you should def check this place out.

So delicious! We came here for lunch on a Sunday around 2pm. There was no wait for a table for three of us. Or server was friendly. We ordered a thin crust and deep dish. They brought out the thin that was done just a few minutes before the deep dish so we could get started enjoying it. We got sausage pepperoni and both were very tasty!

Best Deep Dish Pizza in Chicago. That's my opinion, but you need to try this pizza before you disagree. Let me explain my stance:They get the ratio of ingredients right. Dough, there's a lot of it, but it's light and fluffy. It's the backbone of the pizza but it doesn't dominate. It's delicious and hot and bready, and it won't feel like cement in your stomach. The crust is still sturdy and crispy.Cheese, less cheese than the other deep dish slices, in the best way. You taste it, but you're not chomping through puddles of grease in a cheesy swamp. The burnt ends are a culinary treasure, chewy with sweet, intense flavor, makes the crust the best bite.Sauce, the best standalone sauce in the city. Sweet! You can taste the tomato. It's not too acidic. Thick and applied liberally. Toppings, so generous. If you order pepperoni (the best topping) you get a tight weave of pepperoni that covers the whole pie. There's no other pizza place that borderlines too much pepperoni, it's a wonderful problem to have. In summary, the construction of this pizza makes it the best in the city. It's okay to disagree with me, but not before you've tried it.Order in and out are both challenging experiences. There's usually a pretty heft wait if you're dining on the weekends. Navigating the crowded entrance way to pick up your takeout order is pretty frustrating. Whatever.

Delicious pizza, authentic and old school setting. The perfect experience for my first Chicago deep dish. Really enjoyed the pizza and ambiance here. Service was a bit slow, but to be expected as it was Saturday afternoon and the place was packed! Will definitely be back for another round of tasty pie.

This is easily one of the best pizza places in the country. I came here as a stop from business trip. I ordered the personal pan 10 inch pizza with sausage Canadian ham/baconAnd mushrooms. The crust of the pizza was probably one of the most unique features of food that I have ever tried. You could tell that a lot of thought and effort went behind perfecting the the sauce, don't get me started on the sauce. You could tell that it was authentic and homemade. The sausage was definitely something worth writing home about it looked like a quarter size the meatball but it tasted like a perfection  the textures of the meat to bread were excellent and blended very well with the homemade sauce of the Pizza. I think overall the most unique thing about the meal was the sauce and meats. I'm from Philly so take this with a grain of salt, the best cheesesteaks/Philadelphian food can be found at Hilton in Philly

If you are up by Wrigley, you need to stop in this pizza place! My favorite pizza in Chicago is Lou Malnati's but this is a very close second. We ordered a thin crust and a pan pizza and they were both awesome. The topping were free and the pizza had the perfect proportions of cheese, toppings and sauce. The service was excellent. We had a waitress that was training and she did a great job. As others have said, parking is difficult so we took an Uber.

I think this place is little overhyped.  I mean their pizza is good, but not 20-30 min wait worth it.  It's overcrowded on weekends and Game nights. Overall good place for a slice of pizza.  Won't recommend much. But if you around and have nothing much to do, try it.

This establishment made me feel like I was a local Chicagoan, especially after working up an appetite at Goose Island brewery right before!Their caramelized crust won me over & just had to put pepperoni, jalapeños & pineapple on it to seal the deal. I tried Lou Malnati's too & thought it was good, but I found that THIS is the Chicago pizza experience people talk about!

Had the classic deep dish with pepperoni and onions!  Ok the people I was with said the pizza was good. I guess I'm just not a deep dish fan.. :/   Enjoyed the atmosphere.. Pizza was good but nothing crazy and I AM ONLY saying this because the pizza isn't for me but everyone I was with who likes deep dish said pequods has one of the best deep dishes in the world

Best Chicago style pizza by a long shot (I will admit I am a fan of Giordano's as well, but this one takes the cake).  Great balance between topping,s cheese, and crust (which has caramelized cheese on it BTW!).  The only down side is it gets PACKED and is difficult to get into most times.....because it's so great.  I would definitely recommend ordering a pie to carry out if you don't want to deal with the hassle of waiting forever to get in.

I have been hearing people talk about this place forever, so I finally gave it a try at midnight one night. LOL. I placed an order for deliver (thin crust, sausage, mushrooms, garlic, and tomato). Starting with the positive....toppings are AMAZING!!! So fresh and delicious. Why 3 stars? Probably the worst crust I have ever tasted. It totally had no flavor and tasted like regular bread versus pizza dough. Also the delivery took almost 2 hours. I was told when ordering from Pequod's though you need to go deep dish, so maybe i'll try that next time.
The sauce was acidic and the dough was about what I could make and I don't bake. It wasn't bad, but I don't understand the line out the door that showed up five minutes after we did.
Best pizza in Chicago, hands down. Only complaint is the long wait. But so worth it. I love the burnt cheesy crust. Apps are good too:)

We came to try because we heard this is the spot for deep dish pizza!We arrived on Sat. Night and we were super hungry!!! We were told there was a 60-90 min wait to be seated plus once seated 45-50 wait for our pizza order. We were super sad and not in the mood to wait 2.5 hours for pizza, so we ordered it to go and took it back to our hotel. (This was a 50 min wait). The bar area is super small, so we couldn't get a seat. We decided to sit outside and wait for our pizza. We did meet some cool people while all of us were waiting for our pizza or to be seated. We ordered 1 pepperoni and 2 pepperoni and sausage pizzas. Yes, the crust is caramelized and yummy! The toppings yummy!! The only negative is that there is not enough cheese in the pizza. It tasted more like bread and toppings. We did try Gino's East for deep dish pizza the next night and that was more tasty. Toppings and cheesy! Yum yum. But if your looking for less of a cheesy taste, Pequods is your spot.

Went to the restaurant on a busy Sunday night but it only took about 20 minutes for a friend and I to get a table. Ordered an order wings, cheese garlic bread, and pepperoni/sausage small pan. The wings were pretty good to me. The waitress accidentally brought us the half order instead of the whole order. The garlic bread came much later and it was only ok. It was mostly cheese and bread, I didn't taste much garlic. The pizza was great! I'm not usually a fan of pan because it's too much crust but I didn't feel that way at Pequod's. The pizza was loaded with toppings. The edges were crispy and cheesy. And the crust was not too overpowering. Sauce was good too.

Excellent Chicago style deep dish pizza, with their uniquely delicious sauce and 'burned' cheese crust! Make sure to ask for extra sauce either on your pizza, or even on the side. Vegetarian and meat options are both fantastic. There's a bit of a wait usually, even in the middle of the afternoon, so be prepared, or call ahead and get your table bumped to the top of the qu when you arrive! And you can put your order in while you wait, they just won't put the pizza in the oven until you're seated.

This place was recommended as one of the top 3 pizza places in Chicago so we decided to give it a try. I've had pan pizza before and usually enjoy it. I wasn't a huge fan of this one. Nothing really wrong with it, ingredients tasted fresh, but I didn't like the crust. They are known for caramelizing their pizza crust and to me it just tasted a little burnt and toasty. This was a one and done for me. On the plus side, the service was excellent and quick, and prices were very affordable.
It's a fun place to get a local feel, the pan pizza is Houed and interesting, well done is the only way to go because is so thick anything less starts making pizza just ok to not good, fair prices

Love this pizza, one of my favorites in the city.  The wait is absolutely the worst thing about this place but they will usually take your pizza order while you're waiting for a table so it moves pretty quickly.  The lunch special used to be better but it's still pretty good.

Did someone say Chicago deep dish pizza? Obviously when visiting Chicago, you have to get pizza. SO my cousin and his friends took me here. We were able to get in right away. I heard it can get very busy. We started off with a salad because we were pretty hungry and knew it would a little bit for the pizza to cook. We got a deep dish pizza with olives, green peppers, pepperoni and I don't even remember what else. All I know is that it was amazing!Seriously one of the best slices of pizza I have had. So good. I wish I could go back now! Pizza is my jam and I wasn't disappointed.

First deep dish pie in Chitown. A line outside the door, but I was only one person, so got to quickly get a seat at the bar on a Saturday afternoon.Ordered the Cheesy Garlic Bread appetizer to start ($4ish) since the pizza takes forever to get in. Two large cylindrical slices of bread topped with gooey melted cheese and a strong taste of garlic. Probably not the best idea to order before trying to down an entire deep dish. Main course was a 10" with mushrooms ($13ish). Gobs of marinara sauce soaking thick bready goodness. Very filling pizza though I did not like the chewy burnt crust along the edges (marinara didn't help there). Could barely move after all said and done.Service here is friendly despite the hangry crowds. Great pizza though wouldn't wait forever for it.
Pequods's you broke my heart on Saturday.  What has fame done for you?  I waited 2 hours for my pickup order and the sausage was thrown on as an after thought.

DO NOT COME HERE. Yelp usually doesn't let me down, so I'm really sad that it has this time. These reviews are completely inaccurate. We waited 45 minutes just to be seated and another hour for our deep dish pizza to come out. I had Giordano's last time I came to Chicago and wanted to share this amazing experience with my boyfriend. Instead we were presented with a thin burnt crust on our deep dish and a ridiculously long wait. Was not worth it at all.

I really want to give this place 5 stars because so many people say it is the best pizza in the city.  We tried this place twice and got thin crust as well as pan and it was just "meh".  I really don't see what the big deal is about this place but I live down the street and it is always packed with people outside.  Now, i am not saying this place is bad at all, I guess it just didn't hit my taste buds correctly.  But...... Living in the city as long as I have, I will tell you whenever anyone is asked about their favorite pizza in the city, they always say Pequod's.  So I will definitely give you props for that!!!!

I'm only giving two stars for the staff.  I'm stunned people so young can handle so much chaos.  Other then that the sausage and pepperoni used was good but the rest of the pizza is basically an hour and a half for Pizza Hut. Is this the best Chicago has to offer?  Sad.
Ridiculously long wait. I was told it would be an hour wait and after 2.5 hours I still wasn't seated. Chicago has plenty of pizza places that make this a waste of your time.

Very good pizza in a very tight space. We ate there in the wintertime, a group of about eight of us. We were seated when the whole party arrived. Since it was cold out, most people waiting were inside. Our tables were next to the door so it was cold due to the door being opened constantly, and people waiting to be seated were standing close enough to bump me while I ate. Not the most pleasant dining experience. 5 stars if they organized space better so diners could be more comfortable.

I've only tried deep dish pizza twice (NorCal and LA) prior to Pequods. I normally prefer thin crust pizza, but Pequods definitely had me thinking twice! The restaurant looks small but tucked on the side is a staircase for additional seating upstairs. We came at an off time (around 3:30pm) and were seated immediately. By around 5pm, the place was completely packed with a wait to be seated. Appetizer Combo ($9.95): Deep fried zucchini, jalapeno poppers, mozzarella sticks, and mushrooms! 2 sauces accompany the plate of deep fried goodness: ranch and the most perfect cocktail sauce. I enjoyed all but the jalapeno poppers which had a tad too much cheese. Perfect appetizer to share.Medium Pan Pizza ($15.50): Toppings range from $1.45-$3.50 each for add on. We added sausage & pepperoni to our beautiful 6 slice deep dish pizza. I absolutely LOVE crust on a pizza and Pequods delivered. Crispy cheese crust on the edges and perfectly cooked crust on the bottom of the pizza. CRUST HEAVEN. I can't stop thinking about it.Pequods is out of the city for those who visit Chicago but it's worth the trip.

I have no idea why this place is always crowded and there is frequently a line to get in.  It's crowded, and noisy, and questionably clean.   The pizza's OK, but there is much better pizza in Chicago at Giordano's or Lou Malnati's.   Nicer places too.
It was just ok. Ambience is great but the pizza leaves a lot to be desired ... and I LOVE pizza!

I wish I did not have to fly form California for the most delicious treat of my life. The pizza was recommended by a local. The two of us ate enough for 3 because we knew we could not come back and it was so good.

I recently had dinner here with a group of 10 people, ages ranging from mid-30s to late 40s.  We had attended the Cubs game earlier in the day and decided to have pizza for dinner.  I have been to this pizzeria previously.  The pizza is always outstanding, but the service is average at best.  However, several individuals in the group were visiting from out-of-town and wanted to have dinner at Pequod's.  The service our group experienced was horrible.  We waited about an hour for our table, which wasn't unusual for a Saturday night.  We were seated and our waitress asked to take our drink orders.  For our group of 10, we ordered two pitchers of beer.  The waitress quickly informed us that based on instructions from the manager, we were "one and done" so we could at most order one pitcher of beer.  We were shocked by her response and asked her to explain.  She was incredibly rude and indicated that her manager concluded that we had attended the Cubs game and appeared to have consumed too much alcohol; therefore, the pizzeria made the decision to limit our group to one drink per person.  We asked to talk to someone else.  A second employee of the restaurant approached our table, looked at one of the members of our group, and stated "he entered the pizzeria and was slurring and had glassy eyes", so our alcohol consumption was being limited.  This employee's assessment was false.  The individual in our group who was being accused of this behavior asked clarifying questions, and the employee, appearing embarrassed, left to find the manager.  The manager came to our table and explained that he had asked his employees to monitor our group and determine if we were fit to have more than one drink.  He subsequently apologized and acknowledged that his staff had clearly misunderstood his instructions.  While I appreciate the manager's response, his staff's behavior to our group was offensive.  While our pizza was very good, I will not return to this restaurant.  There are too many good pizzerias in Chicago that treat their customers with respect. Absent the good food, I would have assigned a rating of one star instead of two.

Been for the lunch special many times and convinced this is the best pizza deal and my favorite pizza experience in Chicago. I'm not a fan of "Chicago Deep Dish" but I love Pequods deep dish with caramelized crust!!!
The lines can be insane, it's more chill at their Morton Grove location.It's the caramelized crust, that's what it is.
Great pizza, solid vibe and a good beer selection! Takes a little while for the deep dish to come out, but they warn you right when you walk in. Solid place to come watch a game
Delicious pan-style pizza with a butter crispy crust. Lunch special is amazing for a pizza and a drink for cheap!

A Chicago staple for sure! Pizza is always delicious and hot, service is always great too! They also have a nice little bar with a good variety of beers on tap. Usually a long wait to dine in or carry out so don't wait till you're hangry.
Chicago's best pizza. Worth the wait, if you don't want to wait go early or carry out.
Nothing I can say that hasn't been said already. The crust is amazing. Great sausage, lots of cheese. Definitely an occasional treat.

If you're going to get deep dish in Chicago, you go to Pequod's. Sure, it's not in a tourist trap like Mag Mile or Navy Pier, but I think you should ask yourself at what lengths will to go to in order to obtain premium pizza. If your answer is a couple blocks. There's no hope for you. Just kidding, you'll be fine, but you're missing out. Grab an Uber, take the bus, idc just go to Pequod's.

My boyfriend and I were in town for spring break and came here for dinner on a Sunday night after seeing a movie. It was a little past 6pm and there was already a good crowd outdoors waiting to be seated. Thankfully as a party of two, we were seated immediately. I had read about Pequod's on a list of top spots for Chicago pizza, but eating here was completely unplanned, which made it all the better.We ordered a small pepperoni and sausage pizza with cheesy garlic bread as an appetizer. We didn't expect the garlic bread to literally be two slices of bread with cheese and garlic on top. We could have done without it, but since it takes an hour for the pizza to be made, it was nice to have something to chew on.My recommendation is to come hungry! A small pizza is more than enough for two in my opinion. The crust was super crispy and the sauce was sweeter than expected but still really great. They were very generous with the toppings. We ate half and took the other half to go and honestly we loved it even more the next morning after heating it up.

Dont understand what all the hype is about. Waited over an hour for a table. They had one poor girl working the host stand, not enough. When we finally got sat our table was in the middle of a loud room on the second floor with uncomfortable chairs. The salad came out before the beer without utensils. The pizza took ages. The crust was burnt, or as they say "caramelized," but the rest of the pizza was decent. Our server seemed too busy to take care of us. Of all the places to get deep dish in Chicago wont be returning to this one.

I have ordered pick up twice from this restaurant. Both times the pizza is cold and the pick-up time was 1.5 hours. It seems they need help determining pick-up time vs. serving fresh food. I will not be back.

Hello, FOOD SNOB here.I would have given this place another star but they really need to have a better air conditioning system. Especially when it is 90 degrees outside. It is very uncomfortable when your sweating and eating hot pizza. The pizza was good but I wish I could have enjoyed it more. I especially loved the CARAMELIZED Crust. Great environment. Great service.There was a show on one of the cable stations rating this Pizza 2nd best in the country.I dont think its quite that good, but it is good.

BEST PIZZA EVER.I genuinely don't know what else to say about this place other than the three words posted about. For the first time, I am speechless about what I ate. I got the deep dish pizza. It looks burnt at first but they actually line the baking sheet with cheese and so it's just cooked cheese. It's delightful and brilliant. Beware, it is also so so filling.
Best Deep Dish in Chicago!!! Bit of a wait which is what you want to see at a place like this.  The pizza was out of this world and reasonably priced

Best deep dish in Chicago, hands down.The wait is a little crazy (especially coupled with the fact that we didn't get to pre-order our pizza like we did at Lou Malnati's) and the space itself is a little too cozy for me (brushed elbows with more strangers than I cared to), but staff is friendly and the pizza is absolutely worth the wait.Everything about this pizza is life. From the crust to the sauce to the cheese to the toppings, everything balanced out perfectly. I found the sauce at Lou Malnati's to be a bit too acidic for my tastes, but that was not the case at Pequod's.Would 100% return for deep dish if I visit Chicago again.

One of the best deep dish pizzas in Chicago and it's worth the wait. It's usually about an hour or more wait but with good reason. Call ahead earlier in the day and get your name on the list. Once you check in you can wait it out over some great cocktails next door at the drinking bird. Cheers!

Great pizza! Had been hearing about it from other people so was curious to give it a try. I liked the option to add on so many different toppings - we were feeling particularly "adventurous" so we got anchovies on half of the pizza, and it was SO good. The deep dish here is definitely really yummy, although I must say that I'm not very good at telling similar foods part so I couldn't really tell you how it was different from Lou's. Maybe slightly less cheesier?? Idk. But regardless I would say it was definitely great!
Best pizza in Chicago.  When I have guests in from out of town, this is where we go for deep dish.  Eat here, you will be happy with your decision.
Love this place it's the "stuff" best deep dish ever!!!! Can't wait to get some again the la escarole is amazing as well. Call in an Day ahead of time!!!!!!

Disappointing Pequod's experience on Super Bowl Sunday.  My friend had a party, and ordered (through Door Dash) at noon for a 6:30pm delivery.  Now, I get that's it the Super Bowl, so they were likely busy, but they should've been prepared.  And that's why my friend ordered at noon.The door dash driver was there on time, and kept sending my friend updates that he was just sitting there waiting for them to give him the pizzas to deliver.  He finally arrived an hour after we were supposed to originally get them. Getting late pizzas wouldn't have been such an issue, but the order was completely wrong.  One was supposed to be a thin-crust half-Hawaiian, half-cheese, but instead it was cheese and pineapple on one side and cheese and ham on the other.  The deep-dish was supposed to be half sausage and half pepperoni, but the pizza instead had no meat and had green peppers on the whole thing.  The pizza tasted okay, not great, but the garlic bread we got wasn't good, either.Again, I get Super Bowl Sunday is a big day for pizza places, but this should not have been a surprise to them  Getting the pizza late AND having the order be completely wrong, especially for the price paid, is extremely disappointing.  I'm sure the experience in the restaurant is much different/better, but this was not a good experience.

Getting deep dish in Chicago was a no brainer for me during my first trip to the city. With so many choices and opinions, it was hard to choose which one to try. After some recommendations and online reviews, we decided to try Pequod's. I was pretty much sold when I heard 'caramelized cheese crust' (a specialty of theirs). For appetizers, my friends and I got the cheesy garlic bread which is super cheesy (!!) with the right amount of garlic and butter, it was a great way to trigger our appetite while waiting for the pizza. I've been warned by locals that the pizza at Pequod's is delicious but not the best representation of a Chicago-style 'deep dish' pizza, and I can see why. The crust is best described as a thick crust and the pizza itself was not the "so deep you'll get lost in the ooey gooey layers of melted cheese and toppings" kind of deep dish. Because of this, my boyfriend was not too impressed. I, on the other hand, thought it was pretty good and would have no problem returning (but maybe after trying other deep dish spots). What made this pizza truly stand out and worth trying is the caramelized cheese crust. The cheese added a nice texture and salty/cheesy flavor to the dish. Overall, the pizza is a solid 4 and the crust, 5 -- I mean, who doesn't love burnt cheese?

So this was a pretty good deep dish. I found it very annoying that they don't call their pizzas what they are- calling it a pan pizza when it's clearly not. Anyway, the crust is probably the best I've ever had, but the filling left much to be desired, nothing special, at all. However, overall it was an enjoyable deep dish pizza.
Their pizza is famous in Chicago! Burnt caramel crust and delicious sauce. Their lunch specials are amazing too!

OK. OK. So my first review was a bit grumpy. But C'mon, a 3 hour rolling delay for a table?For fathers day my very lovely family ordered a carry-out pizza from the Morton Grove location and brought it home.And it was (drumroll please)...fine. It was better than Giordano's or Uno or Gino's. But not better than Pizzano's or Lou Malnati's. Not enough cheese despite the wonderful burnt cheese around the edges, the crust was thick and really just bread, the sauce was OK. I'm glad I tried it.

We checked out this Chicago pizza place on our way home from road tripping to the west. We picked it because it had great reviews on none other then YELP.COM. my husband and I have been to Chicago a few other times ( mostly just flying into and out of O'HARE) so we have had other deep dish/ pan style pizza. Unfortunately this pizza was just ENNNN, nothing too special but it wasn't bad. The edges were crispy and blackened, melted cheese and slightly greasy pepperoni, the good kinda. Other pizzerias defiantly have better style pizza with lots of layers of cheese and mountains of toppings more like a pizza cake. Pequod's was 90% dough, layer of sauce and the traditional cheese and pep. Also it roughly took about 40 mins for the pizza to be fully completed, ( which was a really long time for to-go order placed on a Tuesday at roughly 2 pm --- I cant image how long you would have to wait if your going/ ordering at a busy time ) which is kinda of a long wait for 1 medium cheese and pep pie... I don't think we would come here again because basically it was just okay, nothing special, just an average pizza & an atrocious wait time..

Decent enough pizza, started off as a good experience but the night was eventually ruined by multiple rude staff members. I'm not the type to write reviews but was a little taken aback by this experience, do yourself a favor and get it to go.

As a native New Yorker eating New York pizza in New York and obviously being a New Yorker I want to say this pizza was good but I most certainly cannot. This pizza was absolutely the worst,(a solid 4/5 because I'm a New Yorker) my ego cannot concur enough with my taste buds.  Original Deep dish was a solid 4/5, thin crust was clearly also a 4/5. Beer selection was great. Ambiance was very fun, family friendly and casual.  I enjoyed the garden salad as my appetizer.The Staff were friendly and accommodating.  I bothered them a lot for multiple beer runs, pizza slices and a plethora of odd request like their phone numbers and if they wanted to go out on any dates to no avail which left them to clearly give them 4 stars.In all honesty this place was awesome.  Food environment and everything was on point. Hope you guys enjoy your meal here.Still not better than NY pizza though.

I don't know what it was but something about this place really fell flat for me.Maybe it was the fact that my coworkers talked it up so much? I don't know, but whatever the case, it just didn't live up to the expectations I had.I went on a Saturday night (it was very busy, so much that I could barely hear my friend while we waited to be seated) and found that the crowd consisted of your standard Depaul area crowd. The wait was much longer than anticipated (over an hour!) and when we finally were seated, service was a bit lackluster.We ordered a cheese pizza which boasted a caramelized crust, but when it arrived it just looked burnt. The taste wasn't that special either and I found myself wishing for some Giordano's. Sadly, I don't think this place is for me.

Chicago deep dish pizza.  My first bit of advice is... to listen to your server.  We ordered 2 of the large special pizzas (for 7 people) and salad.  Way too much food, so we had the next mornings breakfast!  Very good deep dish pizza.  The atmosphere was fun, with TV's tuned into local sports.  We lucked out with a little round table for our party with room for a high chair for #7.  It was perfect.  The last bit of advice is....you can pre-order a deep dish pizza.  I wish I had know this information.

You know how Pizza hut was actually just deep fried pizza, but no one wanted to face that fact, so we just built them next to K Marts and stopped going? Well this crust is cheesey, and fried and delicious. The pizza is good. Solid pizza. But you go for the crust. Its a whole thing.

The deep dish here does not disappoint! Three of us went for an early dinner on a weekday to avoid the crowd. We arrived around 4/4:15pm and did not wait for a table, but tables seemed to run out by 4:45/5pm with a line forming at the door. The pizza is worth it though. We also ordered the appetizer sampler, which was good because we were starving and deep dish pizza can take some time to make. Overall a good meal!
So good. Love the carmelized crust. Can be a long wait on weekends and very long wait with delivery, but well worth it!

Pequod's certainly provides a unique style of pizza to Chicago, with a funky vibe. I hear nothing but great things but every time I've gone I get mediocre service and a pool of cheese that sits in a dough bowl. ‍

My personal favorite deep dish pizza in the city! The pizza is delicious, and I normally don't love deep dish pizza. I love the crispy pepperoni as well.The only negative thing I will say is that we ordered a Caesar salad as an appetizer and it was literally a bed of lettuce with about 4-5 croutons and that was it, and it wasn't even the right kind of lettuce for a Caesar. The dressing wasn't mixed in either, so it was not at ALL worth it to get the salad. However, take it for what it's worth--their specialty is deep dish pizza and not salads.If you've ever heard of Pequod's before then you probably know this, but expect to wait a LONG time for your table--but it's definitely worth the wait!
I got the personal pan sausage, it was excellent.  Had the famous crust, good beer. Recommend this place for sure.

This is hands down the best pizza in Chicago! The deep dish is the best in town! Crispy crust, moist pizza. So good you'll wonder why you hadn't  come here sooner cause I know I do! Pizza does take a little more time to cook but you won't regret it!
Pequod's is one of the best pizzas in the city and a most visit for all of my out of town guests.
Got pizza for take out.I ordered deep dish pizza. It was good but I still find Lou Malnati's way better.I got half of my pie with Pesto and I really suggest you to do the same! It was super good!

***Pequod's Pizzeria is an okay deep dish pizza spot though I definitely prefer Lou Malnati's***Pequod's is a pizzeria and bar located just outside of Downtown Chicago. You will have to take a taxi or drive to get there. It feels like you are in a Chicago institution once you step inside with the patrons, the small business look and the Chicago sports décor throughout the room. It has less of the touristy and restaurant chain touches / trappings of the more well-known Chicago deep dish spots.What Pequod's most excels at is their crust. It is a true pan pizza and has an exceptional caramelized crust. This caramelized crust does not just deliver a great crispiness to the pizza crust, but it also delivers a really addictive flavor. Pequod's burnt crust has the kind of distinction that Pizza Hut hopes to achieve with their pan pizza crust but does not.The sauce and toppings are all fine, but the center of the pizza has a lot of soft bread / crust, which keeps the pizza from being one of the best in the city.Service was fairly quick and friendly.Prices are okay given that the portions are generous and the pizza is so filling.I am not a huge deep dish pizza fan though it was nice to try a more local deep dish pizza spot in Chicago. It did not change my mind about deep dish pizza, but if you are a fan of deep dish pizza and live in the area, Pequod's is worth a try.I am not sure what the parking situation is, but it looked like there was free street parking in the area.
Deep dish pizza at it's best. Been here many times and never disappointed. At busy times, there can be a wait, but it's always worth it.

My husband and I always stop here before or after a movie and it's delicious.The wait time is long but it's worth it.The staff has always been friendly, the food always good and we'll continue to go here.I'm more of a thin, cracker crust type of pizza lover but with that being said, this is the only place I'll eat a pan/deep dish pizza because the crust alone is pure perfection. It's a bit pricey but it's worth it.
The best deep dish in Chicago. The crust is the best part! I go hot peppers and pepperoni. It's worth the wait and a place you have to try.

Greatest Deep Dish Pizza in Chicago. Everyone else is tryin' to be Pequod's. The crust is incredible due to the pans they have been using for decades. There is no other crust like it with the caramelization and flavor. If there is a wait it's worth it, but there are also nights with no wait at all. Great in any season and any time of day!
There are numerous pizza styles and Pequod's has a cultish following for their crusts.  You should be one of them but all in all I like a little less bread.
The deep dish pizza was awesome! The location is a bit out of the downtown core but the pizza was well worth it! Huge portions and their butter crust was amazing
Classic yet unique. Pan pizza at the top of its game. You don't know Chicago Pizza if you haven't had Pequods.

Solid pizza experience. Pretty good Chicago deep dish pizza but not quite as good as Giordanos in my opinion. The sausage topping is great though. Medium easily serves 3 people (and that's if they have big appetites). Mozzarella sticks were extra cheesy, stringy, and crunch on the outside. There's an attempt to do a sports bar theme but it's not totally cohesive. The music choice is cliche radio hits but that's all negligible in my overall rating of the place.

Took them a while to have us seated, took them a while to get us a booth since we didn't want center seating, took them a while to serve us beer and starter (garlic bread with marinara sauce was amazingly different and tasty!) and took them a while to get us our pizza... Total wait time was about 40 minutes (blame it on Friday, eh?) Loved the deep dish veggie pizza (cheese with onion, tomato, spinach, black olives and jalapeño) we ordered. Small size is more than enough for two when you are super hungry! Moderate pricing for amount of food.

This is probably the best deep dish pizza you can find in Chicago. It is absolutely delicious down to the last bite! The line/wait is usually incredibly long, which is the main turn off, but despite that the prices are great and the pizza is even better! If you are in Chicago for a weekend, a month, or a year, you have to come here at least once (if you can limit it to just one time). And if the line is long, just hold out because it is so worth it.

It's a joke that the rating for Pequod's is only 4 stars right now. Pequod's is the best pizza in Chicago. If you are in town for a few days and want to say you had Chicago's best pizza - this is the one. Go here, get the pan pizza, have a slice or three, and temporarily forget about how disappointing the bean was.

Great pizza!!It's a tough call... But their pan pizza might be better than Giordano's stuffed pizza.Attached is pan pizza with black olives and ground beef.Their thin pizza was ok, not the best... Pizano's or Pat's pizza might be better.

Came here as the last spot during our weekend in Chicago. Rating is for the attitude from the host when we got there. We came at 3 pm on a random Tuesday with all our bags, clearly tourists, and were greeted with hostility because someone in our party was wearing a Yankees hat..completely unnecessary. I understand it's a sports bar with pride, but we didn't come during a big game, or during any game. There were maybe 6 other parties in the restaurant -- it was pretty obvious we were here as tourists just expecting genuine Chicago-style pizza. Instead, we got a load of BS and yet were still seated? Next time just don't bother seating us if you care about pride more than hospitality. Not worth it for me to even give a review on the food.
Great place for a pizza pie. A divey kind of place with dim lighting and ambiance for discerning pizza lovers. It's good for pizza night or date night.

Pequod's Pizzeria is the best place in all of Chicago to get incredible deep dish pizza. Even though we went when it was busy, we got our pizza in a very timely manner, and were overwhelmed by how good it was. We've tried different pizza all over Chicago, and all four of us who went agreed that Pequod's was the best, and that we'll be going back when we visit the city.
A delicious Chicago staple and must try place! Pequods never disappoints with its Chicago cheese pizza! The atmosphere really helps tie the whole experience together for a perfect night in Chicago!

We were told there was a wait and to go next door. We were given a pager n told it would be 45 min wait. After 5 min the pager goes off and we are seated. I Was in a car accident n taking the stairs slowly. The manager assumed i was drunk n wouldn't let any of us drink. Even though the place was filled with drunks and I had not been drinking. The manager was very rude raising his voice in front of other customers. I was so emberassed. This was my favorite pizza place

I'm a huge NY style/thin crust pizza person. I feel like you get so much more of the flavor that way. But, obviously, coming to Chicago, I had to give the authentic deep dish a try. Many recommended Pequod's as one of the best deep dish pizzas. We planned it out right by going in the late afternoon. We were able to get seated right away, but it still takes 45 minutes once you are seated to get the pizza. Imagine if you had to wait in line for 2 hours and then 45 minutes after getting seated? That's the norm for a place like this. We went with the regular cheese and added some green peppers. Didn't want to compromise the authentic cheesy taste too much by adding too much. The pizza was delicious and one medium was perfect for 3 people. Boy is it cheesy and bready. But, not too much bread as I was expecting. I liked how the crust was crisp, giving it more flavor and helping it stay together well. I think the crust was pretty memorable - they flavor it very well, and it's the perfect amount of crisp.. The cheesiness was exceptional, as you could see it as you pulled apart each piece, which you want with pizza, am i rite? Glad we were recommended this spot when visiting. Hope to be back soon!
Not a fan of deep dish or pan pizza but the pan pizza here is pretty good! The atmosphere here is laid back and chill, great place to grab a beer and a bite.

We tried a few of the top-rated deep-dish pizza places on our first trip to Chicago. Pequod's was our absolute favorite by far. The crust was perfect and just the right amount of crispy. The toppings were on top of the sauce and cooked to perfection. It was the perfect taste of deep-dish that was expected. I am normally a thin-crust, NY style pizza lover and this deep dish was top notch for me. Would recommend this pizzeria to anyone visiting Chicago!
Not much to say other than this just isn't my favorite pizza, which gets me death stares from friends and family. If you're not a fan of a super-bready crust, you might not like this pizza.

There are two floors! The first floor was super crowded when I walked in, but when we were seated on the second floor it wasn't as bad. We were seated quickly.  The waitress came quickly with waters and explained the menu to us. We ordered and the pizza came out in about 40 minutes! The toppings were great, but the crust on the other hand wasn't as impressive.  The crust seemed a bit overdone and was a tad too hard for me. Possibly was just a busy day and they rushed it or left it for too long. Would come back to try again!
Absolutely love pequods!!! It's a defendant authentic Chicago favorite!!! Less commercialized and among the best stuffed/deep dish pizzas!!

So everyone always says if you are ever in Chicago try a Chicago Deep Dish Pizza. On recommendations from a few friends people suggested to try out Pequod's Pizzeria. We hopped into a cab and came straight from our hotel which wasn't that far actually. While arriving here for dinner they told us it would take about 45 minutes and our name was on the list. So while waiting we just hanged outside since the place inside is literally super packed with all sorts of people. I was thinking of just getting a personal to share with me and my friend but on recommendations from the server she said we should get the 10 inch small size. The personal is a 7 inch pizza. Guess what we didn't even finish our pizza which always happens because one we don't eat a gang load and it was a total waste. I think personally when you tell a waitress that you aren't really hungry and want to just try something a personal would be fine. Especially since the crust is so thick and huge. It is like your eating a big piece of wet tomato bread. Hey I might be getting hated on for this but seriously I wasn't at all impressed, maybe it's because I like things on a smaller scale and that I feel a lot better if I do finish things!

Simply AMAZING! We tried a couple of the most popular deep dish pizzas in Chicago, but Pequode's was simply the best. You're not there for the pricey sit down dinner experience, you're there for tons of flavor!
I have had the thin crust pizza here several times and it is always my favorite. It is a pretty busy place so be prepared to wait!
Omgosh, can you say scrumptious!! Seriously, this deep dish pizza is to die for. Great service, good ambiance, and deliciously tasting pizza. You absolutely must try it. I can't wait to be back!
Super good! Not my favorite Chicago pizza but top 5 for sure! Always busy too which is a great sign.
Best deep dish I've ever had.  Been to a lot of different places but this is the best.  Simply amazing.

Please don't eat here - simply put, I would like to keep this place all to myself, making it my very own deep dish Mecca. Pequod serves, beyond a shadow of a doubt, the best deep dish pizza you'll ever eat. Their vegetarian pizza sets the standard for all veggie pizzas.Go early. Go often. Just don't ruin it for me...

Pequod's pizza is LIFE!! I feel barbarically super basic admitting that I once thought Giordannos had the best deep dish pizza (this in comparison to Due, Connie's, and Lou's). In terms of pan pizza, Pequods sets the bar high. All other pan pizza in comparison is ok at best. If you've gone and didn't order a pan pizza, well done, and dislike Pequods, GO BACK!! You need to order that!!... You're welcome! :)
IMHO Pequods is the Best deep dish in Chicago, hands down! Always a great spot to take a visitor.
best deep dish in Chicago hands down. Make sure to be seated downstairs. Upstairs is cheap and lack luster.

Took my team here for a social event and while the pizza was a unique spin on deep dish (they call it pan - with burnt edges), their service left much to be desired. They switched our waitress mid stream and after we got the new server, we struggled to get refills or even acknowledgement.
Best pizza I have ever eaten. The crunchy crust, tangy sauce, and gooey cheese were amazing. I wish it was in California.
Pizza was a 7 on a 10 scale, not worth a three hour wait. Would do delivery for sure though!

10 inch deep dish was the perfect size for two.Each bite was a chewy, doughy, dry mess! Not nearly enough cheese or sauce. But, hell, at the end of the day, pizza is pizza and I ate it all. Overhyped.

I really like Pequod's! One of my favorite Pizzas in Chicago! There is always a long wait, but you can go accross the street and hang out at Barne's and Noble until your table is ready. I personally like that.
Great Pizza... But only as a carry out.  The wait is just too long for my tastes.

I LOVE their pizza -- my husband and I agree that it is hands-down the best deep-dish pizza we've had in Chicago. They caramelize the crust and it is wonderful.The star down is for wait-time when it's busy. They're really great when it's an off time and they're not busy. Super friendly and helpful, but they need to do something about how they handle customers during the busy times. They don't take reservations, instead they have a priority seating list that puts you at the top of the wait list when you arrive. When I went with a large-ish group, they told me we'd have about a 45 minute wait. It took about 90 minutes, and we had something scheduled (and paid for and reserved) right afterwards, so it was super stressful trying to get dinner before we went to our event, and we weren't even really able to enjoy ourselves -- just ordered a couple of pizzas, had a beer, and had to take off. So, not the best place to go for dinner if you have somewhere else to be later, but still good food.Like I said, when they're not busy, the experience is great. They always have a game on and have great food. The service staff makes great recommendations for beer when asked and the atmosphere fits in well with a sports bar -- a little dark on the inside, but all the better to watch a game, eat pizza, and have a drink. If you come with a large group, be prepared to be a little squished. They don't have a ton of room and are quite busy during the dinner hour.
With its delicious caramelized crust, perfect sauce and cheese to topping ratio, Pequod's is hands down the best deep dish in the city. Pass the ranch.

You need to plan ahead if you want delivery. To my location it's 2 hours but well worth the wait. A thick airy crust topped with plenty of cheese and tasty sauce. I recommend the sausage and pepperoni.  I have had pizza from.many places and states but have never had pizza like this.

I have heard so many good things about Pequod's pizza from all of my friends, but I just don't think it's that good. I've had it 3 times now, and have never really enjoyed it. I usually don't write yelp reviews, but I felt it was necessary for this pizza. I ordered a half sausage with cheese and half spinach and mushroom with cheese deep dish pizza. If you like a deep dish pizza with 95 bread and no cheese or toppings, then this is where you want to order from. I don't know if they decide to not try on takeout orders, that's what I've heard, but this pizza was so bad, I needed to write a review. I felt ripped off. Please observe picture. I prefer uno's, due's, lou's, giordano's, and even dominos to pequods. Would probably never order myself again, but if my friends want to order pequods, I hope it will be better than this past pizza.

Chicago is well known for their deep dish pizza but you would for sure be missing out if you didn't try Pequod's pan pizza. I could eat it all day, every day. The dough is thick and the perfect mixture of soft and firm. The sauce is not too chunky with vegetables (onions and tomatoes) and this comes from someone who hates chunky sauce. The crispy edges of the pan pizza is so good! The garlic bread was also scrumptious, as were the mozzarella sticks. One of my favorite Lincoln Park treasures :)

I have eaten at Pequod's and have had it delivered.  Both are extremely delicious and the delivery enables one to not have to wait forever.  Their spinach/garlic pan is so delicious with the caramelized crust.  The last time it was delivered, the pizza seemed a bit doughy and I would have liked it to have more cheese/tomato sauce.  Perhaps it was a random occurrence since I don't remember Pequod's being super doughy like this before.  I have also tried their thin crust with basil and it is delicious.  I recommend Pequod's for both deep dish and thin crust.  All of their ingredients are well-done and they do not skimp on them.
In a city of pretenders trying to hang with the big dogs, Pequad's stands out. Great pizza and crust!

Being a Chicagoan, I've had my fair share of pizza and there is a reason why this pizza joint always has an hour long wait outside and two hour window of delivery...BECAUSE IT IS SIMPLY AMAZING.Their stuffed pepperoni pizza is the best tasting pizza ever. I don't know how they do it time after time but it's delicious and I'm addicted to it. The wait is WORTH IT. Also their pequods salad is a great addition to their pizza. They produce quality pizza and it's a pizza place you must try in Chicago.
great, fresh and hot pizza in morton grove.  YUMM

Im not from Chicago, but I travel there often and always make sure to try a new pizza place every time Im in town... Ill go ahead and say it, Pequod's is the best pizza I have ever had. Pequod's is #1 for me and Lou Malnati's is #2

I am probably saying something that is considered sacrilegious in Chicago, but, in our household's opinion, Pequod's pizza is totally overrated. Aside from having to wait on hold for more than 15 minutes to try to get it ordered for delivery, the pizza we picked up had absolutely no flavor whatsoever. The Italian sausage tasted like unseasoned ground beef and the tomato sauce had no flavor. Sorry for this, but this may the first pizza we have not finished and didn't want to save for leftovers.
Solid pizza, great crust, usually busy but understandable given the food. Favorite pizza in Chicago.

This place is overrated. The pizza wasn't the best, I've had better. But what was very disappointing was the terrible service we got from our server. She was not friendly at all and kept giving us an attitude for no reason. And the wait was extremely long.

Everyone has a different  idea  of  what is THE BEST. Best pizza,  best  burger,  etc.  I really like the pizza here because it's a little  different.  I like  ordering the personal  pan pizza's.  I like the way they are cooked  in those  old  skillets.  And  the toppings  are fresh and plentiful.   For me,  this place has the BEST  pizza.

I've tried giordano's and pequod's now and I can see why people like both. However, I think I might choose pequod's over giordano's because of the way the crust is made. I liked that the crust was crunchy and the pizza was soft. I created my own toppings when I went and got mushroom, onions, and sausage. Choosing the toppings I think can also make or break the pizza flavors. It seems like this place is always busy so know that there will be a wait. I didn't know this because it was my first time there. But you can call ahead to have your name written down, and once you get there, they will move your name up to the top. So you do still have to wait, but it won't be like an hour. Once you place your order of pizza, know that it will take about an hour to make the pizza. So it's probably a good idea to order appetizer if your starving. I ordered the jalapeño poppers which were fantastic! Recommended to us by our server. It was just me and my bf that was there so we ordered an appetizer and a size small for pizza. Size small has 4 slices but keep in mind that it's a chunky slice. I was able to only eat 1 slice because It's so much going on in just 1 slice.

I really wish i saved my picture from the times I've ate here, but clearly I was always toooooooooo hungry that I forget to take a picture. The food here is phenomenal, the pizza here is MY FAV PIZZA in Chicago. This spot is underrated, the food, the environment, everything is great! Love this place!
Best pizza in chicago. The place is a little small and might seem cramped for moments, but you can wait next door at their new bar while your pie ia cooking. Expect to wait in line for a while.

Pizza was pretty good but not enough for us to want to go back. We asked them for a romantic table and were put on the crowded second floor middle row tables which constantly have waiters and people going to the bathroom whizzing by. The entire time, a private boot (haha! I meant booth, but that's a great typo) sat empty next to us, but we were told it "wasn't available". Lastly, the dessert was expensive but *tiny*. I almost called over the waitress to say are you sure this is what a piece of cheesecake should look like" but judging by our table request, we didn't bother. So, busy, loud space, good pizza, expensive tiny dessert. Lots of our friends love it, so maybe it was just an off day.
The best thing about the pizza is the dough (a little overrated, Malnati's is still better in my book). Great hang out place, good location and good food/service.

Went to this place after Cubs game- here's my first impression as I walked in- DIRTY! Staff looked exhausted although it was end of night. Pizza wait was 40 minutes although person at bar said he had been waiting over an hour... not that many people in restaurant, maybe heavy carry out causing wait time? I had a Italian sausage, with sweet peppers. Ok this may possibly have been the worst Italian sausage I've ever had- it resembled beef jerky- the peppers, nearly raw- warmed up is how I would describe- bread was way to big not a sausage roll- friend had meatball sandwich, as I write this it's 7:30 am 8.5 hours later and he's puking- the meatball sandwich was ridiculous- it looked like they started making a pizza then realized it was a sandwich? I know this is a pizza place first but come on if you mess up a simple sandwich how good can the pizza be? I mean seriously. My guess this place is frequented by people right out of college that were eating Dominos pizza for the past 5 years in college. The older group probably ate there years ago wandered in and realized the pizza wasn't as good as they thought. My guess is that if any of you 4 star reviewers took a tour of that kitchen you'd drive straight to Cosco to buy a pallet of toilet paper cause you'll surely need it.. I agree that Lou's is way ahead of this place-oven grinder another good place as I remember although haven't been there in a while, might feel the same way- I like well lit restaurants that don't have a wad of gum sitting on bar when I sit down. Maybe I hit this place on a bad night- I doubt it though... The bartender was very nice, she gladly took our money with a big smile-
This pizza was just okay!!!  Maybe because it was lunch time!!  My friend and I got the personal pan lunch special.  The pizza need more cheese and more sauce
I had their lunch special once and it was pretty decent. A pizza joint has to be more than pretty decent in Chicago to go back for a second time.

My first Chicago deep dish, and I will never forget it.  It took us a while to walk to Pequods from the train station, so cue happy sounds of satisfaction when sitting down at one of the high round tables near the center of the room.  I was a little surprised by the bar like atmosphere, but it was fun to watch sports as well as a pizza tour group that arrived later.  After debating about the toppings and the size with some advice thrown in by our friendly waitress, we ordered together.  The pizza arrived an hour later.If you know anything about the Chicago pizza scene, you'll know that there are many different camps that pizzas fall in.  Pequods specializes in a burnt crust variety, with a thick crust and much cheesey goodness.  Very delicious!  I also overestimated the size of my stomach and could only finish two slices, so I end up taking quite a bit home for later.
best pizza in Chicago. Order takeaway and take it to the bar across the street, Kibbitznest.

Called in for order..only gave my first name.. Kim.. it says Kim Nguyen on receipt. *kinda of racist..* came home and the pizza was not what I ordered. Called in to tell them and the host argued that my caller ID is showing Kim Nguyen.. the phone I'm using is not even the phone I used to call in for the order. This is crazy.... let's see if they actually gave me my refund.

An incredible authentic Chicago style pizza place.  The slices were incredible and the atmosphere was textbook pizza joint.  The wait staff could use a little hospitality, but the food more than made up for it.
Best deep dish, pan, Chicago style pizza! Wait is long usually, but they're always friendly.

OMG this place is the REAL OG! I've never had pizza as delicious as this, EVER. Run don't walk to Pequod's. I would literally fly back from Atlanta just to enjoy a pie from here.  Their deep dish pans are old and well seasoned, making the crust taste like absolute heaven.

If I could give this restaurant zero stars I would. My family and I came to the restaurant back in July because a lot of people we spoke to recommended Pequods over Giordano's and Lou Malnati's, let's just say they couldn't be more wrong. The experience from start to finish was one of the worst I've ever had at any restaurant. We waited over 3 hours for a table of 10. At first I didn't mind the wait because we were a large party but by the time it was 12am and we were still waiting it was kind of insane. When they finally called our table we were seated upstairs and while walking upstairs we noticed the entire restaurant was empty. I think maybe one or two parties were left but there were so many tables available i couldn't believe they took so long to seat us. By the time they seated us we put in our order right away and then waited another hour for the pizza, for 4 pies of pizza! At that point we had been waiting for 4 hours, 3 hours to sit then another hour to eat. It was 1230am and I decided to ask one of the waitresses why the pizza was taking so long, she looked up at me and said "don't you see I'm folding boxes, I'm busy, I can't help you." I understand she wasn't our waitress but it wouldn't have been so hard to say "sorry if you give me one second I'll grab your server and she can help you." Anyways, to top it all off, when our pizza finally did come it was the most mediocre of pizzas I've ever had. There was no cheese, the entire pizza was just dough, I wouldn't call it a deep dish or actually a pizza really.I wouldn't waste time coming to any of their locations. Lou Malnatis and Giordanos were far better in my opinion and there's no sassy waitress folding boxes there.
Not a fan. I like deep dish pizza, just not Pequod's crust. It is a biscuit like dough and very dry and crumbly in my opinion. Caramelized cheese was nice but not enough to compensate.

All time favorite pizza in the city and maybe even ever... it's amazing! The crust is doughy in the middle and crunchy on the bottom and the caramelized cheese on the edge is the best part. Also has a great cheese and sauce ratio. If you go before 5 you usually don't have to wait but go any later and it can be up to 2 hours BUT you can wait at the bar and get som pre pizza drinks.

Good place, really. Comfy room and great service. I can't find a single thing to complain about, but I have a hard time coming up with a big compliment either. The pizza was good, but not exciting. The charred edges of the crust were nice but the dough to toppings ratio here is a little bread heavy for my taste. I enjoyed it and have no complaints, but it's hard to come up with anything that impressed me overall. The people were nice, but not overwhelming. Bottom line, don't be afraid to visit this place. You'll enjoy it. It's a good spot with good people. You probably won't find yourself raving to your friends about it later though.

I've ordered at the restaurant and also have had delivery, both very similar in the quality of food! In my opinion, is superior than Lou Malnati's, Pizzeria Uno, Gina's or Giordano's. Consider delivery if you're in a time rush. From order being placed to pizza arriving to our apartment in Lakeview East - it only took about 1 hour 20 minutes, I was blown away!

I was really excited to try Pequod's after all the hype I've heard since moving back to the city.  Perhaps I'm old fashioned, perhaps I'm no longer hip, but I thought that other than the delicious burned cheese crust - the pizza was just average.  It's certainly not up to the level of many other less-trendy deep dish spots in the city.  I suppose to each his own, but I'm glad to have tried it on day there wasn't much of a wait - If I had waited an hour for pizza like this, I would have been very disappointed.

Wow! Don't go to the popular place everyone goes. Go get pizza at local places like this. I loved it! The Pizza sauce is wonderful.My husband pointed out to me how the pizza is made in Chicago.  Crust, Cheese, and then the sauce is on top of the cheese along with all the toppings.  WHAT A GREAT IDEA!!!  I wish everyone made pizza this way.The crust at this place was crispy and tasty, takes about 40 minutes to make the pizza so don't show up starving, but don't go eat before you come here because there is a lot of pizza to eat and enjoy.I didn't realize there was an upstairs till we were seated up there.  This place is much larger then I expected and perfectly placed in a wonderful community where you can walk around and enjoy the outside shopping areas around as you wait to be seated and enjoy wonderful food.
Great pizza if you enjoy Chicago deep dish. This is more of a pan pizza but the caramelized crust is what sets it apart from the rest.
This may actually be one of the best deep dish places in town. Their caramelized cheese crust really stands out and it stays true to Chicago style deep dish. Great lunch special deals as well.

While in Chicago, we were on the hunt for the best deep dish. We only had a chance to try two, so I can't compare Pequod's to all the other deep dishes of Chicago. With so many different places at our disposal, we went with Pequod's because of the solid reviews. Although it wasn't our favorite of the trip, we still thought it was good! The small (10") was more than enough food for two. It's cool that you can do half toppings here, we loaded it up with veggie toppings for me and meat for the meat eater. I couldn't really taste the cheesy crust, and to be honest prefer Lou Malnati's crust a bit more. We came at an obscure time and there was no wait. It's a bit of a trek, but it's worth checking out if you're like us and want to check out the best of Chicago.
There is always an argument about the best Chicago Pizza. Well, this is it. If you are a true Chicagoan you understand that Pequad's is where it's at!
Delightfilully Chicago. Crispy crust amazing cheese. Order extra sauce and don't bother dinning in. A+, best deep dish in the Chi.

Was recommended to this spot by a Chicago native so I had to try it out. I was told to "not have high expectations" for Chicago deep dish pizza but I was still looking forward to trying it out. We sat upstairs in a booth. Service was honestly... OK. It took a minute for our server to greet us and we weren't really checked on much, until we requested for the check. I really enjoyed the pizza though! Crispy crust and it was soft and hearty with toppings on the top -- I really liked it. Definitely the type of pizza to put you in a coma. I wanted to ask for extra sauce on the side because the pizza is quite bread-y but as I mentioned above, we did not receive much service.

Hands down, Pequod's is the best Chicago deep dish. Pequod's is always a staple of my Chicago trips. I always try to eat there at least once while I am in town. The first couple times I was in Chicago, I did the touristy thing and went to Giordano's, etc. I did not know about the Holy Grail of Chicago pizza yet. A friend of mine told me I was missing out and needed to stay away from the tourist trap pizza places and experience true Chicago pizza. I had high expectations for my first time when I went to Pequod's, and they definitely were met and exceeded! I was not disappointed. If you go on a weekend, you should expect a wait, unless you utilize the call ahead seating that they offer. The pizza does take some time to make, but it is expected. Their pizza is actually true deep dish pizza, with the perfect combination of dough, sauce, cheese, and toppings. (Instead of having loads of cheese and toppings filled with a thin layer of dough.) I can't even put in words how amazing the flavor is, especially with the caramelized cheese on the crust! That's probably one of my favorite parts!!! The atmosphere is great inside as well, especially to watch your favorite team. Lots of televisions and you will have a view of multiple screens from wherever you are seated. I was impressed with how reasonable the price was at Pequod's as well. If you haven't had Pequod's deep dish yet, you need to go try it ASAP. It will change your life and you will not want to eat any other Chicago deep dish ever again.

Got pick up from here last night. Not too bad but the thin crust was a little too doughy for my liking. The pizza had a unique flavor to it which was pretty good. The wings sauce was good but ruined by soggy wings. I wish people wouldnt leave wings submerged in a gallon of hot sauce. It takes a way the crispiness. otherwise this was not a bad first experience

Ok so this review is based on delivery. The pizza is amazing. My favorite pizza in the city. However, delivery is not what it uses to be. I initially called at 6:10pm today to place an order. I followed the prompts and was on hold listening to some awful music for 20 min. 20 minutes. Unreal. Then the music stops, and I get pushed to voicemail! The fact I even stayed on hold that long showcases how much I love this pizza. I call back and decide to choose the pick up prompt, which resulted in me speaking to someone right away. I advised what happened and instead of saying they will look into it, she said she could take my order herself. Had I known this I wouldn't have waited for 20 minutes.Now the fun part. I got my order taken, was told it would be here in about 1.5 hours (8:05pm). Pizza didn't come until 8:30. That is 2 hours of waiting. That's a bit ridiculous in my opinion. I'm not that far away, there was no rain, and traffic around 8pm isn't really heavy. I ended up calling the store asking if anything had happened because it's been 2 hours. The girl who answered said to call back in 10 minutes if the pizza didn't come. I mean, shouldn't this be addressed at that moment in time, regardless? What is 10 minutes after 2 hours of waiting?!?!? Customer service should have been better. I should have been given to a manager to discuss. Had I known I'd be eating at 8:30pm I would have ordered somewhere else, eaten by 730pm (at a normal hour).Pizza came lukewarm, not hot. Normally, I would say something, but I was so hungry from not having had anything to eat all day that I just said forget it. They won't do anything anyways- they didn't do anything when I told them I've been waiting over 2 hours and the pizza guy was 30 min late. For the price, I would have expected a little better customer service. I order pizza all the time and come in very frequently, so this experience makes me a little weary of ordering delivery from here. Maybe it's best to go sit at the store, and hope not to be stuck upstairs on the summer where it feels like 100 degrees!I want to emphasize that I called at 610 in order to beat the rush and be able to get my dinner by 730. Unfortunately, it's 9pm and I just finished. I'll report back if pequods reaches out. I'm not really holdingy breath though.

The best pizza in Chicago. The best location is in Morton Grove. If someone tells you Lou Malnatis is the best, than they are a fake and don't understand real pizza. The caramelized crust can't be beat, and you can't go wrong with any of the toppings. Make sure you call in advance because the pizza takes over an hour to cook, and don't worry about ordering too much the leftovers taste even better. Enjoy.

This is by far the best pan pizza in Chicago. I come here every time I have visitors. Every single person loves it. It's a good idea to come during the week for lunch for a shorter wait. Still worth the wait for dinner, however.

Pequod's defines what deep dish pizza should be. This is a must-do when our friends come in from out of town...and after we take them once, they request it every time they come back. The crust...THE CRUST!!! It's kind of burnt but not...look, I don't know what they do or how they do it but the crust is to die for!
