From the quality of the ingredients, to the cozy atmosphere and the great service...you really can't go wrong!

This is my favorite pizza joint hands down. You can't beat the price and it's right by the movie theater! The service from the servers is unbeatable. I always feel like family when I come. Thank you pequods!

The pizza is ok and the service was horrible. The wait for our pizza was almost two hours, so long that we had to order an appetizer after waiting 45 minutes because it was so long, I guess not a bad idea to get you to spend more money. The restaurant was not what I would consider clean, looked like it had not be renovated since it opened. Don't expect to much and you won't be disappointed, but this would not be on my top list of 5 pizza places to visit in Chicago!

If you're a fan of deep dish pizza this is a must! Line goes outside though on weekends. Mad busy! Definitely need a bigger location. Service is fair space itself is like any other old restaurant. Cheers

We came here on recommendation from friends that this was the best deep dish in the city. Better than Lou Malnati's or Giordano's. We ordered a pizza to go because the wait was over an hour and it's too crowded to wait inside and not a great waiting space. I was sorely disappointed by the deep dish and it was the worst deep dish I have had. The crust was really dry and there was a few dollops of cheese but mostly dry bread with sauce. I'm not sure if it was an off night since it seems like most people seem to like it, but definitely not what I expected. I would like to try it again to see if it was just a bad pie, but don't want to end up like last time. I will definitely update my review next time I try. I prefer Lou's and Giordano's at this point.

If you want local deep dish, this is your spot. Voted the best among everyone I know and the perfect place to bring out of town guests. We have friends who look forward to coming here every time they visit. Grab a drink because you will most likely have a wait. No gluten free options here but if you are with a big group, you can get one of their salads which are pretty solid.

I loved the pizza and wings we had at Pequod's. I was visiting in town with some friends and we felt very welcome and enjoyed the food and beer together. We had a great experience! I will say that their furniture is a little older so the atmosphere gets a 3/5 from me but overall the service and quality of the food was great! Happy with our experience!

Went here for Lunch. I was very excited to try the deep dish here as I had heard it was the best in Chicago. I've always been a Gino's East fan myself. Ordered ahead and used the text service to expedite our meal. The pizza came out within the time they said, however it was soggy and watery. The sauce was not seasoned at all and the pizza at all was flavorless. However, the one fantastic part of the pizza was the caramelized cheese crust which was delicious. Rest of the pizza was awful. Thankfully, the server spoke to the manager and they took the pizza off our bill. Unfortunately, both me and my companion got food poisoning from the single slices we ate. I will try Pequods again as I'm hoping it was just our bad luck that our pizza was terrible.

For 15 years I have gotten great takeout pizza from Pequods. Last night my wife and I chose to actually eat in at the restaurant. It was not at all crowded (that is unusual) but a large sign at the greeter's table warned of a 40 minute wait (at least) if you dared order pizza -deep dish or thin crust.  The greeter did say we could get slices in ten minutes. Slices came in about 20 minutes burned up and singed. 1/2 order of spaghetti ordered with cheese came quickly with a mountain of cheese burying a tiny bit of spaghetti and a small single meatball (for $2.95 additional). Unrecognizable as a small spaghetti dinner. One of the worst  restaurant meals I've  ever had!We'll go back to ordering take out pizza from Pequods.

I went on Sunday with some friends and the waiting was wait too long. We asked our pan pizza to go because we though that it would take less time that if we wait for a table at the restaurant. But it wasn't like that. They told us that we had to wait for 1:15 hours, and we were waiting there for 2 hours. It was really frustrating because they were telling us that they were checking our order, but they were not doing it. Finally, one of the workers appeared 45 minutes later than our original waiting time with our order and other 10 more orders. Our biggest surprise was that when we arrived home 5 minutes later and we ate the pizza it was not that good like if you eat it in the restaurant. The crust wasn't crunchy like it should be, and the pizza was kind of cold. We use to go to this restaurant a lot to eat the best pan pizza in Chicago, but now I don't know if we will come back.

When in Chicago, you gotta go get yourself a deep dish pizza.You can go for one of the chain restaurants, or you can try a local joint.The bf and i came here in the afternoon. No wait around 5/6 o'clock.What sets this place apart from the other pizza joints? The caramelize crust. God that crust was good.I would have to say, if you like a thick, hardy, toasty crust, tart tomato base, and lots of gooey cheese, then this is the place to go.THe bf and I ordered the small and it was SO MUCH FOOD. We ended up getting just mushroom, which was a good choice since it didn't end up too oily or overwhelming.i complete recommend this place and if you can, come for their lunch special. It's like $5 for a personal pizza!Score!

After trying many pizza joints during my Chicago visit, I really enjoyed Pequod's pan crust deep dish style with the rising dough. Also, their crust had a nice crisp, burnt looking cheese crust along the edges. This was definitely my favorite deep dish style and one of my favorite deep dish pizzas I have had!

After hearing so much about this place, I wouldn't really rank it that high on my list of favorite pizzas. We went around 11:15, and it wasn't too busy. The pizza was good, and the lunch special is an amazing deal, but it wasn't anything spectacular. The wait was around 45 minutes and pizza is super doughy and doesn't have much cheese, and I would have expected the "caramelized crust" that they are known for to be more than just the edges. The servers weren't the friendliest either, so it's not really somewhere I would choose to go back to. But it was an OK lunch.

This place is quintessential Chicago.   Wow.  I loved it so much.  The pizza was great "college" style... but for those of us with a bit of a honed taste.. probably a bit to much sauce.   Anyway.. .just my opinion, but.. overall.. excellent.  And great for a 1st date!

My boyfriend and I came to pequods the first night we arrived in Chicago.  It was our first time trying deep dish pizza so we were very excited and very hungry. We had high expectations for this place and for the deep dish pizza itself. Thankfully we sat down right away and didn't have to wait in line. We ordered our pizza and the waitress told us it would take about 45 minutes for the pizza to come out....  :( we were really hungry so we ordered some mozzarella sticks to munch on while we waited. Finally the pizza came out and we were ready to dig in. To be honest, my boyfriend and I were quite disappointed. Idk what we were expecting but it sure didn't meet up to it. It wasn't horrible but it just wasn't great. I ended up only eating one slice (only because I was hungry) and my boyfriend forcefully ate two slices. Maybe we will give it a try again next time

It is a nice cozy neighborhood Pizzeria.  I have lived in Chicago most of my life and can say that I have frequented many, many other establishments.   We ordered a thin pepperoni large pizza which was tasty.  It arrived in a timely manner.  The service was ok.  The staff is mainly female (at least from what I could see that day).  We sat at the bar because my out of town friend was starving and did not want to wait a minute longer.  I was surprised that on this particular night (weeknight) it was not busy at all.  The female staff seemed to be more interested in talking to my male friend which I found to be very disrespectful and unprofessional.  Luckily, this is a friend otherwise he would have been replaced very quickly if he was a significant other.  Like I said, the attention was toward him that I did not even or was asked if I wanted any water.  The bar area where we sat was dirty and sticky and no one bothered to even wipe it down.  It gave me a sick feeling so I barely touched or leaned up against it.  I took a few bites of the pizza which I said was tasty.  I guess my friend could tell that I was unhappy by the look on my face that decided to eat as fast as he could and leave the place.  If I were to order pizza from this place again I would definitely order it to go.  Parking was not difficult to find, but with so many other pizza joints in this great city, it will be a while before I head over to this place and order their famous pizza.

Probably the best deep dish pizza I've ever had. Visited Chicago and had to visit this place. Waited about 1.5 hours for a party of 2 on a Saturday night. I wish that they'd allow ordering before seating so that it's ready the the time the table is. Sadly, it takes 45 minutes from time of ordering to receiving the pizza. But it is so worth it! The caramelized crust makes it a masterpiece. Definitely visiting again when I'm in town
Amazing pizza. The bar/front staff could be friendlier but honestly the pizza was so good I barely cared.

Pequod's is one of my favorite Chicago deep dish pizzas.  The crust is caramelized and crispy, and the pizza simply hits the spot.  I usually go plain cheese, because I'm a simple guy.  Wait times can be long, but I guess that's a good thing?

We stopped in after a Cubs game on a Saturday around 515 place wasn't that crowded we got a seat right away . The inside is small and hot . The pizza was good , not amazing like I have read . They have a ton of workers with Pequods shirts on walking around , and multiple girls came back to check on us and refill our drinks . So we weren't really sure who our server was . Very small menu , but we went for the deep dish pizza . It was a nice Saturday dinner in the city, if we are in the area again we will stop by .They do have a call ahead seating option , your not guaranteed to be seated right away but if they are busy I would do this option on the way there . I also heard if you order a pickup and decide to stay and eat they seat you fairly quickly. There is street parking (which is hard to get ) but also a Parking garage across the street .
Love coming here for pizza. But the wait for a table is extremely long and ridiculous. Maybe getting a bigger spot? Besides that pizzas good and staff is very nice as well!
I know they're known for their "awesome" deep dish; however, I don't really like it. I prefer the thin crust. It has a great taste. This place is always busy.

One of the best pizzas in Chicago. Deep dish is fantastic. Hands down better then Gino's East and Giordanos .   Great flavor, only thing I don't like is how long the wait is to always get a pizza. I guess that means it's fresh though !

Placed order at 2:45pm for a 5pm delivery. They lost the order. New delivery time was by 6pm. Called at 6:15 to check in. The pizza had "just come out of the oven". The pizza just got here at 7:39pm.LITERALLY 2 HOURS AND 39 MINUTES AFTER STATED DELIVERY TIME.By far the worst pizza delivery experience of my life. Very very disappointed by Pequods. Will never order takeout from them again.

Forget Giordano's, forget Home Run Inn, forget Lou Malnati's, forget Gino's East. Pequod's puts them all to shame. Hands-down, best pizza I've ever had. There's usually a massive wait (especially during Cubs games), and pizzas take an hour to cook, but it is absolutely worth it. The sauce is rich and spicy, and the crust has the perfect amount of crunch to it. Don't get it delivered, though. It completely alters the texture of the crust to a mushy substance. If you do have to get it delivered, order it uncut, and throw it in a hot oven for a few minutes to firm the crust back up. The one thing they could do better is their delivery system. They're very unaccommodating with their delivery zone, and it can take over two hours to get your food. (I've been told by a driver that they keep a short staff of drivers.)

Pequod's was recommended from a co-worker who knows my love for pizza. Unfortunately I'm not a huge fan of their caramelized crust. I enjoy eating the crust, but this was not an option for their pan pizza. I will say the cooks are very heavy handed on the pepperoni toppings, which was definitely well received!
Man, got some soggy deep dish tonight. Bottom was literally soaking wet. I had to throw the pizza in my oven for 30 minutes. Gross

We got here on a Saturday night around 6-7 PM. There was about an hour or so wait. Meanwhile, we luckily got a spot at the bar and enjoyed some beers and the Blackhawks game. Finally, it was time to eat. We got the deep dish pizza with caramelized crust. Pizza was pretty delicious, but the crust is what made it unique. I've pretty much had the best of the best when it comes to deep dish, but this place is right up there. It's hard to be blown away when you've had the best, but there was definitely no denying that the pizza and experience is worth the trip.

Enjoyed the pizza. Seemed a little over cooked not just "caramalized" but for the price and service I would definitely recommend this place to someone wanting deep dish and not looking to break the bank

The first time I was here, there was no wait (we came super late on a weekday). This was a few years ago while on vacation, but it was SO good that I remembered it. Fast forward to the present, I had to go back and again, it was soooo goood. Waited about 30min this time but still worth it. Definitely a must eat in Chicago. I've also had Giordano's and it was mediocre. If you're going to try deep dish then you gotta try Pequod's!

hmmm... i don't know.  either we went on an off night, or this place is supremely hyped up.  i honestly don't know if we went on an off night, because people were waiting outside to be seated.  long story short, it took over an hour to get our pizza, and once the pizza arrived, the bottom was burnt and there was not enough cheese. maybe i'm holding this place to such a high standard, but i should right??? Michelin recommend this place, and you know if they recommend it... it has to be good. the crust and bread holding the pizza was just too thick and the sauce was kinda lacking.  the price for a small pizza is roughly 12 bucks, and toppings are an extra 2 bucks.   not to mention, parking is almost impossible to find on the streets, so you'll have to park across the street at he movie theater lot for 10 bucks. =/ i was going in with high hopes, but this place fell short of them.

This place is full of it.  They screwed me over with my take out order.  Lied and said they would make it right with a credit.  When I  called to redeem  the credit didn't exist.  I will never do business with them again.  I don't pay the get screwed.  BUYER BEWARE!!!!!!!!!
Chicago in a pizza! Great drafts too. Seating is downstairs and upstairs. Quick with the drinks. Takes a few for the pizza. Worth the wait. Thanks guys!

After seeing this quaint little spot on three different shows, we had to make the trek while in Chicago! The crunchy cheese crust around the pizza is superb and also  the best part. If your into the deep dish or have never had it, it's definitely different and unique; this east coast gal likes NY style or Detroit style( if ever in Pittsburgh I'll show you the best Detroit style). Appreciate the uniqueness and the fact that it's different from regular Chicago deep dish.
Wasn't a huge fan of the pizza. Took 1.5 to get us on a weekday. We only live about a mile away or so. Topping were pretty good, but the crust is just weird. I would say try once.
I will not eat pepperoni pizza unless it's from here! The service, vibes and food is great. Even delivery is great. When friends and I go out for pizza this is always the place for our group.

The veggie pan pizza was just okay in my opinion. It wasn't bad and it wasn't great. I personally didn't care for the taste of the tomato sauce. As others noted, there was too much crust with respect to the toppings/cheese. Although the crust did taste decent. The quality of the veggie toppings was meh. And lastly I was not a fan of the caramelized crust. I appreciate them trying to do something a little bit different, but it just came across as weird. At the end of the day, there are other deep dish restaurants I prefer. I'm glad I checked this out though.

Best deep dish pizza I've tried in Chicago! It's a little outside of downtown, but it's worth the drive or cab ride. I prefer Pequods anyday over Gino's and Giordanos. Tip- They do call aheads which saves a lot of time since this place gets packed.

Nice little spot to drop by after a drink filled night in Wicker Park. Stopped by to grub on some deep dish when we found out they close at 2 AM. I was pleasantly surprised that it resembled more of a dive bar than a pizzeria. Being on vacation in Chicago and being that it was my last night, I had to have me some Deep Dish Deliciousness. Unknown to me, they served pizza by the slices, which was to come out a lot faster if you didn't want to wait for a deep dish. Did my inebriated self want to wait an hour for a deep dish? Sadly, my impatience got the better of me.I went with a simple slice of pepperoni, sausage, and mushroom pizza while my girlfriend wanted a white pesto pizza. The server told us my order wouldn't be a problem to make for a slice but we'll have to order a a full pizza for my gf's order. Not a problem...if my slice didn't take as long as her mini white pesto deep dish to come out. What was probably 35 minutes, my slice finally came out. Perfect size for my hungry drunk ass and loaded with toppings. It was better than I expected. My only gripe? The sauge, or shall we call them meat balls, were a little too big and over powering, making the pepperoni and mushroom irrelevant. Luckily, them balls were packed with flavor. Just wish they were smaller in size so I can taste the other toppings. Not before I was 1/4 through my pizza, my gf's pizza came out. If I knew my slice would take almost as long as my gf's order I would've just went with a classic deep dish. We rarely got checked on and had to wave down the servers a couple times to get water refills. Besides that, the servers were very friendly. If we ever stop by Chicago again, I'd definitely like to try what people are saying is the best deep dish in Chicago.

Deep dish pizza, yum! I came here with a friend on a weekend for lunch around 11:30AM, and there was no wait. There was a wait, however, for the pizza to come out; I hear it's pretty typical though. We ordered a small pizza with spinach, mushroom, bell pepper, and pepperoni. The sauce wasn't very flavorful and towards the middle, the crust got soggy. For the most part though when the pizza first came out, the bottom of the crust was crunchy which was nice! I really enjoyed it. The outer crust was my favorite part though; it was a bit burnt and it was super crunchy and delicious! Good place to eat, I would definitely recommend it. The bill came out to be around $11 post-tax, which I don't know whether is typical or not for deep dish. Delicious though!

When I called ahead I was told that they would not put the pizza in until we were here. I thought, wow they must deal with a lot of sketchy people. Then when we got here they told us that the pizza won't be started until we were seated. It took 15 minutes for them to seat us. They put us upstairs where they have one waitress for 20 tables. They let us know that the pizza would be 40 minutes. We have been here an hour. Our waitress came to the table and apologized that they "lost" our order and that it will be an additional 20 minutes. The waitress just came to ask if we wanted to order additional food! Um, no, we'd not like to spend more money here! We'd like what we called ahead for.

You're not a true Chicagoan if you haven't had Pequods's. Their deep dish is amazing. If you are going to eat in, get there at an off time as they are usually very busy during dinner and lunch hours. We frequent delivery and it is still hot when it arrives. YUM!

In a town know for deep dish and never changing the deep dish prerequisites, Pequod's stands out for making a great pie while diverging from the run of the mill pie's you'll find elsewhere. Easily taking the crown as my favorite Chicago deep dish, Pequod's excels exactly where the others, in my own humble opinion, have failed: refreshing a Chicago staple. The pies are deep but not so much that one slice fills you up. The crust is perfectly golden brown but allows the toppings to take top billing. If Pequod's wanted to improve, the only recommendation I could proffer is to open another location or expand their delivery radius to River North!!

Loved it! I think it's a tie between Pequod's and Giordano's for me. It's everything you'd expect if you're craving the usual deep dish pizza. Giordano's is more of a "fancy" deep dish in my opinion. While Pequod's focuses more on the crust, Giordano's is more about the toppings and cheese (which can be overwhelming and super rich). Both are great. I liked the atmosphere on the 2nd floor. Seemed like a dive bar. I'm surprised they don't have more locations in the downtown area!

Just how do they do it?  How does this place achieve deep dish pizza perfection?After some research, I found out some of the secrets.  First is the cast iron pizza pans, well-seasoned after many years of use.  Next is the dough, spread in a thick layer on the bottom of the oiled pizza pain, but not up the sides.  The cheese is whole mild mozzarella, sliced in house to exact specifications, and laid in overlapping pattern on top of the crust but, and here's one of the secrets, also placed up on the sides of the pan.  A hefty ladle of uncooked seasoned tomato sauce goes on top, followed by toppings, dried oregano and pecorino romano cheese.  The thing bakes for about 20 minutes in a 600 degree oven.  The result?  The crust has a beautiful lacy caramelized ring around it, the sauce is sweet and tangy with great depth of flavor, and the toppings are charred to great effect.It's deep dish pizza perfection!  Hard. To. Stop. Eating. It.The only downside is that it's busy and the wait is long.  On a rainy Saturday at 1:30 pm, we waited about 45 minutes to get in, and then it took another 45 minutes to get our pizza after we sat down.  Don't fret, your patience will be rewarded!

I don't get the hype....I found Pequod's totally overrated. Full disclosure: not a hater of deep dish, but strongly prefer thin crust. Regardless, I did not find the pizza that tasty. Didn't like the biscuity quality to the crust and didn't think the sauce, pepperoni or sausage was that tasty. I'm not going to advertise for other pizza joints in this review, but there is much better pizza to be had in Chicago. I did like the carmelized cheese on the crust, but this barely tasted like pizza to me, it was like some generic Italian-ish pot pie w/out enough garlic/herbs/flavor. All it was was filling. I tried it, it did nothing to make deep dish more appealing to me.

The atmosphere was nice and so were the employees, however the thin crust pizza slices I ordered were over priced for what I received. This pizza does not adhere to the standards I hold Chicago pizza to. If you are high as a kite and need some warm food in your belly before you sack out then this joint could be for you. The staff, atmosphere and late night hour is what this place has going for it but you want to go here for a slice of pizza(it's in the name) for a comparable price. I would not recommend to others.

Looking for deep dish pizza. This is your spot. Divey but authentic Pequods pumps out delivery and in house pizzas. Service is accommodating and eager to please although their busy. Best luck at no wait is off hours or before 5PM. Loved it but had to give it 3 stars based on the wait, dark/dive atmosphere and fact that they don't mix your salads because people complained about the amount of dressing used...? Like what? Beware of Cubs games because overflow tends to find itself there after games.

Absolutely amazing pizza!  Crust was incredibly crispy and that caramelized cheese...drool...We actually didn't have to wait long for a table on a Friday night (Tip: use their priority wait seating on their website!  It's not really a reservation but they'll put you on the front of their wait list once you arrive).

My favorite deep dish pizza in Chicago! The burnt crust is absolutely delicious. It's a place that I would love to be able to make a reservation, but it is worth the wait. Whenever I go to another pizza place, I find myself wishing that the crust tasted more like Pequod's. Deep dish is not something you can have every day, but whenever I do have it this is the only one I think is worth the unimaginable level of fullness I experience when done eating!

My first real chicago deep dish pizza! We walked in a few minutes after they open, and there were already a few customers inside... a good sign.Took about an hour which is reasonable, so we ordered a half order of fries to keep us entertained (yum and cheap). A "small" pizza has only 4 slices but is definitely enough to feed two people. That delicious smell of freshly made pizza, the cheese string lasting forever, the toppings are big and juicy. and stuffed at capacity. The crust is solid... crispy crunchy almost cookie like. The sides are baked with caramelized cheese and is almost 4 inches high. Very satisfying.Staff was friendly and was great at helping us customize our perfect pizza!
Great! Just don't come in when you're already starving- deep dish takes 45min-1hour.
By far the best deep dish in Chicago. I've been here multiple times and never was let down by the food or service.

It's a shame what a little bit of fame and popularity can do to a place. Have been going to Pequod's for years because they have the absolutely best pizza.  In the past, execution and customer service has been good. (See my review from 4 years ago...).  Unfortunately, the last 3 times I have been to Pequod's my order has been totally screwed up - and the worst part, THEY DON'T CARE.  Lack of any concern for customer experience and never expressing any sincere apology from the invisible management has finally driven me (party of 9) away for good.   They have made it abundantly clear they have enough business and don't need mine.  There are other decent pizza places who will APPRECIATE my business in the future.

My favorite deep dish pizza in Chicago.  Pequod's is a whale of a good time.  This pizza is legit they don't Moby Dick around with the quality.  Great place for a date night, slam a couple pizzas and let the romance commence!

First time I had their burnt crust years ago, I wasn't so much of a fan.  Lately I have had it a couple times and find it very unique and addicting.  Friendly service, good unique chicago style pizza.  Definitely recommend trying it out.
Good pizza. Interesting concept. Not deep dish though. Lou's or Giordanos is the way to go.
A bit overrated. It was a long wait for our pizza, and when we got it the crust was burnt.

Fast service. Pizza was tidy and tasty. Wait staff was pushy about us packing up leftovers, paying a bill, and leaving. We hadn't even finished eating or drinking our drinks. I understand the effort to get more bums on seats, but I felt rushed and wholly undervalued.

I may the only person in this city that is not a huge fan of pequod's pizza. It's ok, but nothing to drool over. Wait to usually too long for average pizza. If you want great Chicago pizza, go elsewhere. Pequod's is all hype.

Now that I've tried most of this city's popular pizza joints, I feel like I can put each one into their own category. By far Giordano's is still my favorite because they have a fierce gooey cheese game going on in their pies. Lou's tends to be more saucy, while here we found it to be overly bready.On our first visit we tried the thin crust which we enjoyed, so we were very excited to get their famous deep dish with an all cheese crust, which is phenomenal by the way. Who knew burnt cheese could taste so good? The pizza seemed to be a good inch of bread high with a layer of sauce and toppings as opposed to more of a deep dish where the bottom layer of dough is thinner and the toppings deeper and more plentiful. It still tastes great sure, but everyone has a preference. My husband likes Lou's the best which is why we were hoping to have this be our new favorite and could that way compromise and eat here when we were in town. I like that it has the feel of a local sports bar and the service was stellar. Our waitress comped one of my husband's beers for taking a long time to come out when we hadn't even noticed or brought it up which I thought was completely awesome and unnecessary. Still do come here and try it to decide for yourself which pizza suits your fancy. The toppings are fresh, the flavors on point, and you certainly won't leave hungry! They also have great lunch specials and you can call ahead and put your name down during high wait times.

This place is overtly rated to be one of the best pizza   In Chicago.  I had to see it for myself.  If you are coming here on an empty stomach you better pack a SNACK box because you are going to be WAITING a very LONG TIME to be waited On.  We had a very nice waitress she gave us her suggestions we like the appetizers very much.  Nice and hot.   The pizza to me was not like WOW best pizza no. I did not care for it because it lack seasoning and the dough was not well done for me and I needed to add salt on my pizza.  I never add salt to my food but yes the pizza was under salted.  The only thing that I totally disliked were the hostesses.  The one that had glasses was loosing control and was yelling at all of us to get into a single file and had to be helped to mange the buzzers you received to be called to your table.  After over an biy and half we finally got our table they took us upstairs and a hostess with braids was so rude she was taking us so fast up the stairs my cldey sick mother was exhausted and could not catch up to her.  So by the time we got sited at our table the hostess rudely slam the forks, knives in a cup on the table and walked off.   That ruin my appetite.  Set the ambiance from 5 states to 3 No am definitely NOT coming back not worth the wait

Closer location than the original to downtown of my favorite Chicago deep dish pizza.Food: 5, Atmosphere: 3, Service: 4Cost to worth it rating: 4 ($22 for 1 topping large pan pizza)Return worthiness: yesHighlights:- Caramelized crust: their differentiator - Toppings: they have meatball (liked this a lot), Italian beef, and giardiniera and top it with lots of gooey melty cheese- Garlic bread: solid to munch on while you wait - Serve the full menu until 2am- Full bar- $5 lunch special: includes personal pizza and a sodaMidlights:- No specialty pizzas: you gotta make up your ownLowlights:- Bit of a car ride to get to from downtown Still love this pie and will be back.

I don't understand the hype of this place. Super small, so it was obviously over crowded. The staff all seemed to be either stoned or off of some other stuff I don't even know of.And honestly, the pizza wasn't even THAT good.Save yourself the experience, and don't go here.
Love this place. Super easy to pick up pizza on my way home today as it always is. Pizza is a unique style and the burnt crust is addictive.
One of the best Chicago deep dish pizza! Love their crust! They also have an awesome lunch special for $5.95
Food was okay, nothing to go crazy about.. but the service was terrible. Won't make it a point to come back.
This was pretty good. I can see why people like the carmelized crust, but I'm a big fan of the flaky crust pizza. I was glad that the wait was not too long and that we were seated within 20 minutes.

Our server Angela was fantastic!! She was able to accommodate our group and was able to split all of our receipt!! Thank you Angela!!We all had their deep dish Chicago Style Pizza! It was a mix comment, but overall not bad. you would have to know what Chicago deep dish pizza is about, otherwise, you might find it interestingly different!!I would've taken photos, but our whole group worked the whole day for more than 16 hours and by 10:30pm, we were all exhausted and just ready to just dive in and eat!! LOLOverall, I'd recommend coming here and be one of the locals!!Until then, Cheers!! ~ :p

My first Chicago style deep dish pizza did not disappoint! The place is pretty divey and unapologetically so. Since the pizza itself was going to take about 30-40 minutes, we ordered their cheese bread to start. The cheese bread is almost artery clogging with the amount of cheese that they put on it and was the perfect size to share between three people without being too much. We ordered a pepperoni, sausage, and basil pizza. The crust came out looking like it was burnt but it was just how they caramelized cheese. The crust itself was very crispy on the outside while fluffy and doughy on the inside. The addition of the caramalized/burnt cheese was definitely my favorite part of the pizza and was quite addicting! The pepperoni was pretty standard and I liked their sausage a lot better because it was more flavorful. The only real downside is that the pizza was mainly a really thick crust. Though it was tasty, I could only really get through one whole slice before being sent into a carb-induced food coma. Once we got over the intial wow-factor of the crispy cheese, we mainly picked away at the toppings of our next slices.Overall, I think Pequod's was a great introduction to Chicago deep dish for me and I can't wait to try other spots to be able to compare!
I ate here once with six beautiful and accomplished women and one guy named Clarence. Food to notch, service excellent. Picky Pizza eaters will not be disappointed.

Chicago is the land of deep-dish pizza. And I can't stand it. The only time I would ever get deep-dish was when I had a friend in from out of town. Ever since I discovered the deliciousness that is Pequod's, it's not just the only pizza place I take friends too, it's where I like to go whenever I'm in the mood for a really good pizza pie. It's not deep dish. It's deep-pan pizza so, while the pizza is two inches thick, most of that is crust instead of normal deep dish sludge. And the caramelized crust is amazeballs. I was surprised how divey it felt when I first walked in but I like that they let their food speak for itself. The cheesy garlic bread is a solid starter, and they typically have pretty good drink specials. I've actually never had to wait too long to get seated, but I've also usually been able to avoid prime dinner time. The one time I had to wait at all, I was able to grab a drink at the bar next door while I waited for my buzzer, so no harm no foul.

Pequods was my first deep dish experience in Chicago, and the only way I can describe it is good enough. We got a small 10-inch pizza with sausage and pepperoni, which paired with a side of fries was the perfect amount for two hungry dudes. The pizza takes about 40 minutes to come out, so I recommend ordering right away. The cheese is crispy, the toppings are on point, and the crust requires a fork and knife for sure.I do really like the atmosphere, which is like a cool locals bar. Not as touristy as the Lou Malnati's in downtown Chicago. That gives it a slight edge in the comparison, but the pizza comes down to whether you like a crispier or slightly softer pie.

Great place. Went here for a birthday party. My food took a little while to get to my table, and our waitress kept assuring us multiple times that the wings would be ready soon, but it took about 30 minutes from the first time she said that. So service might be slow here sometimes, but mind you it was kind of busy at that time.

Originally from Chicago I've had many of the Deep Dish Pizza's from several of the popular and less popular places in Chicagoland.  Lou Malnati's has always been my favorite go to pie for years.  Until now, there was no competition IMHO.  Recommended by a city Lyft driver, great reviews on Yelp and other references, we decided to try Pequod's. We (all five of us who are all long time Deep Dish fans) were NOT disappointed. Great pie! The crust, the ingredients including the sausage and cheese are top quality. The sauce is excellent with a slight tangy while the acidity is low and cooked out. Going forward when visiting "My Kind of Town", I'll now have pan pizza on two different nights. One night at Lou's and one night at Pequad's  (not necessarily in that order).  Expect to wait during peak hours but it's worth the effort! Very reasonably priced as well!
omfg! lost for words..... just go try it! nuff said!!!!

I am not a big fan of deep dish pizza, but Peqoud's is pretty damn good. The crust is excellent, caramelized deliciousness; and the toppings are always fresh and plentiful. The service is excellent, and the background music always has me singing along, to my friends chagrin. I don't get here often enough. I love Lou Malnati's, but Peqoud's is a very close second. I adore this place.

I've tried out two other pizza spots in Chicago while traveling here for a few days and this is the best! I would come back here again for their cheese pan pizza which is what I got. They have a lunch special during the weekdays from 11:00am to 3pm for $4.95 so I would recommend ordering that. You can get a personal pan pizza with a fountain drink for the price, which is very reasonable. The quantity is sufficient too for one person but you can even share it. My friends and I ordered an extra one to go as well.

Hahahah, Pequods.You like deep dish? You like this place.I think the overly-detailed bad reviews are hilarious. This is not burger king. You do not get it your way. You get it Pequods way, and sometimes, you have to just take it that way.But I am not here to talk about how long it took to get my food, nor if the server was rude to me, or if your box had a dent in it. I am here to talk about how the food put in front of me was, which is really what we should all be talking about.

My favorite deep dish pizza ever. You just can't beat Peaquod's: quality ingredients, good sauce/cheese/toppings ratio, and the perfect level of char. I know the charred aspect isn't a favorite for everyone, but I think it completes the pizza and makes it into the perfect Pequod's crust. I've been here several times and the service is kind of hit or miss, but fortunately for them, their pizza is so good that I keep coming back regardless. If you're coming in from out of town and you want deep dish, THIS IS IT. Also try your fav topping with giardinera (spicy food lovers only)... thank me later. :)

Having lived in Chicago for over a decade, leaving and then coming back again, I can now safely say that the beat deep dish is from Pequods. It's tough to get in on a weekend night, but weekday evenings are no problem.

The best deep dish pizza in Chicago! We actually had it recommended to us by someone who lived there and we were very impress.  This isn't a big place so the wait can be a little long but worth the wait!
Not as good as the hype! It's OK, but I'm not a big fan of golf ball size sausage and very little sauce. I will stay with Nancy's deep dish  or Aurelio's thin crust any day !
Decided to check it out once I read a couple reviews . Great pizza . Couldn't even finish the personal pan pizza

A huge disappointment. There was wait which I don't understand why when majority of the second floor was empty; we were seated upstairs. What is up with people and deep dishes? I was excited to travel to Chicago to finally try the famous deep dish pizza and that was a huge mistake; the grumpy guy that sat across me couldn't agree any less. We had the small pan pizza with onion, pepper, mushroom, basil, pineapple and some other greens. It wasn't bad looking but the taste...he finished his slice and I couldn't even stuff another bite. I think I ate a total of 2.5 bites of my slice and doggie bagged the rest for my mommie. Mom didn't like it either. We also ordered the appetizer combo that came with mozzarella sticks, zucchini slices, jalapeño poppers, and breaded mushrooms. I was super excited for the mozzarella sticks because I can't remember how old I was when I had it; probably in high school. I can't say it fulfilled my craving for mozzarella sticks but it was definitely one of the better appetizers. Everything else was being ingested out of hunger. We also ordered the garlic bread and wow were we upset. It wasn't garlicy or buttery. Hmm. This is a tough review. I feel like it's suppose to be good but I had such a bad experience with the food.

I really like the pizza here. I've only had the deep dish. Also have had salad and apps there which were fine but nothing special. My boyfriend has gotten a pasta dish and thought it was good but nothing to write home about. The pizza has a caramelized crust which I've heard some people think is too much of a burnt flavor, which I can understand. It's up to your personal preference whether you will love the pizza or not. The service is just ok, and I've ordered it for delivery which was not a good experience. They messed up on my delivery time and tried to deliver it when I wasn't there, so came back about an hour later after completing more deliveries. I had to microwave the pizza once it arrived and the fries we got were soggy. I would go back for the pizza, but would not do delivery again.
Our favorite pizza place in chicago. Skip the long lines of tourists at all the other downtown spots and bring your family and friends here. It's a much more local feel with great food.

This was the least flavorful "deep dish" pizza I've ever experienced. The deep dish was more "pan pizza" and less deep dish. The sauce was in dire need of salt, the crust was soggy and the meat lacked any flavor at all. Where was the cheese? Several people recommended this restaurant over my favorite Giodarnos and over Lou Malnatis, but I'm convinced they lacked tastebuds. The only positive was our waitress Tessa, who was polite and attentive. I was otherwise, beyond disappointed.

fast servicepizza is oka friend of mine recomend this placei order mediam peperoni 1/2 whit mushrooms and jalapenos when the pizza arrive omg was a lot of jalapenos like i order extraalso order the apetizer was ok

Brenda was awesome. She really helped us out in a bind. Because we were traveling internationally and had card issues with fraud alerts, she was kind enough to make our order happen while we sorted out our credit card situation. Had she not done this in order to facilitate our order, we would have probably never tried (or gone back to) her establishment.For the record- we were a late night order, so time was of the essence.Much appreciate her faith in us, and let it be known that- given how great her service was, and delicious the pizza is- we shall now be regular customers, having recently moved here and this being our first pizza order in Chicago. Thank you, Brenda!

This really needs no help with a rating. I will tho, since I see some disgruntled NY and other folks who live out of town have given lower ratings. The crust is always just the right amount of crisp and done. It's a deep dish pizza done correctly, where others fail. The toppings are always tasty. I've never had it soggy, its always been slightly burnt, like their signature, and perfectly done thru the rest.So Fort Worth, Miami, Anh (real trendy spelling) and dorky Jake from SF, just stay in your respective smellier cities.
Best deep dish in town baby!!!!

Great food, great service, reasonable prices, best pizza in chicago! 5 starts, id definitely recommend trying this place , if you dont live in town, trust make the trip west over here its awesome, great bar to watch sports games too!

It was a new experience for me to tell people all across the city that I'd had pizza, and when they asked "where at" I said "Pequod's" and the response was *universal* approval. "You won't find better in the city. Good job." It was almost as if people were surprised that I, some guy from Vegas, would be able to divine the local secrets of Chicago pizza. This place was awesome. That's the important part. Second most important: you're going to wait for it. We put our names in and went down the street to a bar they had partnered with to wait, instead of just sitting around waiting for a table in the actual restaurant. They gave us a buzzer and we started drinking. About 80 minutes later, the buzzer went off and we headed back to our table. We ordered garlic cheese bread for starters, and it was pretty good. I'd give it 4 stars if I had to grade the bread alone. It was still good, no doubt, the bread could have been a bit better if I had to pick one thing to improve. After we ordered our pizzas, one thick and one thin crust, we waited again and ate our garlic cheese bread and drank our drinks.The pizzas arrived. I'm not a big fan of Chicago-style deep dish. I consider myself a thin-crust man. The thin crust is thicker than I expected, more of a "pan" style, "normal" thickness. The deep dish was exactly what I expected. Even though I'm not a deep dish person, I ate two pieces and had to stop myself from having a third lest I leave no room for the thin crust. The thin crust was excellent, and the thickness was deceiving: it was crisp and delicious even though a bit airy. I am a big fan of both these pizzas. The toppings tasted great, the sauce was great, the service was pretty good. I'd come here again in a heartbeat. And I understand why everybody was so happy for me when I told them I'd come here.

I have always heard people talking about pequods so when I came to eat here with a bunch of friends I was so hyped. We even brought some friends that were visiting from Florida. The place was packed so I thought it was a good sign. We ordered the sausage with pepperoni, pepperoni sausage with jalapeño, and canadian bacon with pineapple. After we ate I felt so bad for bringing my out of town friends. It was so meh. It wasn't bad but it also wasn't good. Good thing Florida pizza is trash so pequods was ok to them. The atmosphere is fun but it gets so packed that sometimes it's hard to get a hold of your server. But when u do they are nice and helpful.

Always have their amazing pizza when I can. Love the lunch deals and I love the burnt cheese crust. The wait is typically pretty long but it is definitely worth it for this pizza. I am the kind of person who does come here during the less crowded times. Make sure you go during lunch for the 4.95 lunch special. Also there is a bar next door where you can have a drink while you wait. The buzzer will work in there while you wait. I do like sitting on the second floor better as it does feel cozier, especially for how long you have to wait, and they service I get up there is typically better. The past few times I have been here the servers have not been too warm and welcoming and it looked like they were just fed up by the huge crowds and lines. Us customers just can't help it when the cooks make this pizza so addictive so we keep coming. This is definitely a local mostly location and the best place in my opinion for deep dish in Chicago. This is coming from someone who doesn't pizzadiscriminate.

At the servers suggestion , we ordered a large Pequod salad and a large Caesar to have while our pizza cooked   $9.50 each--iceberg lettuce, one sliced mushroom 3 cherry tomatoes a few onion slices . Poor.We ordered 2 large pan pizzas, different toppings . The first one came out for 1/2 the group. 20 minutes later we had to flag someone down to look for the second pizza. 1/2 the group had finished eating.They came back a few minutes later with 2 mediums and no apologies.Pizza crust was amazing!

Best to come in on a weekday if you're looking to dine in (carry outs good, but doesn't compare to pizza right out the oven) cause it's always super busy but this pizza really does live up to the hype.

Well, this was a flat-out disappointment.I'd been hearing great things about Pequod's for years:  Hell, since before I even knew Yelp existed.  Now, I'm no Chicago deep-dish junkie--the dreadful Chicago-style place in my hometown kept me away from the stuff for years--but I've now visited the city enough times to have had several of these pizzas that I thought were terrific.  From what I gathered over time, Pequod's was supposed to be one of the two or three best.  To judge by the pie we had on this night, it fell sadly short of expectations.  The crust:  One-dimensionally crunchy and virtually flavorless.The sauce:  Insipid and bland.The veggie toppings:  Hacked up in unpleasantly large bites.  (The sausage was pretty good, though.)That heralded caramelized crust was pretty great, but it could not make up for the rest of this mediocrity of a pizza.Maybe this was just a dud, a bad night.We liked everything else about Pequod's:  The casual, cramped, old-school feel of the place; the friendly, if somewhat relaxed, service; the solid Italian salad we shared as an appetizer (very good housemade dressing); and the beer list.One day, I'd like to give Pequod's another shot.

Came here on the suggestion of different locals. Left supremely disappointed. The pizza was not deep dish, which is what we expressed that we wanted when Pequads was suggested. What we got was a very thick pan pizza with little to no cheese, bland sauce, and unappealing toppings. It was really unfortunate, as we picked this place over Lou Malnati's. Won't make that mistake again.

I went to Chicago for vacation and knew I couldn't leave without trying Chicago's deep dish pizza. We ended up picking Pequod's.We came on a Friday evening and had an approximately two hour wait. Luckily, there's a Barnes and Noble nearby to pass the time. After getting seated, we ordered a medium pizza, which was the perfect size for three, with fresh basil, sausages, and mushrooms. The basil seemed to be lacking in both quantity and flavor, but the other two toppings complemented the pizza really well! The crust of Pequod's pizza is also to die for and was yummy.

For years, I've ben so confused as to why Pequod's isn't the place you hear about most for pizza. I tell anyone visiting that they need to go here. It's such a great spot and doesn't feel chainlike at all.

I came here on a Saturday, and it was packed! When we got there, there was a wait, but we were able to grab a drink at their associated bar two doors down. We had one drink there before our table was ready. We had the cheesy garlic bread and created our own pizza. The cheesy garlic bread was great, and while I am not the biggest fan of deep dish pizza, it was still some of the best that I have had! It would have been nice if they had taken our order when we first got there and were waiting, as once we got seated upstairs it was about another hour until we got our pizza. Overall, good experience and I would definitely come again!

This place has great pizza but the service tonight ON MY BIRTHDAY was terrible! I ordered a pizza at 8:15pm. Now it's 10:17 I just cancelled the order because it never came. Some idiot lost my order. They took half off my bill and promised my order would be ready in 15min at 9:50pm. 25min later my food wasn't ready, so I cancelled my order. I hate incompetence. I will never eat here again. I'd rather spin month at a place that might not taste as good but have enough good sense, not to lose my order. What's worse is u can believe I drove damn near an hour to get it. Never again. And I'll be sure to tell/talk anybody I know out of coming here. Here's a tip: Get some better business Practices!!! Thanks!!!

We shared a wonderful deep dish pizza that we customized with pepperoni, sausage and green papers. It was delicious! Be aware that you will wait 40 minutes from the point of ordering before your pizza is served! The place is multi-level and buzzing with people. Fun, casual environment!

Pequod's is a rock solid pizza and I've been going there for 25 years. It's a bit of a wait most of the time so come early grab a beer and most importantly order in advance so you can sit down and eat your pizza right away instead of having to wait for your pizza order once you finally sit down. The pizza crust is crispy although I admit it could use a little salt. Thin crust is what my son likes. When you can hook a 13 year old on good pizza it creates an experience he'll have his entire life. Speaking of experience the place has a lot of character. Good place to take a date or a family!
Great pizza, friendly service and laid back vibes in the cutest neighborhood. This is a must!
Such awesome pizza! Crisp crust, great sauce, and tasty toppings. The only issue is the wait, as they don't take reservations and they're so popular. They should expand!
Best pizza in Chicago. The wait is rough - always...but worth it. Grab your pager and go next door for a cocktail while you wait!

Before anyone gets outraged for the 1 star rating, this review is only for their veggie pizza. I got a pan pizza while my friend got the thin crust one and both of them were so disappointing, the thin crust slightly less so. It looked like raw unseasoned veggies were just added on top of a cheese pizza. The pizza sauce tasted like canned tomato sauce. The only thing good about the pan pizza was the crust. Rightly done, I am sure this pizza could have been amazing. It took us 30 mins to get a table and additional 30 minutes before the pizza was brought out. So not worth the time or money if you are a vegetarian.

I always tell people this place is a hybrid of Giordrano's and Lou's. It's got the pie-stuffed feeling of Giordano's and the delicious buttery crust of Lou's. I'm picky, but I call it the perfect pizza. If you're having dinner prepare to wait an hour for a table and another hour for the pizza. Just remember it's worth be wait.
This place is great! Serves is great the pizza is mouth watering. Highly recommend this place!
Amazing pizza! Best deep dish pizza in Chicago!

I came here on a recommendation from a friend who lived in Chicago.  I got on the "preferred seating" list for 7 p.m. and we got here early.  Upon arrival we were told that it would be a wait of 45 minutes to an hour.....even though we got on their "preferred seating" list for 7.  What kind of restaurant makes you wait an extra hour even though you have a reservation?I guess business here is so good you can lie and give customers the shaft and not have to worry about it.

I waited to review Pequod's until I had many others under my belt (85+ at this point). I remember loving it about two years ago when I first had it; before I knew anything about the hype. You can argue who has the best deep dish in Chicago, but I want to put a spin on this. If you look at the menu, they call this "pan" pizza and I'm glad they do, because I'd consider them the best pan pizza in Chicago, not deep dish. What I'm trying to say is pan pizza is known to be over-compensated on the dough. This is a very doughy pizza. I consider deep dish more balanced with more cheese and toppings and less dough. To each their own. I really like the airiness of the crust. It has a well-cooked bottom crunch, yet a chewy center. The sauce is more savory and is a true sauce, not chunk tomatoes. I hate to say it, but the sausage tasted a little dry and gritty. This is more than likely due to it being cooked on top of the pizza. There was a decent amount of cheese. It was enough, but wouldn't have complained if there was more. Of course I have to mention the caramelized cheese crust. This is the best bite of the pizza and what they are famous for. Don't be alarmed, it does not taste burnt at all! I also got a thin crust pizza. It's nice that they do a braided outer crust. The toppings were abundant and the it was far more cheesy than the pan pizza. I really liked the thin crust. I think everyone should at least get Pequods once to say they did and it may be your new favorite pan pizza. If you like lots of dough, this will be your place.

After a few recommendations from locals, we decided to visit and taste for ourselves. We arrived and waited for about 10 minutes before we even got asked about what we would like for drinks. In discussions with the server, she advised that the deep dish takes about 40min to bake. So, we opted to get slices instead as we had a plane to catch. Well, 40 minutes later 2 of us got slices that were warm, not hot, warm. Our friend ended up getting a personal thin crust which is not what he ordered. The pizza was not good for any of us. We were absolutely disappointed with the service and quality of food. Maybe on a return trip, we'll try again and get better service and food.

What is there to state accept this is the best pizza in the city. They take pizza to another level for taste and the restaurant experience is not bad either. They did a remodel some years ago at the Clybourn location to add more seating and to update the look. The crust and the pizza sauce is just magnificent. This place is definitely worth the trip if you are not close to this location. They also have a location in Morton Grove. bon appétit!
Took a long time to come out and the refills were slow. But the pizza was very good.  We ordered a deep dish with olives, onion and mushrooms.

I call Lou Malnati's Pizzeria my favorite Chicago pizza chain, but Pequod's may very well be my favorite Chicago pie! The Carmel crust is to die for and is like no other. Very cozy joint in a nice neighborhood. Parking is difficult but worth it. If ever in Chicago and looking for a true Chicago gem this is it!
Delicious deep dish pizza!! We ordered and got it delivered and the delivery was pretty speedy forDeep dish. Would definitely have it again.

On my flight over to Chicago I watched an episode of "Delicious Destinations" which was all about places to eat while in the City in which they recommended this place.  I was overly disappointed when coming here.  Service and everything was fine, but the sauce on the pizza was filled with entirely too many seasonings.  It reminded me of a marinara sauce made by someone who doesn't know what they are doing, I really didn't like it.Also- they are known here for this "signature" burnt cheese crust.  I can't understand for the life of me what makes it that special.  It tastes exactly like you would imagine, like burnt cheese.  I wouldn't waste my time coming here if you are visiting- stick with Lou Malnatis.
Three times, three pizzas delicious and warm from the oven. You can't claim yourself a visitor to Chicago until you have brought your stomach here! The best deep dish in Chicago!

Second stop on my Chicago pizza tour. And the BEST!A lot smaller then Lou's and Gino's. Reminded me a of a dive restaurant, limited seating area.Not located in the downtown area. Located away from all the tourist stuff.Lunch special is best deep dish pizza deal you can find. Only Monday - Friday 11AM-3PM.Chicago Lunch Special - $4.95 + $.80 + $.80 = $6.55 - 7 Pan Cheese Pizza with Pepperoni & Sausage -  Not tall as other deep dish pizza I had but the toppings were still loaded on. What sets Pequod's apart is that crispy cheese they get on the crust. The crust is already thick and buttery but adding the cheese to crisp up while cooking brings it to another level.No wonder they are always voted top pizza in America!

We ordered a pizza an hour before close, paid for it upfront, walked up 20 minutes before close to pick it up which is when we were told to come get it and all the employees looked at us, and ducked behind the bar. We waited outside knocking to get our pizza that was paid for, never got it, and out $30.

Everything was stellar except that their crust is waaaaaay too thick, even if their cheese, sauce and toppings are on the generous side, as well. I am impressed that despite the thickness of the bread, it was not in any way soggy from the other ingredients piled on top of it. Meatball topping is great. I just cannot abide by their thick bread.

Just had my first Pequod's pizza. It was delivered to my hotel with no plate or utensils; I guess I should have asked. It was haphazardly cut, which made it even more difficult to eat. The ingredients are fresh; the sauce is a bit too sweet for me; and, overall, not a lot of flavor compared to other choices I could have made tonight. I suppose there might be others who would have enjoyed this, but not exactly what I was hoping for tonight.

Deep Dish pizza is good. If you're visiting Chicago I would try one of the more popular joints just to avoid the long wait and hit this place when you have more time to try different pizza places. Waited about two hours for a table. The customer diversity was made up of a lot of families and a lot of kids. It was a bit of a mad house but the staff handled everything well.

I had been meaning to come to Pequod's for the longest time and finally made it here on a Monday night.  Pro tip: Go on a weekday.  We were seated immediately.  My fiancé and I split a deep dish pizza, and it was quite tasty.  Not mindblowingly great enough for me to make the trek back up to Pequod's soon (I live within walking distance of a Gino's, Giordano's, and Lou's), but I certainly enjoyed myself.  The service was kind, and restaurant's atmosphere was comfortable but nothing special.  I would return if in the area!

Not a huge deep dish fan but when visiting Chicago, I figure you have to at least have it once. I've done Uno and Lou Malnatis but wanted to give Pequods a shot- it did not disappoint. Really enjoyed the crust versus the overly buttery kind you typical get. Also found it to be a little less doughy overall. Would definitely recommend adding this to your Chicago pizza tour.

We visited Pequod's for the first time on Friday, September 2nd.  We arrived at about 8:15PM.  As a visitor, it appears that there are three main competitors that are popular with both locals and tourists.  Pequod's, Lou Malnati's and Gino's East.  Well, Pequod's was our favorite of the two that we tried (The other one was Lou Malnati's).We absolutely loved the crust and the way they browned the cheese that was melted over the crust.  We found the pizza and toppings to taste delicious and we were pleased with the amount of sauce and cheese used.  I would DEFINITELY RETURN and eat here again,.  Why three stars?  I have one suggestion.I wish you would be able to "order ahead" once you put your name in and then by the time you get your table, there was less of a wait.I know, that would probably cut into profits for ordering other things like appetizers and drinks; however, during busy times, would that really be a problem?  It seems like there is always someone waiting anyway.Secondly, and due to no fault of the restaurant, there was a group of really, really drunk party of five slurring generalized insults the entire time.  They were rude, throwing food around, saying discriminatory things that several tables could hear and just were a terrible group of people to be sitting around.  Should we have said anything? I'm not sure whether we should or not.  The server who very clearly heard them should have been the one to take care of the issue (I personally believe)So, overall -- our favorite pizza -- and we would return.

I had made up my mind after trying 3 other famous Chicago pizza places that I just didn't like deep dish pizza. Nothing was really that tasty. That's when a friendly local told me to give it one more try at Pequod's. I love to eat so I accepted the challenge.We took the train out to the nearest stop, but the nearest stop was about a 30 minute walk to the restaurant. It was sort of a good thing because we worked up a big appetite by the time we arrived. The restaurant has a cool neighborhood-y dive vibe, which I liked. It felt more like a college bar than a pizzeria. Seating is very limited and about 20 minutes after we were seated, a huge line of people formed at the hostess stand (they began quoting wait times of 1 to 2 hours)! It takes a while to bake a fresh pizza so don't come here if you are in a hurry. I probably should've taken away 2 stars for their awful instant iced tea. Skip it. So gross. I always lose major respect for restaurants that care too little to fresh brew their own iced tea. It's not that difficult to do! At least the beer list has Lagunitas, a must-have with pizza. I made the mistake of letting my husband order the pizza and opted for a medium with extra pepperoni. Let me tell you, Pequod's understands the concept of "extra." This pie was loaded with spicy pepperoni and it was good, but I had to pick off pepperoni to give him because there was so much. I really liked this pizza (didn't love it, but it's good). The crust is very light and fluffy and tastes like beer. It reminded me of a classic pan pizza crust, but the carmelization was amazing! I could eat that part all day long. The sauce was very spicy which I also liked. This isn't a fancy place but the pizza is great. It was worth the walk.

While the pizza is amazing, the customer service is less than stellar (at least for delivery).  I've frequented Pequods for many years, several times a month.  I finally decided to get it delivered.  I noticed that I was less than a block from the cusp of their delivery zone and almost didn't call until I saw that they would be willing to make "reasonable accommodations."   I was told that it was way too far north (even though they deliver for several more miles south) (about 2.5 miles).  In fact, they tried arguing with me as to where I actually lived, stating that it was far too many miles north of a particular street (that I actually live south of!)Am I bitter?  Sure.  But when they offer "reasonable accommodations," and then argue about the location of my address.... hmm.  no pizza is worth that treatment.

I have definitely had better service from here before and I was k with the crappy service, til I got home to eat our carry out pizza. We got there at 4:30 pm, at this time we were advised there was a 45 minute wait, so we went to the "waiting tank". Now its 5:45pm and we still have not been seated, I went to ask how long did we still have to wait for a table, the hostess gave me attitude as if "how dare I asked such question" and said we still had 7 people ahead of us.  Couldn't wait for that, had 7pm tickets for the movies and its almost 6pm, I still had another hour for a table and 30 minutes for the pizza... lol. I just placed an order for a carry out to have ready when we left the movie theater.. 20 minutes later, once I finished my drink, went to the same girl and asked to change the time for pick up, wanted to assure my pizza wasn't just sitting there over cooking if it was done earlier than expected. She told me it was impossible to change the time, she said " the kitchen is extremely backed up, most likely it won't be ready by 9 regardless". We get there at 9:30, which was the time I asked them to change the pick up time to, didn't check the pizza, was too excited to eat it since I had been craving it for months. when I get home, its an over cooked and cold pizza that I found. I couldn't even finish one slice. Hostess should try to pay more attention to requests, it would make the 3 hour wait more bearable.

We are from out of town and went here based on Yelp reviews. We went on a Monday night at 8pm, so we were seated immediately. Take note that even after you order, it's a 45-50 minute wait for the pizza. We ordered the small deep dish pepperoni for the two of us. My husband ate both of his and was full-- I could only eat one. It was really good but the underneath was a bit dry. The caramelized crust was delicious.

Hands down the best deep dish pizza in Chicago! I've ordered delivery from there no less than 25 times in the past couple years and it's consistently exceptional pizza!As a heads up, there's often a wait if you go in person. I'd recommend putting your name in and then heading to grab a drink at the bar next door.Keep it up Pequod's!
Omg my favorite deep dish place in Chicago. It's where I bring all of the out of towners for "real Chicago pizza". It's also a great date place, right across the street from the movie theater.

Pequod's is my favorite pizza in Chicago and that is saying a lot because Chicago has terrific pizza.  To give you an example of how great it is, I never order an all veggie pizza because I usually don't feel satisfied unless there is a meat topping.  This is the only place where I will order one because their thin crust pizza is puffy and delicious, they have they perfect amount of cheese and their seasoning is so good.  Of course their thick crust pizza is wonderful too.  You can't miss with anything you order.
It's one of my top 2 for pizza in a city that has more choices than any other. Only downside is it's so busy that you need to order early - that pretty much tells you how good it is!
Don't care for the wait or the attitude. Pizza is meh. Honestly, the alternatives you have before you when you are rejected by them and often much better.

It may have been better a few years back but it's still arguably the best pizza on earth and easily Chicago best deep dish. I've regularly had all the spots to hit and Pequads is clear numero Uno! I hit it everytime I'm in Chicago

Oh, deep dish. Tried 'em all, including now the locally-recommended Pequod's. Cheesier than others, bottom crust a bit thicker, and it sticks together better than most -- but it's also pricier than most, and with it comes a wait time longer than most. Maybe I just don't like deep dish that much.Thin pizza was below par. At least the employees were all super nice?
My second favorite deep dish spot in Chicago, right behind Art of Pizza. But if a buddy comes into town wanting deep dish, go here for the beer and atmosphere over Art of Pizza.
Amazing pizza!! A must have when visiting Chicago. Great selection of appetizers and beer.

Wouldn't know how the pizza is because the person taking delivery orders was so rude I decided not to go ahead with the order. Seems like they don't need my business, so I'll take it elsewhere. Update: my husband did order the pizza one night and the crust came completely burned and the pizza just wasn't good (although I liked their pepperoni). I can't believe this place is to popular

Pequod's isn't the best pizza in Chicago, it's the best pizza on the planet!  The caramelized crust is to die for!  After living here for 20+ years, this is my go to place to amaze out-of-towners on our best local pizza.  Pro tip:  the personal pan pizza lunch special gets you maximum caramelized crust for minimal wait time.  Enjoy!

Pequod's is the only deep dish pizza that I recommend to friends and family visiting Chicago.  Other pizzerias tend to have a spongey crust that gets soggy towards the end of the meal, but Pequod's caramelized crust holds up to the weight of the ingredients on top much better. Quick tip:  Instead of sharing a medium pizza between two people, get two personalized pizzas for more caramelized crust.
With all deep dish options in Chicago, this one by far takes the pie. The buttery crust supports the cheese to sauce ratio and the no-chain vibe makes it feel much less touristy.

Pizza was just ok.  Service was not good.  Slow and no attention to detail.  Then my wife told me the woman's restroom was dirty.  We had 3 places our friends told us to go for pizza, next time we will try one of the others.

My favorite 'deep dish' in town. FYI- it takes 45 minutes to prepare from time of order. The caramelized cheese crust is delicious.  Not too heavy. The sauce is super yummy too. Staff was friendly. Will definitely be back & will shoot to bring visitors here instead of the more familiar choices.
If you don't get the caramelized crust you're not doing it right. And the sauce... ooooooh the sauce... I love this place
No double about it, Pequad's has the best pizza in Chicago! Hands down!

Absolutely my favorite pizza in the city. A unique take on deep dish with a delicious crispy cheese crust. Would recommend the pepperoni banana pepper toppings - so good. Long waits if you go in person pretty often but ordering takeout works great.
Awesome food Greta service very enjoyable will be back!

Deep Dish! I literally came from New York to try this pizza! My girlfriend is a Pizza lover, so after asking around and doing some research we landed in Pequads! The cast-iron plate makes a big difference, and as my pallet continues to evolve you can taste the different seasoning! Worth the travel!  Check out my instagram for places to visit and eat @expensive_appetite
One of the best deep dish pizza in Chicago hands down!the pizza is always good the long wait is the only major downside to pequods.

First off: I think deep dish pizza is sort of like a very large hot pocket at best and a tomato soup in a soggy bread bowl at worst. SO, I'm a little biased because I'm not the biggest fan of deep dish. That being said, I thought that the amount of food was fantastic. The portion size is fairly good, though it's not exactly "cheap eats" for 2. My boyfriend was disappointed in what he got for the cost, but he also couldn't stop comparing it to regular pizza in NY. Pequod's felt different to me than Giordano's, and I appreciated the decor and the zombie Moby Dick theme, so for that alone, I think this place is solid. I'm a huge fan of sauce, so I actually loved that there was a lot of it, and that's my favorite part about deep dish. The pan style pizza here is served in the pan, and the service was good. The crust is nice and burnt, just the way we all like it. It's not a ton of cheese but still plenty for you to feel like you're going to have a heart attack. I think it would've been awesome for a late night snack but unfortunately, we had too many meals planned to take any home or go back. I look forward to trying this place again next time around.

I'm giving it a 3 out of 5 but only because I put salt on the thin crust with anchovies and olives, which seems nearly impossible. Otherwise I'd give the pizza a solid 2.5 and contest reviews suggesting items even in the top 5 of Chicago pizza. I'm not sure how they got on this list but I cry foul...not even in the top 20. The service was decent and the beer was cold.
Sweet sauce, amazing crust and perfect amount of gooey cheese. The pepperoni was crispy and the pizza wasn't greasy!Totally worth the drive out.Worth the hype!!!

I went here once. It was a long wait and we had to wait in this little coffee like shop a store down. They must be partnered together. We ordered an appetizer because we knew deep dish would take a while to cook. The food overall was really good and the vibe was chill but the wait was a little long.
not sure if I like it compared to lou malnati's!service was ok, wait was crazy, crust was a little too greasy for my taste, and atmosphere was extremely crowded

One of the best pizza places in Chicago! Great, dive-bar kinda feel to it. Usually very crowded on weekends, so come early or expect to wait. They let you order pizza while you're waiting, which definitely helps. Beer options could be a bit better, but other than that this place is legit.

Unless you go by yourself like I usually do so you can sit at the bar or unless you go at an odd hour, expect to wait at least an hour.That being said, the wait is totally worth it if you're looking for Chicago Style deep dish pizza. Pequod's does it better than anyone else and it isn't even close. I used to be a huge Lou's fan and still go there as I don't live near Pequod's, but when I have the time & am itching for the best deep dish around, I make the hour train ride to eat the best.What makes Pequod's the best is their perfected crust. Slightly burnt which gives it a crunch without being overly doughy. Their sauce has some zest and is not pure tomato. The zesty sauce gives the pizza some kick. Sauces that are pure tomato are garbage in my opinion. All their ingredients are extremely high quality. Great beer selection as well.If you're itching for deep dish that is head & shoulders above Lou's, look no further than this gem only true Chicagoans know about. Simply the best.
Seriously tasty pies! Nice people too. Gets busy early so don't wait!

I used to hate Pequod's because I grew up on Giordano's. Well, Pequod's is in fact delicious. The cheesy and buttery crust is just so yum. It totally grew on me. We usually get sausage, which is always a good hearty choice.
One of my Favorite Deep Dish Pizzas in Chicago.. they do it right Love the well done crust

It took over two hours to eat!  Okay so we had to wait for about twenty minutes, they took our name gave us a buzzer and we went next door to have a drink. We ordered only to have our meal given to the wrong table.  They remade our pizza but burnt it we ordered some appetizers while we waited for pizza three.  The staff was nice but we had to ask them what was happening.

Very mediocre. We were definitely disappointed based on all the stellar reviews of the deep dish pizzas. Our pizza crust tasted okay but nothing great. The dough was a little dry and bland. The wait here is also insane and definitely not worth it. I probably won't go back as it is not worth the wait for the mediocre deep dish. Personally,  I think Lou Malnati's is better. Maybe it was an off night? I came here once before but just got a salad. It was good, really big portion but again, nothing i would order again.

I used to love this place in college. I went back tonight and had an awful experience. The hostess with the brown hair, glasses, and winged eyeliner was rude and a smart ass. If I call and make a reservation and you call it a reservation on the phone w/o any further information about said reservation, I'm going to assume I'll be seated within half an hour. An hour later we were seated. Reservation was at 7:30 and we didn't eat until 9:30. The pizza was soggy. I could tell it was soggy coming out but the guy who gave me a slice insisted it wasn't. The pizza was okay but the service was horrible. JUST DO CARRY OUT!

One word, Amazing! I'm not gonna try to compare it to other pizza joints in Chicago, but this one isn't only about the Pizza, but the ambiance, the service, and the food. Pequod's is more of a locals place to go, so you don't see many tourists. When we go there for dinner on a Saturday, there was a wait of 35 mins. Which from my understanding is a very short wait time for a Saturday night. Once we got our table, we were seating upstairs. It almost felt like a "Speakeasy Pizza" joint. This place isn't a "tourist pizzeria". It's authentic Chicagoan, packed with Chicagoans. It's very loud[in a good way], people just entertaining their guests, having a good time, chatting, laughing, and enjoying some great pizza.
This pizza is great for both locals and out of towners looking to dig in to some Chicago style deep dish pizza!This is one of the best pizza spots in Chicago!

This pizza has so much tomato sauce. Not good if you don't like that. Also not too many ingredients to chose from as toppings.
