Not too busy tho on a Wednesday afternoon if you absolutely want to try it. Also the new paying thru iPad systems that suggest a huge tip are very annoying. I would like the default to be no tip and for me to add tip if I enjoyed the service.

Pequod's. Pequod's. Let me count the ways I love you. 1. That caramelized crust: It makes my taste buds water just remember that deliciousness.2. That sauce: not too overpowering but spread evenly across.3. The pepperoni and sausage: delicious flavors that compliment the cheese and the sauce perfectly. 4. The mozzarella sticks: the best I've ever had. The cheese and the breading and  the marinara - they've perfected the formula.5. The Pequod's Salad: a delicious salad with meat and cheese and pepperoncini.I've heard about Pequod's ever since I moved to Chicago in 2010. But I never went ... until last week. And now I've been twice in the less than a week. Because the pizza is amazing. The service is great. Everything is amazing. I've ordered the pan pizza twice with friends and it's amazing. The caramelized cheese with a sturdy, yet flaky crust makes an amazing vehicle for the cheese and sauce and toppings. Every bite is a little taste of heaven. I love pizza of all types but this is incredible. It's officially made it's way into the number 2 spot in my list of favorite pizzas, which had been occupied by Lou Malnati's deep dish pizza for over a decade. But now it goes 1) Chicago Pizza and Oven Grinder's pizza pot pies, 2) Pequod's pan pizza, and 3) Lou Malnati's deep dish.
Fun environment & solid food. One of those "this is Chicago" places. Good spot to bring people from out of town (cheese in the shape of a whale!)

You clearly need to make a big decision regarding deep dish pizza, so I'll make this brief and hopefully useful: Pequods makes a solid deep dish. They're "famous" for their carmelized crust, which is really just burnt cheese around the edges. You will wait a very long time to eat it (45 mins from the time you order, that's not counting waiting for your table). You will be tempted to order a salad, because waiting 45 mins to put food in your mouth seems unbearable. The salad will be the saddest excuse for a salad you've seen, a complete waste of stomach space, but you'll be somewhat happy to not be starving anymore. Your pizza will finally arrive almost an hour later, and you will inevitably think it's the best pizza known to man, mainly because your stomach is half-full of sad romaine. But this! This is hot & cheesy and bready. Your rational brain may kick in and remind you: this is merely cheese & sauce on a thick piece of dough -- don't get so excited. Ok, ok, the edges are crispy, and that part is incredible, you wish you could eat a whole pizza made of the edges. You will then wonder: did I just order this monstrous pizza just to eat its edges? Perhaps. Perhaps you did. But that's what people do in Chicago, so there must be something to it. If that didn't help you make your decision, I'll just add: this pizza may not change your life, but it will fill your belly, and sometimes that's good enough. You'll also experience an authentic, bustling, pizza parlor vibe that doesn't feel touristy (except for all the people who are clearly tourists). The beer selection is pretty basic. The servers are all in a hurry, but remain nice enough. And those salads - please don't. There are lots of places in Chicago and beyond that make a tasty deep dish. Little Star Pizza in CA is still my favorite of them all, and they aren't in Chicago. The end.
Favorite deep dish / pan place in the city.

First time in Chicago and Pequod's was the first deep dish pizza place I tried. Now when they say "deep dish", they really mean it. This pizza was super thick, heavy on the cheese, and delicious. Not to mention, one slice was all I needed to fill me up. My group of 5 got a large (8 slices) and we had plenty to go around. I'll definitely be coming back!
Best deep dish in Chicagoland! Worth the wait to have it done right. Plenty of ingredients, great texture to the dough and just the right amount of cheese.. What a pie!!!!!!
Overrated. Way too doughy. The ratio of sauce to bread is way too little. Lou malanatis all day
Ordered a delivery and it was an'effort' to get GrubHub, etc. to pick up even though PP lists them as a service. That said the two pizzas were terrific.

Before you go, know that CARAMELIZED CRUST means the BOTTOM OF YOUR PIZZA WILL BE BLACK. This is not my preference, and had I known before perhaps I wouldn't have gone. But I still give this place 3 stars because the atmosphere was fun, drinks were great, and I had a great time with my friends. The blackness on the pizza is from the fact they put cheese under the crust as well as on top of it, and so the cheese directly touching the pan tends to get really cooked. Personally, I just couldn't get it out of my head that I was potentially eating carcinogens by eating burned crust... but this is certainly not the restaurant's fault! It's just how they do things.
From the pizza places that I've tried, this is one of  the best pan (deep dish) local pizza store in the city. I am pretty sure there are many such places...
Service was poor. One pizza came out cold and watery. Piss poor beer. They took the pan with the cold pizza, and put it in their oven a bit longe. There was a half eaten slice of pizza in the pan.

I don't get deep dish, or 'stuffed', pizza. And I LOVE pizza. It has all the components that I love - it's carb-y, and cheesy, and messy, and goopy - but the whole thing just never is as satisfying as I'd like it to be.Pequod's gets great reviews, and maybe this is where mine should end: I am not a fan of deep dish. But THAT said, it's claim to fame are charred cheesy edges. These are nice, and different, and give a deep flavour to the edges of each slice. Based on a recommendation posted to Serious Eats, we got a basic pie with extra sauce, extra cheese. The sauce at Pequod's is great: zesty but not overpowering. But...yeah. I just didn't enjoy it. It was too "bread"-y, and one-note (gosh, I sound insufferable). Not helping was the caesar salad we got in a bid to offset the pizza; it was just leaves with a gloomy dressing and hard croutons. I think we were both envisioning something a little more, well...special, somehow.Super friendly attentive staff, though! So there's (definitely) that.Yelp note: EXTRA SAUCE PLZ (this I stand by!)
Pizza is super tasty. Make sure to get it well done and extra cheese.  Again place is always packed so call ahead of time if you are on a schedule.
Awesome deep dish. I love getting extra sauce and extra cheese, I learned that from my friend Eric. He is skinny, but he knows how to order some good deep dish pizza.

I thought I didn't like deep dish pizza. Then I ate a pedquods. I apologize for now for my immature dislike of something so damn good. Best pizza in Chicago. Absolutely loved it and could unfortunately eat many many more. So delicious.  Pizza was available late as well which is great after a fun night in Chicago. A must try!

Pretty darn good but  not earth shattering.  We showed up around 5:00 pm before the rush.  Parking was available and pizza came out pretty fast.  I think our server forgot about us as we sat there for about 20 minutes waiting for the check.  I'd try it again though.

My favorite deep dish pizza in Chicago. Eating at the restaurant takes a lot of patience as the wait times are usually very long. I ate there the first few times but got tired of it, figured that it would be more convenient to just carry out and enjoy the pizza at home. The spinach and jalapeno combination of deep dish is my favorite.

It's not that it's terrible, it's good, but not anything special. I took the L and walked pretty far out of my way to try it as I heard so many good things. Disappointed to feel I've had the same tasting pizza at the chain pizza places on the west coast. I guess I had to give it a try when I came for a visit to Chicago.

Came so highly recommended to us as the best deep dish in Chicago. Nope, not even close. We had olive and mushroom, the toppings weren't even cooked. The sauce was bland and the salad was hohum. We got seated quick and the service was good but the star of the show wasn't really a star.
Very good service and food we split the appetizer platter and had a personal pan pizza. Not your typical deep dish ver good crust a bit thinner pizza game changer you must try if you love pie!
Hands down, best pizza in Chicago. If anyone tells you differently, they're lying. Thin crust or pan, both are amazing. The Chicago chain pizza restaurants can't even compare.

Bruh. Why does this place exist and can I have one for Christmas? Best pizza in the city, hands down. I don't even like deep dish pizza and I will eat an entire pan pizza by myself and not share. The burnt, crispy crust is the business. The sauce and toppings are fresh and tasty. My go to for pizza.
SOOO Good. Really really good if you like pizza in the form of pizza bread style.. hope that makes sense. So yummy in my tummy!

After seeing the restaurant on the travel channel and we were going to be in the Windy City, we needed to stop in and try. It was a Sunday evening and my wife called to see what the wait would be in an hour. They told her no wait. When we arrived, the place was packed and the wait time was 30-60 minutes for 2. This isn't necessarily their fault. You can't predict rushes of customers. Maybe a better way to say it would be there shouldn't be a wait but we can't guarantee anything. This was only the beginning of our wait. It was suggested that we can also sit at the bar, which is full service. We went upstairs and found 2 seats at the bar. The 2 bartenders were very nice and attentive. They had about 8 beers on tap, all light and hoppy so we stuck with water. We ordered a small Caesar salad to share and 2 individual pan pizzas. About 20 minutes later, the salad arrived. After waiting that long for a salad, it should have arrived in a bowl that had just been woven by master craftsmen. It didn't. It was a small salad, enough for 2 to share if your not very hungry. The dressing was very good. Nice taste of Parmesan. We waited just under an hour for our 2 personal pizzas. There is no excuse for that kind of wait without letting the customers know so they can chose whether they want to stay or not. We weren't given that option and we had walked for an hour to get here. The redeeming things were the staff and the pizza. I ordered a personal pan with sausage, pepperoni and garlic. It was delicious. Probably the best pan pizza I have had. We at at Lou Malnati's last time and, in my opinion, this was far superior a pizza. The caramelized crust was awesome. The sausage, our bartender told us, was made just for the restaurant and had a fantastic flavor and consistency. The sauce was a little sweeter than I usually like but with the crust and toppings, it was perfect. If not for the wait, I would go back again. Maybe try at another time. Pizza gets a 5 star rating. Wait time for pizza gets 1 star. Averages out to 3 stars.

Ordered delivery on a Friday. Never making the mistake of ordering here again and will take every opportunity to dissuade others. Wrote a much longer review but deleted, because why spend the time?Terrible pizza (yet always seem to order once a year thinking it'll get better). Rude and unprofessional customer service. Waited over two hours for delivery (was quoted 1:30 when ordered, again when I called to get an eta after 1:30, and can be seen clearly on my receipt). The manager(?) was incredibly rude and called me a liar about the quoted time ("I doubt you were told 1:30 - we train our girls to say 1:30-2 hours). Looks like some retraining is required starting with you sir. Life is too short to deal with people like this. Point is...Many pizza joints that are much better and treat their customers with respect. Why bother with this bready, bland and sad pizza from an establishment that apparently doesn't value their customers? Easy decision and easy to remedy this situation before insulting a paying customer as well as your female employees.
This was my first experience with Chicago style pizza. Holy cow - worth the wait! (Because if you wanna eat there- there'll probably be one!!) bonus - great left overs!!

Having heard so many praises for Pequod's, I was super excited when I found out we were going to get a delivery of their pizzas for a party on a Friday night.We ordered the pizza on the Wednesday to be delivered on Friday at 7:30pm, the order was confirmed and my friend's credit card was charged. My friend called the next day to amend the order, still confirming the order to be delivered for Friday at 7:30pm. My friend called again on Friday afternoon to confirm the order to be delivered for the previously agreed time, and it was once again confirmed.Friday comes around and we made a little appetizer to be enjoyed while waiting for the pizzas.7:30pm comes around and no pizza.7:45pm, no pizza.8:00pm, still no pizza.We call Pequod's to see how much longer until we were to expect our pizzas. The person on the phone said the ordered was placed, but the kitchen staff didn't want to make the order, so they tossed it out. He said they were going to make it now though. He apologised and gave us a $30 credit to be used on our next order. The pizzas finally came at 9:30pm, 2 hours after the thrice confirmed time and didn't look very good and was super doughy, so I didn't quite like it. I guess the kitchen staff really didn't want to make this order.I'm extremely disappointed with this encounter with Pequod's. What is management doing to the kitchen staff to make them choose to ignore an order simply because they did not want go make it? Or was it just an excuse for them forgetting to put in our order all together? Please fix how you operate your business!

I consider this the best deep-dish in Chicago, but ironically the menu says that they serve "pan pizza." From what I can tell, the main difference is that the crust is slightly less thick/tall, but Pequod's makes up for it with an unprecedented crispy and flavorful crust, which is rewarding given that so many deep-dish crusts are just soggy barriers for the delicious fillings. This place just barely beats Lou Malnati's for best Chicago deep-dish.Read about 4 other top Chicago restaurants on Cat the Critic: catthecritic.wordpress.c…

Fantastic pizza! We love how the cheese was well done on the edges and the crust was perfection. We got there around 1:30 in the afternoon and got into a booth right away. By the time we left there was a long line of people standing along with a few sitting outside. Our waitress was friendly and attentive and we really enjoyed the chill vibe there. Definitely a place to put on your list if you are visiting Chicago.

I could talk about the pizza but it would be a bit of a broken record at this point. I wanted to write a review for the hosts at Pequods. Shout out to the hosts/hostesses at this place for seemingly always being able to keep their cool and get people seated. I get anxiety just thinking about how hard it must be to manage those wait times/tables etc. Good for you guys - keep killing it.

This pizza was awesome... Loved the crust! I had cheese and my brother had sausage and we were both very happy. Service could have been a little better especially since it wasn't busy but the food was great:)

Best pizza I've ever eaten in my entire life! Not even exaggerating... they also have a pretty decent beer selection which makes this place a 5 star review. This is a MUST if you are visiting Chicago!

This is as good as it gets.It'll be busy, but my group of three saw an opening at the bar and went for it.  The bartender was quick to serve us, and always checked in on us.  It was an early afternoon, so we just wanted pizza.  Every bite is fantastic, and I savored for the crust at the end.  Seriously, one of the best pizzas I've ever had.It's very filling.  The 14-inch pizza was too big for the three of us, and this includes two with huge appetites.

Requires a 24 hour advance reservation. At 5:00pm we were told 4 1/2 hour wait unless you call 24 hours in advance for "priority" seating, and then it is an hour wait.    This is my second time trying to eat Pequod's in a week. Will have to wait another year before we came back to town.
The service is nice and the food was fast... the taste was rich... the sauce was a bit much...made it a bit runny...

This was so far out of our way, but I was told by a friend to go.  This hidden gem was worth the trek.   This is a hole in the wall, locals only bar with great pizza.  This is not a tourist stop and shouldn't be.  We were able to get a cold beer and a personal pizza for lunch.  The pizzas were everything I hoped a Chicago pizza should be.  Our service was outstanding.  I was a little concerned when we walked in, but the entire staff did a great job.  They were very friendly.

I know this place has rave reviews, but honestly, I just don't see it. Pros- Delicious and generous toppings (I got the deep dish sausage and peppers)Fast deliveryCons-While the sauce and toppings were amazing, the pizza was a thin layer of cheese followed by 90% bread. And it wasn't the soft "gooey" kind you'd find on a typical pizza. It was super dry and flaky. Very disappointing. I'm glad I was able to say I tried it. But just not worth the hype in my book.
Very good pan pizza, crust with the cheese is awesome generous in the cheese I really liked the sausage and the veggie as well.

This is as legit as it gets to chill with some buddies or significant other in a very casual environment.  The thing to get is there pan pizza and a couple of beers, end of story.  No particular ingredients, anything tastes great!  If you are looking for a good pizza place to visit at night, look no further!  Super chill staff.  You will feel right at home.

Doooooowngrade for delivery - they don't use third parties so you have to call. Understandably it's busy but I got through. Placed an order at 5:30pm. Hour and a half she says. We live 10 minutes away but with my bronchitis and the rain storm figured delivery was the way to go.Got the pizza at 8:30 (double the estimate). Noticed on the receipt the order wasn't put in until 6pm. Received it medium warm and the onion rings were cold - and they forgot the ranch .... straight to garbage and they are my favorite onion rings in Chicago. At least they got the pizza toppings right...?I know you're popular and busy, Pequod's. But at this point you should have a system in place for deliveries. Get it together, P.
Best deep dish in the city! It of course takes about 45 minutes to cook the pizza once you're there, but then it's worth it. Fun neighborhood joint with amazing pizza.

Deep dish pizza is as good as it gets. Pequod's is known for their caramelized crust and the staff is super-friendly. If you want to dine in, I suggest placing a "dine in" order at least a few hours before you go. If you say you'll be there at 7pm, when you get there at 7pm, your food is ready to be served. I don't know if they offer the same service on weekends but definitely call to ask.

Had lunch there last week....servers and bartender, a lady, werevery unfriendly and indifferent.First pizza came out Luke warm, sent it back to re heat.Place isn't horrible, but certainly, imho, not worth a return visit.

IT'S SO GOOD! The crust, man, it's the absolute best. I get the veggie or some variation of a veggie pizza and it's just so good. The service has always been decent. They a little bourgeois  (bougie) though, maybe it's just me. The hostess's for the most part be stale as hell, I tip my 20% boo, boo.  It's alright, I don't if they still doing it, but between 11 AM-3PM M-F they have deals.
Dont get the personal pepperoni pizza. It's very impersonal. Very much lacking in cheese and flavor. Deep dish more like fake dish. Good service though.
This place is a Chicago gem! It's the absolute best. Such a laid back vibe and amazing pizza to go along with it.

THE BEST OF THE BEST! Do not waste your time going to Lou Malnati's or Giordano's. Pequod's is where it's at! I'm from South Jersey and am all about crispy, thin crust pizza. However, I actually debated my deep devoutness and commitment to thin crust pizza after taking just one bite of my personal deep dish mushroom pizza from Pequod's.I would be satisfied eating the crust alone, that's how delicious it really is. The crust is made from basically cheese that crisps and caramelizes while cooking. The inside of the pizza is not as dense as I would have expected from a deep dish pizza. It was creamy, light, and I didn't feel gross after chowing.I could write so much more about how unreal their pizza is, but I would prefer that my mouth stop watering.

Unsure what the hype was about this place. The decor was old smelled kinda raunchy inside? They seated us upstairs in this booth, was about to fall apart. The fan above the table looked like it had not been dusted in years, swallow as the blinds on the window we were sitting by. The waitress was rude and obnoxious, one of them trying to be funny and cute - but she was neither. We ordered drinks (watered down alcohol) got some apps they were good but the smaller had like 3 of each thing, huge plate but minimal food. Then we ordered pizza - the most foul pizza I've ever eaten. The sauce tasted watered down - zero flavor and the pizza dough was not good - I asked if the pizza is always this burnt, she replied no they must've left it in to long - sorry were busy??? Really ? Then the bill came and was way over priced ! Over all if you want something in the upside - the food runner was the most pleasant person in the place and was the only one who was apologetic !Save your time go someplace else who will appreciate you spending about $200.00.

Amazing deep dish. Get the pepperoni, caramelized crust is to die for. The long wait is worth it and the service is generally fast. Put in your deep dish order right away because it does take about 40 minutes. Awesome place to gather with buddies.

Pequods does not have gluten free pizza which I need since I'm a celiac, but my husband wanted to try their pizza so I went with him. He got a deep dish pizza, wine and a salad. There was a 45 minute wait, so I went to grab a gluten free pizza down the street. His pizza arrived at the bar, so I sat down and was eating my pizza as well. The manager came over and told me I couldn't eat my pizza. He also said he needed to ask us to leave. I totally understand there is rules about outside food, so I put the pizza box in my oversized purse, and stopped eating. I thought since the pizza wasn't out that it would be ok. We continued to sit at the bar while my husband (a paying customer) was enjoying his food. The bartender who was very nice came over and asked if my husband needed his food boxed implying we need to go. My husband said he was not finished, and asked if we had to leave. The manager came back over, and aggressively told us he had said we need to leave. I offered to the manager to wait outside with my purse (which had the pizza box in it) while my husband finished. The manager was not having it. I could understand if we were not complying or making a scene, but the manager was totally out of line. My husband barely drank his wine, and had not yet touched his salad. He said he wasn't going to pay for the food if he can't even eat it. The manager said we still had to pay, but couldn't finish. My husband said he wouldn't pay if he can't eat, so the manager took his glass, forks, etc. and threw it all on top of the pizza and told us to leave. This was a terrible example of customer service! I will never go back. This guy seriously had a personal problem, and very unhappy in his own life. I can't believe someone would treat customers like that! Not only did he lose our sale, but we would have came back because my husband actually liked the pizza.

Best pizza in Chicago by far! Im not a fan of crust on any of my food but when I'm eating this pizza its my favorite part. I dined at the one in Morton Grove for my boyfriends 21st birthday & tonight this one. I personally like the Chicago location better but both have just as great pizza & service.

Pick up is the way to go, as the pizza is still piping hot and fresh when you get home. I could eat that carmelized crust all by itself. Hands down, Pequod's has the best crust and pizza. Their proportions are perfect, as I find other places' dough/crust to be too heavy. Their sausage is amazing...really a stand out sausage. I usually get a sausage and pepperoni combo and another with green pepper and onion. While I can eat a lot, pizza is usually filling, but for Pequod's, I make sure I eat at least 4 pan slices since I love it so much. Diminishing utility with the more I consume doesn't really exist here at Pequod's.On another trip, tried the Italian beef and giardiniera. This was on point and they did it right, though sausage remains my preference.To note, I actually prefer NY thin slices but Pequod's pan pizza is that phenomenal.

Decent, but not crazy good for my taste. With so many options of deep dish pizza, I think this one was way too salty and lacked the depth of the tomato taste that I like due to the excessive salty cheese.

Pequod's has the deep dish pizza that I was looking for! We had a late lunch after walking to Pequod's from the Lincoln Park Zoo. It was 30+ minutes for our pizza to arrive, and the wait was worth it! We had the pan pizza with spinach, mushroom, and 1/2 order of sausage (for the husband). You pay for each topping, so we didn't go overboard. Bottom crust was thicker than at Lou's Malnati's which was what I was looking for. The caramelized crust was good and there was a generous amount of toppings. You get full quickly after one piece, but we had to finish it all as we were flying back home that evening. I noticed that the pizza was a bit saltier which was probably due to the cheese. The restaurant was larger than I expected with two levels and there was a private section in the back of the second level. Guess this is a good place for birthdays since we saw several large parties eating here.

This is some of the best deep dish pizza I've ever had in Chicago. It's busy for a reason. Make reservations, it's worth it. Lots of choice. Deep dish, I recommend over thin crust but they were both good. Good appetizers and plenty of choice with the beer selection.Child friendly, they even had creations and drawings for the kids, remember it more like your local bar than a restaurant. Very nice staff.Enjoy

There was so much hype about Pequod's Pizzeria that my husband, a friend, and I finally checked it out. It was extraordinarily busy, but we were seated quite quickly. The service was also prompt despite the norm of having to wait 45 minutes for a stuffed pizza at any establishment. Our server kept appetizers and drinks coming while we waited. The pizza was good. Was it as good as my favorite Chicago stuffed pizza? No, it wasn't quite that good in my opinion. Nevertheless, Pequod's offers a very solid Chicago style pie that everyone should check out at least once.
I'll stick to Giordano's, if I feel like something different Lou Malnati's. The crust was too hard and I didn't care for the sauce.

I had one opportunity to try deep dish pizza. there were several places I could have chose from, but I picked here. I had to wait 30 minutes to be seated, and then another 40 minutes for my pizza. Waiting for your food here is like a quest. Its not easy, and there are times you want to quit. But patience is rewarded with their damn good pizzas. I ordered a medium with pepperoni and sausage. It was just enough for two hungry people, and we were definitely full afterwards. Service is not good, but its not bad either. Our waitress attended to us within a reasonable time, considering it was a full house. The crust gets alot of attention here, but I think the best part is the combination of everything. The main player in this pizza is the bread. Usually a hunk of bread that thick would be dry and disappointing. Here, the pizza is fluffy and moist. The toppings burst with flavor. I still dont know whether I like the pepperoni or the sausage more. The cheese was just enough to be gooey but not overwhelming. They could have added a little more sauce, but I think I preferred it on the less saucy side. the caramel crust was cooked just right, but its not mind blowing as some people make it. Overall, it was an excellent meal. Not too salty, not too greasy, and not too saucy (which gives me heartburn). considering this pizza was neither of these things is quite an accomplishment.

So I have to admit, the waiting for a table and the. The pizza definitely tainted my opinion of this place. I came to Chicago for a conference and had a bit of a reunion with old coworkers, one of which lives in Chicago. She picked this place for us to all have dinner on Sunday of memorial day weekend. The place was packed and there were a lot of us. You can't make a reservation and we ended up waiting close to 2 hours to be seated. We ordered salads and the appetizer sampler to tide us over for when we finally sat down and the had to wait another hour for our pizzas. (For those keeping track, we had to wait 3 hours to eat.) The crust is as amazing as you've heard. Crunchy, caramelized, crispy. The sauce has a bit of a kick to it, which I didn't love. There could have been a little more cheese. Overall, it was good pizza but I was underwhelmed. That could have been from waiting 3 hours to eat, or it could be that I just like pizza the way they make it at home in NYC. Either way,  you have got to try deep dish when in Chicago. I would recommend this place but don't come with a large group. You will wait forever.

Really good pizza. I've had the classics like Lou Malnati's and Giordano's and Uno's but this is great in a different way. The wait (almost an hour) was not fun which is why I took off one star but the service was excellent and the pizza is superb. The sauce is a little sweet which might not be to everyone's tastes but I was really enjoying it. The crust was unique too. It looks kind of burnt but it's actually just carmalized and it has a splendid taste. I'd definitely recommend this place. Good job, Pequod's!

I am not a deep dish pizza person - I grew up on thin crust in our very Italian household - but I must stay this is very good pizza.  Not only that, the ambiance it very fun.  It's always a great place for us to visit during our Christmas Week-end on the city!

This was the first time I had proper pan pizza -- and I loved it! Usually I'm a thin crust type of girl and of course once in a while I  crave my Lou and my Gino's, but pan pizza was never that appealing to me. BF's craving led us to this place, and I immediately loved the ambiance. We were seated upstairs and our order was taken fairly quickly. We started with the combo appetizer and I immediate fell in love with the mozzarella sticks and mushroom poppers. They were hot, crispy and tasted fresh. For the pizza, it took them about 30-40mins to get it to us. We had sausage and pepperoni with 1/2 mushroom and 1/2 peppers. They did not skimp on the toppings. I really liked the bread to cheese to topping proportion for the most part, and with just a drop of cholula, I loved my bites. We had 2 leftover pieces from a medium pizza, and when eating it the next day, I could taste the bread way more than anything else and that's when the proportion seemed off.Other than that, I definitely enjoyed my time there.

If you want cheese on cardboard then this is the place to come to. I think many of the good reviews come from the fact that it is open late and we all know that after alcohol just about anything is good. The crust was super dry and was covered with a thin layer of cheese. The waitress seemed quite disinterested in customer service. I would recommend any of the other local chains over this place.

This is the pizzeria you go to in Chicago if you don't want to feel like a tourist. Lou Malnati's and Giordano's may be more famous, but I couldn't care less. Pequod's serves the best pizza in Chicago! Their secret is layering the edge of the pan with cheese so that it's baked into the crust, giving it an amazingly delicious flavor that's highly addicting. The pizzas are made to order and you can pick and choose whatever toppings you want. Because of this, it could take 20-40 minutes to get your pizza, but that's totally fine because you can kill time with pitchers of beer or whatever sporting event is on at the time.

Pizza is one of the best you'll have. Definitely 5 stars. Downfall: the wait is excruciating (especially when you're hungry). Also, up stairs can get a little hot since they don't have A/C. The seating is definitely tight. This place is super popular so as long as you have the right expectations on waiting times, you'll enjoy it!

I came to Chicago for one thing. DEEP DISH PIZZA. Lunch special. $4.99 Monday-Friday. 11am-3pm. The special includes cheese pizza with a soda.  If this was available back in Los Angeles, you would find me here everyday.I added sausage, pepperoni and mushroom. It does take awhile for it to be cooked roughly 30-45 minutes. Totally worth it. The pizza is a bit bready but I totaled love it. Especially the burnt crisp. Ugh i'm salviating as I write this and wish I could eat it right now.Definitely a personal size is perfect for a person and I eat quite a LOT. I was totally stuffed after eating this.This spot is the spot. I tried the other competitors and this one ended up being my favorite. I came here twice before leaving Chicago. Now i'm sad that I can't eat this pizza anymore.

Goodness gracious this place is magical. My favorite Chicago pizza spot by far. I take everyone visiting the city here and have yet to find an unimpressed customer that I've brought in. If you're planning on lunch, you should be able to get a table pretty quick. Towards the late afternoon/dinner time, I'd recommend making a reservation. LONG wait times, so be prepared otherwise!

Possibly the best pizza I have ever had. What i liked most was that it wasnt overly cheesy like some other Chicago establishments. Be warned that portions are huge - my gf and i couldnt finish a small pizza.

Some of the greatest pizza in Chicago, and you can trust me since I know pizza. The crust is a game changer, cheese is real nice and gooey. Wait times can be long, but bearable. I'd suggest a seat at the bar for best service.
This place is fine but I don't know why anyone raves about it. There is better pizza in Chicago.

This is my first time visiting Chicago (lifelong Californian) and I was blown away by the deep dish pizza here. I didn't know pizza could be this good! Great service, great experience. Pequod's will be my go-to pizza place for the rest of my assignment here.

This place is great.   Best pizza in Chicago.  Now the wait is unbelievable   I called the day prior and asked if I could make reservations.   Well they don't do reservations but you can call ahead.  So I called ahead at 4pm for a table at 7pm and a when we got there they said there would be a 90 min wait.   So please order ahead and the best thing to do is take out.   It's very good.   I have tried a variety of pizzas in Chicago and this one is the best.

The pizza is phenomenal, but only if you dine in. Otherwise it turns out like the picture below. And unfortunately this has happened via delivery multiple times. Perhaps a message can be relayed to the delivery drivers - quality trumps speed.

I'm so torn about Pequod's. I know a lot of people love it, even close friends of mine, but I find it really basic. I've tried it on a few occasions--twice for takeout, and recently I stopped in to eat at the restaurant. It's definitely bready and more of a pan pizza than a deep dish, at least to me. I find that with takeout just getting it with plain cheese wasn't enjoyable. It just congeals and also loses its crispy texture underneath. I think the toppings are what offset the breadiness of the crust. That being said, the caramelized crust is really delicious, even as leftovers. My husband and I stopped in a few weeks ago on a Saturday night around 4pm. It was already pretty busy but it was only a 20 minute wait for a table, and they told us pizzas were taking 50 minutes. We got a table upstairs that was in the corner, which was nice. Our waitress was nice but I have to say the service was extremely disappointing. It took forever just to get a drink and our appetizer came out and was the wrong thing. A few tables around us also received wrong orders. We shared the house salad with ranch, and the dressing was really tasty. The wings, once we got the correct ones, were pretty crispy and had a nice BBQ sauce.Our pizza ended up taking almost an hour and a half to get to us and by this point we were starving even after apps. It was very cheesy and had good flavor. I like their sauce, it's not too sweet or too tangy. We did half with sausage and onion and half with cheese. I definitely prefer the side with toppings-- it offsets how thick the crust is. Eventually our area started to get really crowded and there was a big group of drunk people that snuck past the host and were trying to order pizza without waiting. The waitstaff just kind of let it happen, which was frustrating because it caused us to have to wait a really long time to get our check and leave.Overall I think the pizza is good, and I don't mind eating it, but I don't find it special. I also think that other Chicago "deep dish" varieties like Lou's are much better and have a much more enjoyable ambiance at their locations. Dining in at Pequod's was crowded, slow, hot, and just not worth it.

If I could give zero stars I would. Awful delivery experience. After waiting 2 hours for the pizza, it was wrong. When I called I was told they would send out another pizza but that I'd have to wait another 2 hours despite this being a restaurant mistake! I asked to speak to the manager and was rudely placed on hold for 10+ minutes. The manager lied to me saying she would get out the corrected pizza to me in an hour .... it has been another 2 hours and still NO pizza!!! To say they're lack in customer service, lack in management, and overall rudeness leaves a lot to be desired!!! I would expect at the very least for the restaurant to offer me a gift card for my inconvenience! I would highly recommend getting your pizza elsewhere!
The best deep dish pizza in Chicago. Hands down. Small(ish) so come early or plan on a short wait.
Best deep dish pizza in the city! Generally always a wait when you dine in, so plan accordingly. However their pizza is worth the wait.

My favorite deep dish place in Chicago!!! I love that they are open until 2:00 AM, which means I can satisfy my late night cravings. You can do RESERVATIONS (priority seating) online! Convenient, and if for whatever reason the time or day is already reserved, the manager will e-mail you telling you a different time or day he can do. We had a group of 14 on a Saturday and they were jam packed! We were seated on the second floor because of our bigger group. They gave us 5 high raise circle tables because they didn't have the shorter rectangle ones. That was the only weird part because some people had to deal with "indents" where they were sitting. Like you can just imagine connecting 5 small circle tables in a row and how some people would get stuck in the part where two tables meet. BUT I DIDN'T CARE, because the most important part was seeing my friends. I'm just letting you know in case you plan on bringing a big group on a busy day. [They do allow you to split 14 credit cards, it's a hassle but we didn't have cash]I also can't comment on the service, but because they were busy, you can't expect the constant service. They seemed to have plenty of workers, but still couldn't keep up with the crowd demands, The waiters were flying all over the place and I struggled to find my waiter maybe 2-3 times and kept going to other waiters. But none of them were rude about helping me even though we weren't their table. A funny thing I noticed is that they waiters have a habit of dropping plates (used) or glasses on the ground! I think there were 3 major spills during the 3 hours we were there.

This was my second time visiting Chicago and I've had the opportunity to try about 10 different deep dish pizza restaurants. All have been very very good. Tuff to even put them in order; but Pequods has become my favorite. Amazing sauce, sausage, peppers and cheese. I also like the way they bake theirs a little bit more than most places, therefore the crust is crunchy. The wait time could be up to an hour, just like all the other popular pizza places, depending on what time/day you go. Nice local crowd creates a great ambiance as well.
Easily one of the best pizza places in Chicago! Always a long line since the food is so good!

Yeh ..... I don't get it.  These are so many great reviews on this place. We tried what would be proclaimed to be the best pizza in the universe and it felt very short. The crust was mediocre at best the cheese had no flavor and the marinara sauce very bland. I was with a party of five... We ate it but we didn't feel like it was that great. Sorry!
The best pizza in Chicago hands down! The pizza does take a while to bake but when you have it it's definitely worth every bite! I love the crust, every bit is crunchy on the crust!
Wonderful pan pizza with a delightful golden ring of cheese baked around the crust. Not "deep dish" in the classical Chicago sense, but damn good pizza!

I hate to give this place a one star , specially because I love the pizza here . But every time I come here i could never sit in a booth ! I get it it's always busy but today is a Monday ... maybe 5 tables were being used I requested a booth that was available and I was told no ! So I don't understand why not if there's was no wait behind me ? They just wanted to sit me in a tiny table in the middle mind you I just had knee surgery that does not allow me to sit in high chairs . But when I requested a booth I could t even explain that to the girl because  she didn't even let me finish telling her why I was requesting a booth . Sadly I had to just walk out because I couldn't get a booth and I couldn't sit in a highchair .

Every time I visit Chicago, I go out of my way to make it to Pequod's. The crust is buttery, flaky and perfectly crisp. According to them, the crust is caramelized. The cheese, sauce and toppings make this some of the best pizza I've ever had. On my most recent visit, I came at lunchtime and got the 7 inch personal pizza with sausage and black olives. The lunch special comes with a fountain drink for $4.95. I added the toppings so my total was under $7.50. It was delicious and cheap!A few things to note:*It takes awhile to get your pizza (at least 30 minutes but could be 45 minutes if they are busy), so if you are in a hurry, probably not your best bet.*They have great craft beer choices to go with your pizza.*It can get really busy so lunch or a weeknight be a good option.*You MUST go here :)Make sure to check out this amazing pizza place if you live or are in Chicago!
Excellent! great deep dish pizza amazing thin crust. The staff is always friendly and the ambiance is great. By far the best pizza in the city!!!!

After asking everyone we encountered for a pizza recommendation we ended up here.... apparently this is where the locals go! The restaurant has 2 floors and nothing out of this world in terms of appearance. Staff was very nice, we ordered their deep dish Supreme. The pizza was good but if I was to go again I would stick to just plain cheese or pepperoni as I think the combination of the sauce and toppings was overwhelming but tasty nonetheless. The garlic cheese bread is highly recommended. I have a good overall experience and would recommend.

This place is SOOOO hyped up, so I figured I would order it one Sunday when bored. This is typical pizza nothing fancy or extra about it. Being in Chicago you have to stand out... very disappointed. Not in the place per say, but more in the people must have had some terrible pizza in there life to consider this "the best"

I'm torn. Pequod's is a great pizza, however my latest experience has me thinking I won't be ordering there anytime soon. We called in a delivery order at 5:30pm and did not get our pizza until 9:15pm. I couldn't believe it. When I called to check on the status at 8pm, the kitchen had not even gotten the order. The woman on the phone intimated that there was nothing she could do, and snidely asked if I wanted to talk to the manager. I spoke with him and he assured me he'd put the order in and have it sent out first thing. That took another 1:15 hours (I live 0.8mi from the restaurant). It's really unfortunate because it's good pizza, but just buyer-beware on deliveries... you may wait a long time. Pizza isn't worth a ~4 hour wait.

I had the pan pepperoni.The pizza breaks down like this: 90% cardboard flavored crust, 4% mediocre sauce, 5% ashes of what was formerly cheese 1% razor thin pepperoni.This how a pizza would be made if the only consideration was maximizing the profit, as the cheapest ingredients dominate way beyond what is palatable; then handed off to an incompetent cook staff to burn any flavor right out of the pie.Will not be returning.
This place is ridiculous. DO NOT GO HERE. We put a reservation in and they said we s STILL have to wait for over an hour. Plus the PIZZA is terrible.

Pequod's has really gone downhill in recent years. The wait times are the usual for deep dish pizza (~40-60 mins) but then you often wait longer because of the hype. However, the last time I went my pizza wasn't cooked in the middle (cold, still-raw dough), even after all that time. I feel like a few years ago (like 2012-14ish) the crust was less bread-y, and had more flavor. The last couple times I've gone, I've been disappointed in both the food and the service. The servers are unsmiling and rushed. It was my go-to place to take visiting tourists, but now I'll take them up to Burt's instead.
Pequod's is one of the best pizza places in the city. It's a small, friendly environment with good food and drinks. It gets crowded at dinner time so come a bit early to avoid long wait times!

First time at pequods we went on Saturday night with a reservation and when we arrived my reservation didn't mean anything at all! So we went somewhere else because there was a 2 hour wait time and they couldn't accommodate us even with a reservation. "They said it moves your wait time up to an hour!"We returned the next day Sunday for lunch and there was no wait time luckily!! We had the individual pizza with mushrooms and half sausage.  It was yummy the think pan crust was crunchy and sauce was in between not too sweet or tart. Surprisingly I was expecting a lot a lot of cheese like giordianos pizza but not at all for a change!I liked it and will try it again on an empty stomach. And lastly there's a second floor yay I thought they only had one floor more seating hooray!!
I finally went and now know what the fuss is about.GREAT pizza and good service. Be prepared to wait.I have ordered from here for delivery too.  The place and environment are worth it though.

Being from NJ/NY area we are big on pizza in general. I have a couple spots in Jersey that make a good deep dish. So, we tried Giordanos because it's the "best", along with pizza uno too. Giordanos sucked, I can get better pizza at 7/11.So, we get to Pequod's I order a personal pie and it was incredible, half onions and half sausage. It was a solid 8.5-9 . Crust was perfect, some deep dish places or pizza in general get a flaky crust and I can't stand it. Their pizza sauce had an interesting twist to it, not sure if it had wine/brandy/sherry in it. But man what a delicious twist.Great job and we didn't wait too long either
Hands down the best pan / deep dish pizza in Chicago. The fresh locally sourced veggies, the pizza crust, the sauce are all top notch!!!!!!

They're making pizza the right way here. I'm not a huge fan of the traditional Chicago deep dish style- but Peaquod's really nails it.The pizza pub atmosphere is great for a few draft beers and a couple slices. They make the pizza in such a way that the crust and end of the pizza is carmelized giving a crunchy bite of cheese. It's simply good, and unique from the other deep dish spots in the area.Can't miss this one!

The staff was wonderful and amicable, but the pizza was not as tasty and delectable as expected for a highly reviewed Chicago Deep Dish Pizza eatery.  I must say, I was highly disappointed as this restaurant has received high accolades for the taste of the pizza, and I didn't experience that wonderful taste as mentioned in the reviews.  The dough had no flavor, and it was just toppings on a pizza nothing fantastic.  Papa Johns and MOD pizza were better tasting.  The staff again was wonderful they just need to improve on the pizza.

This was our final deep dish pizza experience before we left Chicago, and it did not disappoint, the crust was nice and crispy and the pizza had a nice velvety texture, plus the sauce was quite tasty. We didn't have to wait for a table which was nice

The food is great, the rattlesnake of a host leaves a bit to be desired.  But the wait staff is friendly and Noelle was very attentive even though she was the only server there.  Wings are good.  Sausage and Pepperoni Large pie was delicious.

Diner in once before and thought it wasn't up to snuff relative to the other deep dish offerings in the area.  Got delivery tonight and it was nonsense.  It was like a focaccia bread with absolutely minimal toppings.  Multiple slices had (barely) 1 of the 2 toppings we ordered.  This was an embarrassment.  Complete joke.  Never again.  Only plus was fast delivery.  Try Chicago's Pizza or Art of Pizza nearby.

Great pizza- questionable service.  Spent over 80 dollars and they switched servers on us mid meal- no word on it, just new server- who checked on us pre food and to package up leftovers- which they then threw away.  Disappointing because the food really was very tasty- and would have made a good lunch.  Oh well- next time we will be a little less easygoing and will have better service to go along with our delicious food.

In a city filled with pizza joints, I don't see the HUGE appeal of Pequod's. Is their pizza good, sure, there are lots of good pizzas out there. Just don't see anything that sets them apart. Having said that, I'd go back if others insist. Service was fine, pricing in line with other similar pizza places.
I'm a thin crust fan but Pequods is my favorite deeper dish. The wait is long but the pizza is worth it.

The deep dish pizza is a must-try and a cannot miss. Enjoy delicious toppings, quality ingredients and friendly service. Be warned - bathrooms are a little rough, but they also have a late night bar so that would explain it.

Hands down, best deep dish pizza in the city. I have tried several places throughout the city and there's a reason there's always a wait for this place despite the number of tables it has. Plus the prices can't be beat. You'll pay more at any of the big 4 pizza places (Gino's, Giordano's, Lou's, Uno). If you want just one slice, head to Art of Pizza. You're welcome in advance.

An embarrassing example of Chicago deep dish pizza. Check out the picture I posted that shows large hunk of bread with a tiny layer of cheese on top. A lot of the pictures look great with that burnt crust and all. But what you are not seeing is that there is almost no cheese on this "pizza". I was sorely disappointed after checking out the pics, seeing their high rating, I was expecting much more. Hopefully you read this in time so you can save your hard earned money for a more substantial pizza.  What they serve here is disgraceful.

Not impress at all... Came in on a Wednesday night before the rush and the pizza was just basically bready. Major lack of sauce and cheese!! Our pizza wasn't even cut symmetrically, let alone it was even barely cut we have to use the pizza scooper to get a finer cut before putting it on to the plate. Been yearning to try this place out but left pretty disappointed. We got a sausage and pepperoni pizza and those two ingredients were point on. But the sauce and cheese was a different story. All of the tomato sauce fell onto the crust of the pizza and I like pizza crust and all but our pizza crust was burnt! So I wasn't even able to enjoy it as much. The thickness of the bread was major carb overload. Not enough cheese and sauce to balance it out at all. If anything, I say get thin crust so you won't be as disappointed as I am. But I never had thin crust so I'm not sure if it's any better.
As always, Pequods is amazing pizza.  You will have a wait but it's phenomenal pizza and great calamari.
Stop looking for a better Pizza any way I see it they are tops in Chicago. But why the name of Moby Dicks boat? Interesting fact! Great place to go!

We're a pizza hut household however when we want a fancier pizza option we typically go to Bricks, Stella Barra or Pequod's. Pequod's pan pizza is un-matched and so delicious. It's perfect for movie nights and has a relaxed, casual atmosphere I appreciate. I just wish they had more locations and weren't always so busy!

I ordered a pizza for delivery and they told me an hour and 10 minutes. Which I was fine with. Almost 2 hours in when I still haven't received my pizza I called and shawna? picked up the phone. When I asked why it's taking this long, she said "that's how Pequod's is". What kind of answer is that? I then said well why don't you tell people 2 hours instead of lie and say only an hour? She said "that's how Pequod's is. I asked for a manager and she hung up the phone on me. Horrible customer service! I will not be ordering from this place ever again and I hope this review helps other people if they don't receive there food when they were told they were going to get it.

Major disappointment. It was the crust/base.  At this place deep dish means a whole lot of bread with a small amount of toppings.  We went to Giordano's and Lou Malnati's the two nights prior and based on the reviews thought we were saving the best for last.  Nope!  It was ok but certainly not in the same league as the others.  Way too much dough and average quality toppings. Waitress was ok, decor was like a dive bar (which I like when the food is outstanding), wouldn't recommend and wouldn't go back.
Pretty damn good deep dish! The tomato bisque soup was also yummy. The appetizer sampler wasn't that great, but we ordered it since we knew the wait would be long. If not for the app, 5 stars!

With chains like Giordano's and Lou Malnati's serving up deep dish in Chicago, Pequods is certainly a hidden gem. However, it is my FAVORITE deep dish pizza in Chicago and I never fail to mention it to those looking to try deep dish for the first time. I took my family here and they also agreed it was the best pizza they've ever had.There's more of a sports bar vibe from Pequods than from the other chain restaurants, it's often dark, open late, and there can be tons of people depending of if there's a game or not. What sets Pequods apart is their crust on the deep dish. It's perfectly cooked so that it's carmelized and crispy which makes the pizza that much better. You can't get crust like that elsewhere. Keep in mind that deep dish pizza can take a while to cook so either be prepared to wait (it's worth it) or order some appetizers in the mean time. On weekdays, you can call in and order ahead of time so that the pizza will come out faster once you've arrived. They also don't take reservations so on weekends and nights when there's a sporting event get there early or be prepared to put down your name and wait.

I start to say pizza at its best! Although service need some work. I ordered my food 45 minutes in advance. Got there and hostess was not pleasing me at all. I Asked for regular monthly table, and she lost it. Finally, gave in and embarrasses her self in front of other customer. When I sat down pizza took another 45 minutes. Hostess name : Stacy I will come back for pizza and hope for better service.

If you are into more bread, less cheese, then this is the place for you. The 5 Star point was the sauce. The one star point was the rude waitress, she corrected everything we said, seemed so bothered by our existence, very frustrating.

Their bartender(?)/manager behind the bar warmly greeted us as we walked in. Deep dish pizza isn't my thing, so not going to rate based on that. On the other hand, my friend had a thin slice pizza and she said she's had better, "it was ok". I LOVED my tomato bisque/soup paired with bread and butter. I ordered plain wings as well with ranch on side-- chicken is chicken. My only qualm is the hipsters loitering by the bar. I'm not sure if they were workers on the clock (pretty slow evening; 12a) or they're just hanging out. Regardless, they took away from our server's potential attentiveness. They were loud, obnoxious, and kept talking to our waitress, while we were trying to get her attention for the check. If they were off the clock employees, I don't care how slow the place is, they need to take it down a notch and stop impeding on the server's job. It's like, you want to tip a server, but why would you tip someone who's just bringing you your food, and not checking up on you on a timely manner or to see if we're waiting on you to take the check because your back is towards us blabbering with your friends/coworkers. Shit, if im tipping you for satisfying bare minimum, leave the food at the bar and I'll pick it up myself. Regardless, because I know how entitled most millennials/this generation is, I'm forced to tip, for social courtesy.

I ate the crust and I don't usually eat crusts. I ordered onion, garlic, green bell pepper, and spinach. There were a lot of toppings, so many toppings they were coming off the pizza and I even got a bonus green olive and some red peppers. I was full after 1-1/2 slices. The only downside was over an hour for delivery, but luckily I wasn't hungry when I ordered.

Definitely 3.5-4 stars. We waited over 1 hour to be seated, even though we were supposedly on a priority seating list. The restaurant itself was really neat- two stories but still very cozy. We waited over an hour for our deep dish pizza to come (our waitress thought they might have forgotten about it). It was good, but if this is the best deep dish pizza gets, I guess I'm just not a fan. The beers on tap were excellent and overall I enjoyed the experience.
Best Chicago pizza hands down the crust is amazing. Extra red sauce is key.
Open opinion time, peqouds is my new favorite Chicago deep dish pizza place. This location is big and the servers are friendly though it seems a bit unorganized as we had a few people waiting on us.

I don't get it. I'm more of a thin crust pizza gal, but even so, there's just way too much crust and not enough sauce. Then if you order extra sauce / ranch dressing to make the pizza more palatable, they charge you extra. $2 for a ramekin of bottled ranch dressing? Come on. And it takes a good 45 minutes for the pizza to come.  Why there is constantly a line outside, I will never understand. I can check the box on this place and don't ever have to go back now.

It was deep dish pizza and it was good but it was not mind blowing. The style of the restaurant is more "Bar-like" not super family friendly. Overall, the pizza was good but I also would have been happy with Round Table.

Came here once as it came highly recommended.  I'd say it's my second favorite deep dish to Lou's.  Had to get extra sauce which I'd recommend to break the huge amount of cheese on the pie.  We waited probably an hour before we were able to get some bar seats which was fine.  I'd go back, but not worth waiting a long time.

This was my first time in Chicago and I couldn't have the complete tourist experience without a taste of deep dish pizza.  This place definitely delivered!  I'm a New York pizza kinda girl and a little skeptical about this infamous deep dish pizza but the caramelized crust is absolutely delicious and all the oooey goooey cheese is what dreams are made of.  You do have to wait a while for the pizza but I am telling you it is totally worth it.

Good pizza, but don't ever order this place for catering or delivery. 3 times I've called 48 hours before, and they ALWAYS lose the order.They have no system in place to keep them straight. The answer I always get is "the register prints it up the day you call, but it was put in the wrong place in the kitchen". You may say, "Why not just call the same day?" To that I say, "Because they don't open until 10 and if I need a lunch catering order, they wouldn't have enough time to fulfill it." When I called today to check where our 11:45 order was (it was 11:50 when I called). After the person answering the phone couldn't find the order, then I was put on hold and a manager came to the phone, I was told "they were running late", when I asked how late, they said it would be here at 12:45! This is NOT A TYPO! They were going to be an entire hour late!! I asked if they WERE "running late" how come no one could find my order when I called?? I told them to NOT LIE about it and just admit that they lost/misplaced the order AGAIN!! They FINALLY arrived at 1:15! An hour and 1/2 hour later than I needed it for a meeting! I'd have stopped using them all together after the 2nd screw up, but occasionally someone from our office wants it instead of Malnati's. But after this time, I am done (at least they credited me for the entire order. Doesn't make it less embarrassing in front of a client when lunch is 90 minutes LATE! Get it together, guys!

Lovveee their deep dish (pan pizza)! I would seriously rank this place as my second or first choice for deep dish in Chicago! I have a group of friends whom which we go to a different pizza joint every week. We have tried Giordanos, Ginos, Lous, Piece, Dantes, Boiler Room and this place is a great place for deep dish! Service at the restaurant was great! Our waitress was very friendly and took good care of us... she joked around with us the entire time we were there. Another thing I really appreciated about this place was that we told a staff member who brought the pizza to the table that we were excited to try this pizza and wanted to compare to other we have tried. He instead of bashing or bad mouthing other pizza joints given he works there instead talked about other pizza joints he visits or which other pizza he would recommend we tried! I thought that was pretty awesome!I will def be back in the near future to have more of that yumminess!!!

I've been hearing about Peqoud's for a while now and finally decided to give it a shot. I ordered a sausage and pepperoni pan pizza and a side of mozzarella sticks for delivery. I called at 11am, as soon as they opened, and was told it would take 1 hour 15 minutes. It ended up being 2 hours before the pizza arrived, which was extremely frustrating as the estimated time they gave me was totally off.Already hangry by the time it finally arrived, I was praying it was worth the wait. The mozzarella sticks weren't cooked very well and were pretty bland. The pizza itself was very good and unlike some other pizza places, they didn't skimp on the toppings. There were plenty of huge pieces of sausage and pepperoni and I was sufficiently full after 2 pieces.Overall the pizza was delicious, but not delicious enough to justify the wait. Maybe I'll try dining in sometime in the future, but I'm not in a rush anytime soon.

After disappointing tries of the deep dish all around Chicago, Pequod's met the mark. Pequod's serves personal deep dish pizzas at a very reasonable price and minimal wait time. I would go back again, if I was in the neighbourhood!

I tried Lou's but I liked Pequads better the inside of the restaurant is darker and the pizza crust and bottom are burnt in those big black pans they use. Great sauce it's near the Lincoln park area which is a pretty cool area of Chicago go there and be prepared to be full!

My friends and I went here for a late lunch and it was my only experience of deep dish pizza while in Chicago. The place was packed, even at 3 PM on a Saturday afternoon but we were seated promptly. The service was sufficient, nothing to write home about. The pizzas were tasty, very generous on the toppings and the marinary sauce was yummy! We had the house made meatballs (10/10 would recommend) and ham and pineapple and both were pretty tasty. The wait time is about 40 minutes so make sure you put your order earlier rather than later.

YES!believe all the buzz and fuzz you read online! this place is great.  The service is great, the food comes out fast even though they are BUSY...Friendly wait staff and the pizza! oh the pizza! it's so good!Only negative part is sometimes the wait, but it's totally worth it!
It is indeed American style but not as good as the one I tried in Central Chicago. The outlook is ugly even though the price is really fair.
Amazing amazing pizza!!!!  Best deep dish ever!!!  Loved it!!!!  Will be back for sure !!!

Pequod's and a movie - could there BE a better date night? Nope!Located right across the street from Regal Webster Place 11, Pequod's has THE best deep dish pizza. I'm not generally a deep dish fan but the caramelized crust can't be beat. Also, their deep dish tends to be on the saucy side which is key for me.The place itself is authentic, narrow and too damn crowded. I prefer the second floor where there's slightly more elbow room. We always call in advance to make a reservation, thereby cutting the wait time in half.

Pequod's stole a pizza my heart. This is the best 'za in town! My wife and I dined in last weekend and are still talking about that caramelized crust! I don't think we'll be eating Giordano's anytime soon. The service was great too. Erin and Alan took good care of us...my mouth was watering when that first slice got cut and placed gently on my dinner plate. Goodness, I've gotta get back to this joint ASAP. God Bless Pequod's! PS - If for some strange reason you don't like the pizza from this spot, you're a weirdough!
My husband a huge fan, Pizza crust made by angels. Not sure how they get it to crispy - yet thick; sauce and toppings were excellent. Fast service- friendly - parking ok

I went to this place with high expectations........I will say that i think it was below my expectations. We waited about 1.5 hours to be seated. The best part was that there is a bar "The Drinkingbird" next door and we were able to drink and wait there so that worked out. I'm pretty easy going so the wait didnt bother me....tequila makes everything better anyway. I think i did myself a disservice by ordering the deep dish in a "personal" size.  We ordered two personal sized deep dish pizzas so that we could try two different types. I think you definitely gotta go for a bigger pizza to get the full effect. We also ordered the sampler appetizer and i really enjoyed that. I'm definitely going to give this place another shot next time I visit chicago to confirm my feelings! lol Thanks guys!
The place is awesome the personal deep could feed a army I ate 1/3 of the pizza and was stuffed. I have also tried the Italian beef there one of the best.
Great delivery service and good prices. The deep dish was a bit too "bready" but overall, it was good.
Came here late on a weekday evening. Their pan pizza is so good!! Wasn't busy at all, had a good time.

I last had Pequods 8 years ago and it was outstanding ..so I was so looking forward to picking up my pizza. I ordered at 4:30 told it would be ready in an hour. Arrive at 5:30 give my name and pay for the pizza ( large deep dish pepperoni and sausage ).  5:45 I ask after 3 people get their carry out pizza who arrived after me "when can I expect my pizza ". Young lady states I don't know ". I wait another 10 minutes watch 2 more people receive their pizzas and ask the young lady Is there a problem.  She asks my name  and she looks and says it just came up but she needs to take a few more tickets because they're backed up.. A manager appears and has a brief conversation and takes the tickets ..I'm waiting it's now 6:15.  He comes out with three pizzas mine is on top!  I take the pizza and despite the wait anxious to get home and taste it!  I've had deep dish pizza and this pizza was way too much like pizza bread!   Too puffy and doughy!  The flavor is good but not what I remembered taste wise. I was and am very disappointed!!!  Sorry people but I don't agree that this is a pizza worth the wait or price.

Give yourself time if you are going to dine in. I've been here at least 5x and every time the wait for a table was at minimum 45 minutes and no reservations.The pizza takes forever to come out...food is an art I get it, just a warning. My suggestion would be to call 30-45 minutes before you intend on coming to see what they wait time is like. Their pizza isn't bad, I'm just a die hard Lou's fan. The crust on Peaquod's pizza is fluffier and softer than Lou's buttercrust. Have it and you be the judge Lous or Peaquods?! Service was nothing special.

Went here expecting SO much more than I actually got. Pizza was really not that good. I would honestly say that Giordano's, Gino's East, even Lou Malnati's are all a million times better than the crust/sauce/cheese here. The staff was very inattentive and careless. It took her about 13-14 minutes to bring our drinks, after we waited about 30 to be seated and 10 to be greeted by a server. We ordered our pizza which took about 40 minutes to make (super reasonable for a deep dish). After trying to get her attention for about 15 minutes after being completely done with eating our food (which took about 25 minutes because we were STARVING), we told her (our server) that we were in a rush so head out and if she could bring our check. She was rushed and said okay and brought us our checks. We put in our card and she took the payment and we did not see her for the next 40 minutes, after requesting her to please hurry up because we were running late at this point. I have never been this disappointed with a place's food AND service (well, lack of service, actually). Save your taste buds, go somewhere else. Actually, go anywhere else. This place sucks.

If you plan on coming here on the weekend, make sure you call hours ahead of time to get priority seating once you get there. The place is super crowded on weekends, with hour waits for pizza. The service was okay (could have been better). After waiting an hour for pizza, I thought it would be on the same level of delicious as Lou Malnati's. The pizza was burned, and it tasted like Tombstone frozen pizza. The bread was too dry. Not my kind of pizza.
Hands down the best Chicago pizza experience.  Get there early and grab a drink next door.

Well, I found my favorite pizza in Chicago. This place is awesome. It is in a pretty low key spot on Clybourn just past Webster, slightly busy street, parking is not very easy on the street.If you come past 6pm any night, expect a long wait, we happened to get here right before the evening rush and did not have to wait, and if you're coming in on a weekend, there is usually a very long line outside, but it's worth the wait!We sat upstairs, it's a very cool/ fun vibe all over. There are a few TV's around, but nothing too overwhelming and everyone that works here is really nice. We started with a house salad, big enough to share, and then we went to the pizza... We ordered the Medium pan pizza, we each only ate one slice it was so delicious and filling. You choose your own toppings, they don't have any set pizzas on the menu, and the pizza was divine. The crust is sweet, buttery and savory in one heavenly bite, along with the sauce and toppings, it's just amazing. I will for sure be back! :)

If you love pizza the way I love pizza then this is the spot to go! Pequods is Pizza Heaven. I have tried multiple pizza spots and this one is my number one in Chicago. I can start from the unique buttery and tasty deep dish burnt crust to the perfect amount of sauce and cheese with the toppings! Totally worth the cheat meal and food comma. It is usually packed so prepare to wait for at least 30 minutes to be seated on weekends. Once you're seated the service is legit. Pequods is a must go!

Overall our favorite deep dish pizza in the City. But frankly, have to recognize their capacity to disappoint. Last time, the sauce was lacking flavor and the salad was not fresh (it was replaced). In recent past, pizza not hot all the way through. And once we had a booth with a side wall crawling with bugs (like gnats). We keep going back because when it's good, it is very good. Somebody in charge should step up to address the inconsistencies though because patience does not always last.

So we waited 2+ hours for our pizza to be delivered. When we called 1h30 in, the lady on the phone told us it should have been delivered 10 min ago, and to call her back 15 mins later in case it still didn't show. When we called back 15 min later, she said to be patient and it would be 20 more minutes but she "didn't have a gps on the car". She did not call the driver. Thanks Pequod's for the service, you could use staff training.
The BEST deep dish pizza in all of Chicago!!!  Don't even waste your time going to the other places. The pizza was the perfect combination of fluffy crunchy cheesy and yummy!!
Best pizza in Chicago. Get a large thick pizza with car Malone's cheese on the sides and fries! Best and favorite pizza and I am from Chicago. Staff is always busy but nice. Love it
Decent pizza but nothing special or outstanding . We always order the thin crust and it's pretty standard and good .
Best deep dish in the city. Worth the wait!! The meatball sub is the best I've ever had!

This review is long overdue. The only bad part about Pequods is delivery...it really is a dine in meal worth every minute of wait time. This, in my humble opinion is the best of the best when it comes to Pizza in this beautiful place we call planet Earth. If you're a Chicagoan, you have to get here often, if you're a tourist it is a MUST STOP AND EAT.
Absolutely love their deep pan pizza! I think tourists should check this place out! Great atmosphere, great service and amazing mouth watering food!

The pizza at Pequods was excellent. I enjoyed it so much. The Deep Dish I had was half pepperoni and sausgage and half pepperoni, sausage, olives and peppers! I reallly enjoyed it (Extra L for emphasis). The Deep Dish was more of a Pan Pizza which had a thick crust. For my first time having true Chicago Deep Dish pizza it was pretty good. Next time Im in Chicago Id like to have the Deep Dish slice that has the toppings in the center and bottom as opposed to the top. Back to Pequods though. The pizza was crunchy and the cheese was perfectly burned along the edges. I thought that it was great. The service was pretty good. The pizza did take a while to arrive, but Im starting to learn that pizza making is a bit of a slow art form.So overall this was great pizza. The toppings were tasty and the pepperoni was really good. Can't wait to get back to the Windy City to have some more. 5 Stars

Amazing pizza! I went there around 4:30 on a Sunday - no line and just beat the football crowd. The pizza took about 40 minutes to make and the pizza is so cheesy! I love the causal dining environment and very laid back. I will definitely be back next time when I am in town

I had never heard of this pizzeria before my brother mentioned it to me. We got our pizza delivered in a timely manner, unlike most places. Pizza itself definitely surprised me because it held its own against my all time favorite-Lou's. I dare say I think this was better than any other deep dish pizza I've had to this day... Go try it if you love some classic deep dish style pizza!

This is easily the best pizza I have had in years.  My order had a couple of custom features (light cheese/extra sauce) to it and they got both of them right.  This is totally uncommon as most places strive only to get the ingredients right.  I had carryout but the dining atmosphere looked great too.  Highly recommend.

Had the deep dish pizza but not impressed as others have reviewed. I think they had the pizza undercooked as this place was fairly busy and our pizza came out super fast.  Wish the deep dish was cooked a bit more as it would have been better.  While we had to wait for our table we had few beers right next door. Will give it another shot when they are not that busy.
It was very good, wait for the pizza was longer than expected!Bad news, their is nothing like a NY Style pizza from back home in NYC!
Great deep dish pizza. Sauce and the crust are both excellent. Very generous with toppings. Fun atmosphere with friendly staff.
I love this place !! The pizza and wings are worth the money and annoying parking search.
Pizza takes fucking forever, but my god it is delicious.

Okay, so this is my favorite pizza of all time. Sadly, I haven't gotten it as many times as I would like.The personal pizza I recently ordered really lacked flavor compared to the full size deep dish I normally get to share.The biggest issue I've had here is when I waited an hour for a large pizza for pick up, went to pick it up to find out they made the wrong size. The size they made would not have been enough food for my group, so they offered the pizza they made at a discount, or wait another 40 minutes for the pizza I ordered. I had no choice but to wait and still had to pay full price for the pizza. No discount, no apology, nothing. Really frustrating.Such a shame as I've always been such an advocate for this place and have stayed away lately.  Might have to venture out to the Morton grove location to get my fix!

I've been wanting to come here for a while now. Their's alot of hype about Chicago deep dish pizza. Everyone one I asked recommended this spot, so I had to give it a try.  I knew they would be a long wait but so did everywhere else. I started out with garlic bread to eaze the hunger a bit. When it arrived I was disappointed in the quality of the bread. Tasted like it came from the grocery store so I didn't finish. Then I ordered a salad and it was pretty basic as well, nothing special. They told me to wait for the pizza was 1 hour long, which was fine considering how many people were there. So I actually went next door and got some sushi and brought it back to the pizza place. They were totally cool with it. 20 mins later my DEEP DISH PIZZA showed up and it was HUGE! (I ordered a small btw) having waited this long I was pretty excited to dig in..........................Dam that pizza was worth the wait, and will totally go back. So 5 stars for there pizza but the rest of the food is decent. Which is expected since they specialize in deep dish. Non the less I had a good time and the hostess was nice. Thank you

This was the second place we tried on our quest to taste "famous" Chicago pizza. So far we're not understanding how these places have earned their reputations.We ordered our pizza to be delivered and it came in an hour. That was perfectly fine with us (it was a Saturday night and was actually delivered on the lower end of the time frame I was given).
