Pizza arrived hot and fresh.Just to clarify, Pequad's does not make a deep dish pizza. I see a lot of reviews calling their pizza deep dish and it's not, it's a pan pizza, which means it's a very thick crust. We knew this before we ordered and we are fans of pan pizzas, so this wasn't a surprise for us. We ordered a personal sized pepperoni, and a large pineapple.Overall, the pizza was edible. Sauce was mild in flavor (but at least it had some flavor compared to the other place we tried), there wasn't a ton of cheese (this could be good, or bad depending on your preference), and the crust had no flavor and was way too dry. I don't think I've ever had pizza crust fall apart due to being too dry. That was the biggest downfall of this pizza...dry crust that isn't very flavorful equals a lackluster pizza. The cheese caramelization on the edge of the crust was right on the cusp of being overdone. If it had been cooked any longer that cheese would have been burnt to an inedible state. Thank goodness it wasn't cooked to that point, but it was really close. Maybe if it was cooked a couple minutes less the crust wouldn't have been so dry and the caramelized cheese along the edges would have been in a more enjoyable state I don't eat dairy or eggs and I decided to in order to find out what makes Chicago's pizza great. So far that decision hasn't been worthwhile. You're letting me down Chicago!
I like Peqouds deep dish. Yum. So filling. So satisfying. Reasonable. Decent beer and drink list/menu.Not fancy nor pretentious. Causal.

Went on a busy Friday night, and when we checked in, there was an hour wait but two seats happened to open up at the bar within about 10 minutes, so we snagged those (bar is first come, first served). We ordered jalapeño poppers and a small sausage and onion deep dish pizza. The bartender got our drinks out quickly and the poppers were out within 10 minutes. They are the cheesy kind, not the cream cheese kind like I am used to, but they were still delicious and not too greasy. The pizza took longer (about 40 minutes) but we were expecting that as there is a big sign on the hostess stand setting that expectation. It was WORTH THE WAIT. The pizza was delicious and the crust was amazing.

Deep dish pizza at its finest. Truly, it doesn't get any better than this. Beautiful, carmelized crust that is to die for. It's heavy and you'll be full afterwards, but your tummy will be happy.I'm fairly picky when it comes to deep dish, this place hits the mark.

My girlfriend and I had a bad experience here a few months ago, and I posted about it on Yelp. Within minutes, the manager emailed me to apologize for what happened and told us to come back whenever we wanted and that he would buy us dinner. We did that tonight - and everything was excellent (and free). My girlfriend and I split the Pequod's salad and kept it simple with the pizza (large deep dish wish pepperoni and sausage). We have plenty of leftovers for tomorrow, and the staff and managers couldn't have been nicer to us.I've been to this location probably a half dozen times and will continue to go in the future. Thanks, Pequod's, for your excellent customer service! (And pizza!)

I don't understand the fascination with this place. Sure the deep dish is different and good but with so many pizza places in the city and being a thin crust fan I don't think I'll eat their pizza again.

Heaven in the form of pizza. Forget the places you've heard about before and go here if you want good, Chicago pizza. The crust is perfect, the cheese ring around the edge is perfect, all around perfect pizza. Anyone who tells you this isn't Chicago pizza is wrong and you don't need that negativity in your life.

Favorite deep dish/authentic "Chicago-style" pizza. If you're from out of town and debating on which to try go to Pequod's! There will probably be a wait, but grab a drink and just relax - you're about to have the best pizza ever. The burnt cheese crust is simply to die for.

Pequod's Pizzeria, tomato sauce masters! I'm speaking specifically to all my heartburn people out there, this sauce will not keep you up at 3am in the morning, but enough about all that. I came to Pequod's with my girlfriend, Gaby, wanting to try out this heavily hyped pie. The joint was juking, which was to be expected on a Friday night, but it only took us 40 minutes to get seated which was not bad due to the reputation of the joint and the incredible crowd waiting outside (pro tip: you can get ahead of the wait line if you call in for a table the day before). To pass the time we went three doors over to the Drinkingbird and had a couple of Schiltz and PBR's for 3 dollars a pop while we waited. Once our buzzer thing vibrated we rushed over. Walking to our table all I was getting was college/frat vibes (esp. on the second floor) from the decor to the people. I went to UOI, so I'm a natural in this habitat (just wanted to fully disclose for all the anti-bros out there). Once seated we ordered immediately since we already knew what we came for and did not want to drag out the hold time of the pizza. We ordered buffalo wings and a medium pizza (sausage & pepperoni - 1/2 jalapenos). The wings came out immediately and they were really good, the only problem for me was the price of the wings in comparison to the size of the wings. I literally, in one bite, can clean those wings. I drank one beer and a 1/4 of my second beer before the pizza came out which is okay (I like my pizza out before I finish my first beer (I sip lightly everyone, at restaurants only of course lol)). Once the pie arrived, we dug in. The ingredients are to die for, plain and simple. It was GREAT! I can really see what all the hype is about and the fun atmosphere complemented the entire experience. Trust me - if you haven't tried this place, don't let the hold time faze you, you will be rewarded in the end.  *****I will say this though, I AM NOT A FAN OF THE "CARAMELIZED" CRUST at the end. Idk if this is an accrued taste like wine or something BUT TO ME IT TASTE BURNT. The cheese and crust underneath the burnt ends tasted great nonetheless.The restaurant as a whole is 4/5 for me - the wings 3/5 (this rating is leaning on the weight of the price) but the stuffed pie was 4.5/5. I will def. recommend this pie to friends and family.Cheers everyone!

This is the BEST place for deep dish pizza!My favorite part about the pizza here is how the edges of the crust are slightly burned so it's really crisp. I've tried 3 different deep dish pizza places in one day to compare them all (Pequod's, Giordano's, Lou Malnati's) and Pequod's is the best in my opinion! I can't comment on the service here; I always order for pick-up because I'm too impatient to wait, unless I am catching up with some friends and passing time anyway. Keep in mind that you will always have to wait for deep dish pizza if you expect a quality, fresh pizza no matter where you go.

Deep dish done right. We had our medium pie delivered. While the delivery time was a little longer than what we would've like, the wait was well worth it. In a town with a pizza place on every corner, Pequad's stands apart. Try it, you won't regret it.

Let me start by saying I am NOT a deep dish fan. It is too much for me, but naturally you have to get one because you are in Chicago. Pequod's is what the locals recommended so we came here to see what it was all about. The pizza's crust isn't that dense thick crust that we all think when we think Deep Dish. This crust was thin and crunchy- very much like a cheese crisp. This is the best deep dish I have ever tasted- the cheese to sauce ratio was all on point. I wish I could say this place has made me a deep dish convert- but that would be a lie. But if you like deep dish then this place will most definitely be your go to spot.
The food was great I ordered a veggie/ jalapeño deep dish with extra cheese and it exceeded my expectations. I would definitely come back!
Best deep dish!! Wish there was a location Southern California!! The sauce was so flavorful and the mozzarella was top quality.
The wait was reasonable for lunch (10-15minutes), the food was amazing!! It was about 2.5 $s but worth going there cause there's enough food for left overs

THE BEST DEEP DISH. Don't let other's persuade you. If you are looking for deep dish, come here. Leave the others behind. All Chicago pizza places have a wait, but this one is worth it. What makes them different from the rest is their amazing crust. Caramelized cheese crust. SO GOOD. Just headed over, do it, right now!

Delicious pizza, terrible wait. So the pizza is 4-stars, but the service is 2-stars. I put in a request online for priority seating about 4 days early and never got any sort of email confirmation so I called the day of to confirm. The girl who answered wasn't all that friendly and begrudgingly added me to the list. It was packed when we walked in and I was told about an hour wait. Well...we waited 2 hours. Now I understand the priority seating is not a reservation, but it's supposed to cut the wait time in half. You can't tell me a normal wait time was 4 hours! It's an understatement to say the host seemed overwhelmed, so I'm not sure the priority seating list was really happening. Once we were seated the service continued to be slow, and the waitress didn't seem to move all that quickly. At about 9:30 the pizza finally arrived and everything was right in the world again. I was so excited about the caramelized cheese on the crust and I'm happy to report it did not disappoint! YUM!Despite the delicious crust, I'll be sticking to my old buddy Lou Malnati in the future - shorter waits and they let you put in your pizza order before you get a table. I will only be revisiting Pequod's for take out.

Was able to try this and Lou Malnati's while in Chicago and this place is #1 for deep dish in my book. The service was great and the atmosphere was fun. The crust is the specialty here, they pile layers and layers of cheese on the side of the pan, making a cheesy, burnt crust that made it so crunchy and flavorful. And the fact that we were able to choose the toppings was what got me super excited.After a night of drinking, nothing was more satisfying than this, and of course, we had to order more drinks.. We literally piled it high with mounds of toppings! We got mushrooms, jalapenos, fresh garlic, sausage, Italian beef, and hot giardiniera. The giardiniera and Italian beef is definitely a must-get. Can't wait to come back!
So good. Better then NYC pizza. Worth the wait and the prices. environment is amazing too.

Really bad service, long wait and waitress didn't understand the basics of food service.  Our app and salad were average at best, pizza was ok but disappointing based on our expectations.  Way too little cheese and Lou's crust is way better.

Delicious pizza! The deep dish personal size is very filing. It took about 40 minutes to get our pizza so plan to stay a while and get an appetizer if you're hungry already. We got the cheesy garlic bread and it came out quickly and was very tasty.

Not worth the wait at all.  We arrived at 7:30, were seated at 8:45, and weren't served until 10:40. I was fully prepared to wait but quite frankly almost two hours for food is ridiculous. Manager obviously didn't care when we complained and I'm 99% confident that they gave our order to the table across from us and that's why it took so long to be served. And the pizza was lackluster even though I was ravenous by the time it arrived. Overhyped and underwhelming. Beddia in Philly has one man making pies and they are always slammed b/c of their Bon Apetit review and yet they manage to keep their shit together and consistently deliver. No excuse. Figure it out.
This is my LEAST favorite deep dish pizza place in Chicago. The burnt Carmel crust was disgusting. Def won't be returning.

45 minute wait for the table then 1 hour and 15 minute wait for the pizza  but it was well worth it!Cooked to perfection. The burnt edges has amazing flavor. The sausage and pepperoni are fresh. Again definitely worth the wait time.

Definitely a pizza  joint you want to try if you have a big appetite. I was full after 2 slices. The place does get busy. We had to wait 1 1/2 hours before being seating and another 45 minutes for the pizza to bake. We ordered the garlic bread for appetizers and a small pepperoni, sausage, and onion for my wife and I. It was enough to get us full and crust is decent. Wasn't a big fan. We brought our 8 month old son and the restaurant was accommodating. Overall, wasn't worth the wait.

3 hour wait...3 hours! I thought to myself, there is no way any pizza is worth waiting this long for!We were a group of 7 and killed time at a nearby bar to snack on tacos. When it was our time we headed to the restaurant and took our seats upstairs in a booth under a large tv. The waitress took our orders and we were eating cheesy, bready appetizers within 15 minutes. I tried not to gorge so I could save my real appetite for this infamous pizza. I managed to eat half a appetizer and finally 45 minutes later our pepperoni and sausage pizza arrived. It was freakin amazing. I cherished every bite and wished my stomach was bigger to hold more of this saintly pizza. Others at the table ordered double sausage which was comical because when it arrived we could barely see the crust...there was soooo much sausage! Everyone who ate it said it was too much so don't bother getting a double order, they hook it up plenty without needing that. I left smiling and think this is the best pizza I've ever had in Chicago. It's also very reasonably priced compared to other places. 3 hours is steep though so I'd attempt to go at a down time or order to go.

I've tried this restaurant once due to a friend's glowing recommendation, and was severely disappointed. We ordered delivery, so in fairness I haven't tried in person, but to say the order was botched would be an understatement. My fiancé and I ordered two pizzas and a salad. She is a vegetarian, so naturally we ordered a vegetarian friendly pizza.  Her pizza came overly dry, with very little sauce, and cold veggies. My pizza came with burnt crust, and very poorly distributed sauce and ingredients. The salad never came. The driver didn't alert me to it, and when I asked where it was he blamed the kitchen and said he only takes what they give him and doesn't have time to confirm the order. He offered me the cash equivalent to the salad since I paid with a card, and that he couldn't run the salad back to me since he was too busy. Is this what you call customer service? I called and asked for the manager. She replied with "what would you like us to do, we're busy".  What I would like is for you to take a basic level class in customer service and give a customer what they pay for.  She was useless and unapologetic. Do not recommend. Won't be trying them again.

5 stars for dining in, 3.5 stars for takeout or delivery. Their pizza is about the best you can get when you eat it fresh at the restaurant - although waiting for a table can sometimes be a pain during prime times. But it is worth it if you have the time. The pizza loses something when you take it to go or have it delivered but it's still very good. There's not much bad to say about Pequod's.

Pequods is a good as pizza gets. Plus this location is open late, late, late...perfect to hit after the bars in Lincoln Park. The deep dish is excellent. Great Chicago-style done right. Sauce is rich, tomato-y and tasty.The thin crust is also the bomb. Love the pepperoni. Expect to have to wait for a table - especially late at night when everybody else has closed their kitchen. But, trust me, it will be worth the wait.
Waited an hour and a half for deep dish.  It was good, but not the best pizza I've had in Chicago.  I'm gonna have to say, not worth the wait.

This is quite arguably one of my top 2 BEST pizza places I've ever had in my life and I LOVE New York pizza. I'm not a thin vs thick crust guy; I just love good pizza. I've had the chain pizza places in Chicago and although Peq's isn't as deep, that's the beauty of it! You don't get too much bread, or cheese, or with little pepperoni... Peq's is just the perfect balance between bread, cheese, reeeeally love sauce, & pepperoni. & this is why I love this pizza! Plus, you don't get full off 1 slice, I had 3 bc I love to eat and didn't want to eat more because I didn't want to be that hog. Could've easily had 4 comfortably.I'm from Cali and Cali has no good pizza. So when I travel, I try the landmark foods and this is by far the best pizza I've had in Chicago, hands down - in my top 2 pizzas EVER.

WOW WTH!!!! Never thought I'd be writing this review...... I've been going to both Pequod's locations for 20 plus years never had anything but great food and a nice wait staff. All changed tonight!!! Our deep dish pie was so dry I couldn't get through once slice, it was TERRIBLE, zero flavor, and get this with my two friends still eating, and a fresh round of beers our waitress asked if she could box our pizza to go and get our check, (thinking to myself WTF?) I replied really do you want us to leave?????
Best pies in the city. Always busy. So be prepared to wait, but definitely worth it. I would recommend them over any other spot even though there are plenty of great pizza spurs in Chi.

Best pizza in town but be prepared to wait for both delivery and at restaurant eating.   There must be a better delivery system to get you the food faster.   Regardless, it's worth the wait.    Best sausage in town
I'm not even two blocks outside of the delivery zone and the woman taking orders Friday night wouldn't even entertain the idea of delivery.

I love Chicago style pan pizza, and this is arguably the best pan pizza in the city (and outside because the morton grove location is great too). It's at least a must try for anyone, and you're crazy if you're not a fan of the crust

If I had to eat just one thing for the rest of my life, this place would probably be the one - love love love this pizza joint to death!  It is JAF x 100 - hot peppers and basil all day man on my deep dish.  I love my friend Aamer for introducing this to me, so happy that he is the white guy in a brown guys body for letting me know about this gem of a place.  And whoever says this place is OK or it's not as good as lous or giordanos can really go back to their moms basement and eat tombstone pizza.

Best deep dish in Chicago, hands down. Not as nice of an atmosphere as some other deep dish chains but this pizza is the best. Ask for water if you want some otherwise they won't bring you any. Usually extremely long wait times.
This is a must try for fans of pan pizza. It is almost always where I take friends when they come to the city. I have never been disappointed!

Chicago, I love you for many reasons, but your deep dish is high on the list.  Since moving away, every time I've been back, I've gone to Pequod's.  If you're going for dinner, be prepared for a long wait.  Most really great places in Chicago have long waits, so this is to be expected.  Since there isn't a lot of space to actually wait, you can always grab a drink at the bar that is two doors down, and they'll give you a call to let you know your table is ready.I always start off my pizza meals with a salad to get some healthy veggies in.  But when at Pequod's I douse my salad in their ranch dressing because it has a little extra something in it that makes it awesome.  I think it may be extra garlicky or something, and it is great!  Their house salad also comes with cheese on top that shaped like a fish, which is always endearing.  All deep dish places have something they do a little differently.  Here at Pequod's they're known for their caramelized crust, which really sets them apart from the rest of the crowd.  You can't go wrong with any pizza you would choose.  It is some seriously tasty pizza!My last visit in was over the holiday season during lunch time, and there was a bit of wait.  They have a nice little lunch combo for $4.95 that comes with a 7-inch cheese personal pizza and a fountain drink.  Regular toppings are $.80 extra, and you can also add a small lunch salad for a couple extra bucks.  We went this route, and I enjoyed the pizza, but I am firm believer that the personal pizzas at deep dish places are never as good as the full sized pizzas.  Please tell me I'm not alone in thinking this.  I swear it's the cooking time or something.If you haven't tried Pequod's yet, you're missing out!

I've been to Pequad's a few times, so let me start by saying that the pizza is great. With that said, however, we had such an awful experience with their customer service that they deserve no more than 3 stars. I've been eating deep dish pizza my whole life, so I understand that it takes a long time to make; however, at Pequad's apparently it's supposed to take an hour and a half. That's what a manager tried to convince us of when, on a not so busy afternoon, the table next to us was seated, ordered, ate, and left all in the time that we waited for our pizza to come out. It was pretty frustrating at the time, but in retrospect kind of funny. I'll most likely go back, because that crust... sooo good, BUT it's going to take a while for me to get over this.

This is the best pizza in chicago hands down. the toppings are fresh and the crust and caramelized cheese give the pizza a unique taste unlike any in the city. 5 stars and first recommendation to any of my out of town friends who want to know what chicago deep dish really is

I give them 5 stars for pizza but subtract 1 star for not being eco friendly. I ordered delivery and mentioned I'd be eating at home so asked for no plastic silverware, and received a plastic bag of plastic silverware for and paper plates for 6 people. It's just for me and my husband.  Why are restaurants so wasteful??

I have no idea why nobody opens a place like this anywhere in NYC or Charleston Sc.  I cant find any deep dish pizza anywhere on the east coast for that matter.  I dream about this pizza, it is so satisfying and hearty it really cant be described except overwhelmingly delicious!  And for all of the yelpers who look at the top of the pizza and say; "why is there so little cheese?"  IT IS UNDERNEATH, they don't pile all of the cheese on top of the sauce, that's a defining characteristic of this type of pizza!!  Come on people get with the program, this ain't NY style.

I've been going to Pequod's since I was a little kid, and it has remained the best pizza in a city full of great pizza. The carmelized crust is fantastic, and the Pequod's spinach and mushroom deep dish might be the perfect food. The only downside to its recent notoriety is it's busier than it used to be, but it's still utterly wonderful.

This is my favorite pizzeria , bar none ,and always gets top rankings for their pizza from the many, many restaurant reviews locally and nationally. We've been going there once a week for going for years due to the high quality pizza and great service staff. My only negative would be the whale symbol they use, specifically its eye patch, given today's politics. Know what I mean ?! Love the pizza, the people, and the place. Well worth the trip!

This was my second time having pequods! The first was a super great experience and everything was delicious. The second time around I went with a group. The service and food was terrible. We ordered appetizers that never arrived. Drinks weren't refilled. The pizza arrived super late and burnt!! We ordered a thin crust veggie and one with sausage. I'm hoping the third time is as good as the first time.

This is one of my favorite pizza places in Chicago! The caramelized crust pan pizza is delicious and reasonably priced. The place is always busy, especially during the weekends (can be up to 2 hour wait). However, while the pizza is delicious, the location itself needs some work (dirty tables, dirty bathroom, overall could be a cleaner atmosphere).

Overrated.  Took a Lyft way out of our way to get to this place based on the great reviews and then waited an hour for mediocre pizza at 9 PM. Gets three stars because the service and environment are good. But I'm from out of town in it for the pizza and frankly they're a lot better options where I'm from in San Francisco.  Won't be back.

I came alone and was seated promptly at a high two-top table. I'm glad they have a lot of small booths and tables. the iced tea tasted really sweet and definitely not freshly brewed. On the contrary, they do have a rotating Three Floyd's beer on tap, so props for that. To start, I ordered a half Pequod's salad. I enjoyed it as it had a lot of different ingredients like pepperoni, mushrooms, cheese, and onions. The Italian dressing came in a plastic container, like I was taking it to go. The dressing was good, but not thrilling.At 5:30 on a Friday night, it was already 50 minutes for a personal pizza. I ordered a pizza with sausage and mushrooms and added spinach to half. When it arrived it wasn't cut, so there was no picking this pizza up! The caramelized crust was very good, maybe not as good as Burt's crust was. The sausage was phenomenal, great seasoning, nice sized pieces. The spinach was whole leaves, not a chopped up mix like at Gino's East or Lou Malnati's. I coulde taste it, but was glad it didn't overwhelm the rest of the pizza. Also, the pizza tasted really saucy. I like a lot of sauce, but it was to the point where I could barely taste the cheese.The service was...interesting. I had one server through the time that I placed my order. Then, I never saw her again. Another server took care of me the rest of the way. I had to ask if she was my server now and she said yes. I just expected to get some kind of explanation as to why there was a switch. Also, there isn't much space to walk, especially downstairs. I feel for the servers as they have to navigate through some really tight spaces.It was a good experience and I'd enjoy having the pizza again.

Out of all the highly rated deep-dish spots we bookmarked ahead of time prior to visiting Chicago, this was our favorite pie.  It's a no frills type place and the wait can be easily over an hour and the pies take a bit to come out as well, but this is one place where the wait is worth it.  Our pies had a great crust, perfect amount of sauce, cheese and toppings, would definitely visit again-well worth the hype.

Pequod's, you truly live up to all the hype everyone is talking about. Pequot's has the best deep dish pizza you will ever taste. Forget Lou Malnati's, Gino's, and Giordano's. They don't even come close to Pequod's.Come early or call-in before you arrive to get on the list. My husband and I came on a Saturday night and were predicted a 2-hour wait. No worries though, we walked to the Drinkbird, just 2 stores down from Pequod's, for a drink while waiting. And shortly after finishing our first drink, we were notified that our table was ready. We waited for ~ 45 minutes before our table was ready. Just in case you were wondering, Barnes and Nobles is out of range for the sensor to work. Trust me, we asked them too. What makes Pequod's so unique is their crust. That caramelized crust is so delicious that there are no words that can properly describe how amazing it tastes. You just have to come and try it yourself. I promise you you won't regret it, and it's worth the wait. You have to pay extra for each topping, but don't worry, they are very generous with their toppings. NOTE: It takes ~45 minutes for your pizza to cook after you order, so you should order an appetizer. Their garlic bread is a great start for an appetizer when you're about to get hangry.If you're Blackhawks fan, you'll love this place even more. :)

So I ordered a full order of pasta with a side salad specifically asked for marinara sauce on top of the pasta with the melted cheese I hope I get the post a picture because they are as dry as can be no Parmesan cheese at all maybe I'm supposed to request that but actually it should automatically come with it so that will go in the garbage because I work 12-hour shifts and there's no way I'm going to wait 12 hours to eat and hopefully the salad will fill me up I will never order from them again!!!!! NEVER AGAIN!!!!

My FAVORITE pan pizza anywhere!  I order the same damn thing every time: pepperoni/mushrooms/green olives.  It brings me joy.  Like making guacamole, or listening to an old V-8 accelerate on LSD. I especially like how the crust has burnt cheese on it. The pepperoni often has a bit if color too. I will always be a fan!

Best deep dish in Chicago. Like most locals, this is a topic we take seriously!! I will fight you on this. Their burnt cheese crust does it for me. As an original Wisconsinite, cheese is important to me. My friends and I agree that Canadian bacon and pineapple here is the best but go crazy and get whatever you want. Add pepperocini! Outside of the food being amazing - it's a fun atmosphere / sports bar. It's also unique and not a huge chain. If you have a weekday free go before 3PM for their awesome $5 personal pizza deal!

I have heard about Pequod's Pizza from several friends as the best pizza in town. This is a very popular place and loved by many. I could tell from how crowded it was when I went to pick up my order. Although my pick up time was 7 PM, I was standing there in the restaurant along with many others for 45 minutes until my order was ready. The hostess made it sound that it was normal and she was unapologetic for the wait time. Putting that aside, I was extremely disappointed with this pizza. Its definitely not for everybody. I did not care for the crust or the ingredients. The sauce was pretty good but everything else tasted bland.
Pequod's is my favorite pizza place. I love their caramelized crust no other place can top it.
True chicagoans choose Pequod's over other famous deep dish pizza places. It's fresh and delicious!

We had a going away party on a Saturday. Thankfully, they allow you to put in a table request the day before via their site, which was great for our party of 10. (This is not a reservation. Just gives you priority seating.) You still have to come in a little earlier to wait, they will give you a pager which works near the bar at the Drinking Bird. We ordered 3 large pizzas for 10 people and still had a few slices leftover. Pizza wise, it was okay...I wasn't drawn to it. there wasn't any flavor that stood out. it was just very thick pan pizza (not a layered pizza). I still like Lou Malnati's style pizza more and may prefer Giordano's over this.  Service was fine and they also allowed us to split the check with many credit cards.

My take on my recent Wednesday evening experience here is mixedThe Good:The option to be able to call ahead and put your name on the list for a table is helpful A few decent appetizer options to select from (fried zucchini was good)Reasonably priced menu itemsThe restaurant is easy to find, and the surrounding neighborhood has plenty of free street parking Their infamous pan pizza was a 8/10 for me as far as tasteThe bad: Hosts spent too much time talking with each other instead of welcoming customers into the restaurant (not efficient)Waitress was almost non existent. She rarely came by, and when we needed her, she was hard to flag downThe personal cutting knife they brought me had paper and pieces of food on it (gross). So overall I would say the food is good, but the service and cleanliness is questionable.

The atmosphere: We got here before the rush on a Friday evening (around 6pm) so I can't complain about the wait, but shortly after it got very busy. All the take out order individuals cram into the small space which is uncomfortable for the seated patrons. The pizza: Dry (almost burnt) crust. Like everyone else says, the ratio of bread to everything else on the pizza is too much. The cheese is very stringy and you feel like you have to chew each bite for ten minutes so you don't choke on it. For all the toppings I ordered there was zero flavor, where's the seasoning? I've definitely had better and I wouldn't suggest this to a friend.

OOooh Pequods carmel crust.. i am gaining weight here.  A bit loud inside but the food is always good and we take the remains home for leftover that last all week.  In fact the pizza has an after life in the microwave oven.  Good stuff so take it home !
Holy smokes... that crust was amazing.  If I hadn't burnt my mouth trying to scarf this thing down, I'm sure it would have been even more magical.  Until next time.

My Chicago tour included three different pizzerias in hopes of discovering the best: Lou Malnati's, Giordano's, and Pequod's. My favorite by far? Pequod's!Each takes a little while to get from ordering to eating, making calling in ahead when possible a wise decision. But flavor? Ohhhh man. Technically a pan pizza I'm told, Pequod's is just dumped with everything the way I want it.It looks a tad like a dive bar walking in, which probably has to do with the time of its founding. By the way, I kind of also like that there's only one location - it gives it more of an authentic, non-chained feel. Even if the service was, well, a little bit distant. Can't win in everything, and in this situation I didn't particularly care, probably due to the dive bar feel.The best part? The pizza, obvi! The lunch special is somewhere around the $5-6 dollar mark (sorry, I forget), including a soft drink, which I didn't very much care for but gratefully accepted, a lemonade. The bread is thick and delicious, a slightly caramelized crust, and flavorful cheese and toppings hold the rest of it together. I threw on their sausages and mushrooms for an incredible delight.When I move to Chicago, I know this will be my to-go spot for sure.

We were excited to try a new deep dish pizza, but unfortunately were extremely disappointed. Our waitress seemed bothered by our request and was a bit rude. We ordered well done hot wings, were given regular BBQ wings, and when the waitress was informed, a different waiter bought out the same BBQ wings cooked a bit longer with the same BBQ sauce on it and some hot sauce on the side. A hair was found in one of our personal deep dish pizzas and the others weren't that great. Finally, splitting our bill was a big to do, we were charged more for the drinks when she split the check. We definitely won't be returning.
Did not disappoint! Loved the carmalized cheese and the sauce was super tasty! Can't wait to go back.
Really awesome alternative to the bigger guys like Lou's and Giardiano's. Also, their wings are super underrated

Refusing to serve alcohol to a group of people because you can't realize the difference in a disability and being inebriated. Joel, you're an idiot and have no business having anything to do with customer service. Shameful.

We made the fatal error of going to Lou's when ee got off the plane instead of going straight to Pequod's... but now we know the difference between sub par and excellent...Ordered:Thin Crust w/ sausage, mushroom and green peppersNot ever going to order a thin crust pizza outside of NYC again! The dough tasted like the pillsbury instant dough....Deep dish w/ pepperoni, meatball, green peppers and mushrooms.  Mucho bettero! Fresh ingredients, cheesy and the crust had a nice crunch. All worth the calories!Wash it down with some of "Not your fathers root beer"
Some of he best pizza and a fun atmosphere. (a bit loud but thats ok)

Overrated. I went on a Friday night with a group of 8. We called ahead for priority seating which worked out well. However, when we got to our table we noticed that there were a lot of open tables and there were lots of people waiting outside. It seemed like they were trying to make people wait unnecessarily or there was not enough employees. Our waitress had way too many tables and didn't pay much attention to us after we ordered our food. It took us 25 minutes to get the check because our waitress was swamped. We were given pitchers of water at the beginning of the night that were never refilled. This place is trendy and appeals to a younger crowd however they don't value an exceptional customer experience. I got a snooty vibe and felt that the employees think that customers should be honored to get a table. The pizza was good but I wouldn't recommend it to tourists who have never tried deep dish as the pizza was more of a pan style. Overall, don't believe the hype.

I'm not sure why this pizza is so talked about in Chicago! I had to see what the fuss was about, so I ordered a personal pepperoni deep dish and a thin slice of cheese (yes, I like food). The thin slice was just like any cheap greasy slice, nothing really to it. I was excited about the deep dish however, since I've heard great things. I have to say... this is NOT real Chicago style deep dish. It is a VERY thick slice of bread with minimal sauce and minimal cheese. Chicago style pizza should be minimal crust, and a whole lot of cheese. I was extremely disappointed.
Delicious pizza!I was in Chicago on business. My BFF from college brought me here with high hopes... And the pizza exceeded my expectations! Delicious! I will go back Everytime I visit.

Everyone loves their thin crust pizza.  Many I know say it's the best in Chicago.  That's high praise.  It has almost a cult following.  I like it a lot.  I also like some other places for thin.  (This isn't Neapolitan thin, but just regular thin)
Best deep dish pizza in Chicago!! The crust is crunchy and the sauce is amazing!! Staff is friendly also!!
One of the best pizza places in Chicago.  The lunch special is a particularly good deal.

We made a reservation and we still had a long wait, so make your reservation as far in advance as you are able. Our waitress was great (split the check between a bunch of college kids' debit cards) and the pizza was delish! Loved the cornmeal crust :)

hefty portions of toppings on the 12" medium pan pizza we ordered. wait staff is extremely helpful and courteous.came on a Saturday afternoon around lunch time, and didn't have to wait for find a table. there is plenty of room, including upstairs preferred seating!

Made a reservation for a busy Saturday night. I highly recommend doing so if you're not up for an hour and a half + wait time. Honestly, I understand the whole concept of deep dish pizza--but Pequod's pizza had too much bread and not enough sauce and cheese. Everyone in my group agreed. We also got the cheesy bread: very basic Italian bread with mozzarella cheese and no special seasonings. I give three stars for the fact that we were able to order our pizza along with our reservation and they were already cooking our pizza when we arrived. Definitely cut down on wait time!

The pizza here is absolutely horrible. I don't get the hype on this place. But I tried it once and never again! The service sucked. Food took FOREVER for us to get it. And when it came it was super burnt and probably the worst pizza I've ever had.
Good pie if your into deep dish
Hair in salad and brown lettuce, item left off pizza, delivery late. Very dissatisfied.

you can't go to chicago and not get DEEP DISH PIZZA! so on my short 3 day trip, my friends helped me decide that Pequod's would be the SOLE deep dish i tried in chicagoTHE CRUST, lighter and more crumbly than i've ever had & with a blackened cheese layer on the top of the side, it was a good balance--sausage deep dish: the sausage had a lot of anise but I loved how saucy this pizza was--mushroom with fresh basil & tomatoes: not a fan of the sliced tomatoes but mushrooms never failLOVE that you can get personal pan sizes! i was pretty much full after 3/4th's of this pieit's in a divey sports bar type atmosphere but don't underestimate

I usually love this place. This is my favorite deep dish in the city, mostly because they're made in those cast irons, which gives the crust a fantastic crispy caramelized exterior. One time I came, I got a pretty limp pizza though. Trying not to hold it against them.

I've been there a few times and their pizza is good. They did mess up the last time I was there, they forgot my order, I should have left, but decided to stay (the waitress should have been paying more attention). It feels like they rushed the pizza. About the only thing that is good is the pizza. Their appetizers are blah (mass produced food that gets deep fried), which is not good. Since you are waiting you want to probably enjoy some good appetizers in the meantime and they don't have that.

Honestly, this is some of the best pizza that I've had in Chicago. I absolutely love the caramelized crust and flavor of these deep dish pizzas. The service is great and the atmosphere is pretty laid back. You can't call yourself a true Chicagoan if you haven't enjoyed Pequod's. And tourists, go out of the way to come here if you can.

Toppings,Cheese and Sauce very delicious really make the pizza more than decent, the crust tasted super buttery which wasn't the best combination with pizza but ok. The atmosphere was hectic due to Hawks game that was going on. Will definitely visit a quieter time next time.
After coming here two years ago, I was excited to come back. Unfortunately I was terribly disappointed! Completely tasteless and a strange consistency. Will not be back!

When I came to Chicago, I met up with a friend and asked her if we could get some good ole Chicago pizza.  I knew about Giordanno's and Lou Malnati's, but she suggested Pequods, which I never heard of.  Well turns out it was a great choice, and favored by the locals!She said the line might be long, but we got seated pretty quick on a Fri night at 7.  No more than like 20 minutes.  Once we sat down, there were a lot of beers and then the pizza came out.  My god.  It was delicious.  It had that burnt crust taste and all that delicious sauce and fillings.  Next time I get deep dish in Chicago, this will be my first stop.

Of all the deep dish pizzas I've had while in Chicago, Pequod's comes out on top.  This is the only place that had a crispy crust!  The other places had a much more doughy consistency to them so Pequod's def stands out.  Since the waitress warned that the pizza takes a long time to cook (took about ~40 min)  My friends and I ordered the cheesy bread and chicken strips to help tie us over until the sausage/pepperoni pizza came.  The apps were nothing to write home about but my review is specifically for their deep dish pizza.  The toppings of the pizza was heavenly as well as all the cheese!  I managed to tackle 3.5 slices of that behemoth.  Hands down the best deep dish pizza I've ever had (and probably the longest food coma I've had as well).
Always great and worth the wait! The pizza is amazing!! Best pizza in the city hands down! I will definitely be back again! Great Staff and Atmosphere!

The pizza is amazing and the wait was worth it.  The only problem is when the hype is so high you expect greatness.  I would've like the caramelization of the crust would've been done on all of the crust, not just the top.  The bottom layer was a little to thick and was inconsistent with the top layer.  But nonetheless it's definitely a worthy Chicago style pizza.
Caramelized crust is the best ever!! this place is a chicago gem.

This was suggested to us by multiple people so we ordered in. They quoted us 1.5-2 hours but it took just over 1 hour on a Saturday night. The food had to be warmed up a little, but that just might be because I'm picky. Anyway, we got a medium half cheese, half sausage and green olives. Super good. The crust is more bready than a traditional deep dish style, but the flavoring of the crust is very good. The olives added delicious flavor too. Their cheesy garlic bread was also pretty good! Not just dry bread without flavor. It was a nice lil app. I'd probably come back again and try some other pizzas!

We were very disappointed in our pizza. It was so thick and doughy. The sauce was nothing special and the toppings were sparse. It was mostly bread. There was mention of cheesy crust. This was just burned crust. After reading all the recommendations it was surprisingly bad.  We did not eat our pizza and neither did our dog when we took it home.  I just felt compelled to add our opinions. There were four of us and we were all in agreement. We will not go back. And we waited close to two hours to get in.

So we see all these fabulous review to be extremely disappointed. Delivery took 1 hour 50 mins and pizza was not good - crust was awful. On top of all, they forgot to bring the appetizer for delivery and will not provide full refund. Will NOT return

Kind of disappointed by the pizza here. It was good, but there was too much dough for my taste. My friends loved the place though. If you like a cornmeal crust then this is definitely the place for you.
Loved it! Pizza was delicious and highly recommend the zucchini bites (ask for a side of marinara to go with the ranch). Prices were fair, good atmosphere!

When I was visiting Chicago, I wanted to try this famed establishment. I got this pizza delivered to the hotel, which arrived in a timely fashion and was still very hot. I was not a fan of their toppings... the green peppers were in huge chunks and the whole pizza was covered in a thick layer of pepperoni. When I started eating it, I realized that this is not traditional Chicago deep dish (which is my own fault, their website says they make pan pizza). The dough was super thick and soggy. Total deal-breaker.

Well you've come to Chicago to try the world famous Chicago Deep Dish PIzza. Are you gonna go to a lame-duck chain restaurant like Uno's? No, I don't think so. You are gonna come to Pequod's to truly experience Deep Dish Pizza. Haven't tried other Deep Dish places in Chicago, but Pequod's lived up to their fame.
Pequod's is the best in Chicago. Tremendous pizza, truly Chicago. I recommend this to anyone, for what it's worth.

Heard great things, decided to order and have it delivered. When we called we were advised it would take 1hr 45 minutes  - 2 hours, no big deal. When 2 1/2 hours passed and still no delivery, we called only to be told they were really busy and short delivery drivers. Driver showed up 3 hours after we ordered and had a meltdown in the lobby of our building, refusing to bring the pizza to our door and left with the pizza. Needless to say, there are too many other good pizza places in Chicago to deal with this, you only get one chance, never again.

Differs from other deep dish pizza because the crust at pequods is fluffier and more doughy. There also seemed to be more sauce. I highly recommend trying. However, the restaurant itself is on the smaller side and there was a long wait on Friday night.

Two words: Underwhelming. Disappointing.But this review is solely for the "thin-crust" pizza.I feel like I'm the only Chicagoan (or visitor of any kind) who has something bad to say but I have to say it for anyone who, like me, actually don't like thick pizzas. Sorry, Chicago, but I love me some NY-style pizza. It's the real thing. :PI was with friends who wanted to try the place and thought I'd have a great experience like the many other patrons.However, I guess my first mistake was getting the thin-crust, which is not what they're known for. As I am not a fan of other pizzas, I thought this would be my best bet. For the three of us, the pizzas took 45 minutes.As soon as my pizza arrived, I was disappointed. It was not thin-crust at all. The outer edge where you hold it was really very cushiony, and the rest was just normal thickness. I knew I wouldn't find NY-style but Pequod's definition of thin-crust is way off.But that wasn't really what bothered me. The flavor was just not there. There was nothing about the crust that tasted good (my friends who got pan pizzas said their crust was amazing, so I was envious!). It was really just like plain white bread. The cheese literally sat on the pizza in one sad, rubbery clump, not integrated with any of the vegetables I had selected (they tasted fine but were completely unseasoned). I could only stomach two slices as I was hungry before I just felt like I was eating cheap white bread with plasticy/fake white cheese. Honestly, I've had way better pizzas at Giordanos if you want to talk hyped-up places. Even Blaze Pizza, a franchise, turned out better. Not to mention Dimo's in Wrigleyville which has fantastic pizza. And, crust aside, they win when it comes solely to flavor.My friends were happy with their pan pizzas, though. But if you only like NY-style pizza as I do, don't go even if your friends are raving about it. Let them experience it without you unless you're willing to go for the pan pizza (like I said, I can't speak to it, but I hear it's good and my friends who tried mine agreed it was pretty lame). It's totally not worth the wait and money.

I'm only giving it two stars because the staff was nice and the garlic bread was good.  Given the reviews and the line, I was absolutely in shock about the rest of the food.  The pizza was terrible.  Utterly tasteless.  Seriously, Dominos is better.  Completely disappointed.

After a movie at Webster this place is awesome.  If you like deep dish pizza with that crispy edge of cheese... oh yeah!  Decent prices and a great lunch special for a slice and drink. There can be a wait sometimes which sucks, but the pizza.... YUMMY!

I've been in chicago for 6 years now and this is definitely the best pizza I've had so far! Their deep dish crust is amazing. We had both a cheese pizza and a supreme both were awesome. I like the busy dive local feel of the place as well. Service was great and I highly recommend it!
Not sure if this is authentic Chicago pizza but it is probably the best I've ever had.

This place is famous for its pan pizza.  The caramelized layer of cheese for crust is what makes the pizza here special.  That being said, we had to check this place out!  Upon walking in, I noticed that this place looked more like a bar, rather than a restaurant.  We were seated in a small booth meant for two.  The atmosphere was loud, but that was expected given the bar environment.  The appetizers and the pasta all looked so good.  But we knew we would not be able to finish them all, and still have room to try the amazing pizza!  So, the GF and I just decided we would just order the small pepperoni and mushroom pan pizza. After waiting about fifteen minutes our pizza made its way to our table.  I was surprised with the short wait after because we had dined at Lou Malnati's the prior day.  Our server there  told us the pizza would take 45 minutes to cook.  I thought he was joking at first, but he was not kidding. The pizza was downright delicious.  It was hands down the best deep dish I have ever had in my life.  There was nothing negative that could be said about the pizza.  It was not overly saucy, and they did not cheap out on the toppings.  I loved that the bottom of the pizza was crispy, and not soggy.  I had to use a knife and cut the bottom because it was just that crisp.  The crust was the best part.  It was still so hot, despite eating the crust last.  The cheese was heavenly, for lack of a better word.   I love that this place opens until 2am.  The service was good, and the pizza was amazing.  I would recommend, and will definitely be back.

If pizza preference measured my city pride I'd be a terrible Chicagoan. Thin crust has always been much more appetizing to me than a block of melted mozzarella. If I must dive into the deep dish though this is the spot I do it. Their caramelized crust really steps the experience up a notch. They don't get the national recognition of Malnati's or Giordano's, but I promise you Pequod's is where it's at if you like feeling like you're pregnant after eating pizza. Lots of topping options, decent sauce to cheese ratio, and again of course that caramelized crust. I don't often do pies this way, but when I do I choose Pequod's.

Pequods is my guilty pleasure. I. Effing. Love. This. Place. As a Chicagoan, I don't understand how people can still be hung up on Lou's and Gio's with this place around, they pale in comparison. The thin crust here is good but the deep dish pan pizza is to die for! It has a caramelized crust and is cooked to perfection every time. This place never disappoints and by the way, they have a very generous delivery range. My only regret is that it's socially unacceptable to eat pizza everyday so I have to space my Pequods visits adequately.

I wish I could give this place a 3.5, but I'd rather give it a 4 than a 3. There are many pros and cons.Pros: This place was HUGE. I was surprised to see that they're able to seat so many people. There is an entire section upstairs. It actually two separate sections. The service was good after we got seated. The pizza was decent but did not blow my mind. They tell you how long it will take to cook appetizers and the pizza which is excellent and much appreciated. Good french fries. Great prices on pizza! The crust was nice and fluffy! Even when I ate it cold the next day after I had it in my purse for 5 hours (don't judge me), it tasted great.Cons: There are kind of a lot. They told us 30 minutes to get seated (long), BUT the time was accurate and they actually sat us in 30 minutes. We ordered drinks and they came out quickly, but the drinks were pricey. I paid $5.95 for a pint, and those were the prices for almost all of their beers. We ordered half an order of fries and bruschetta. The fries were really tasty but I wish I had a bottle of ketchup rather than packets. The bruschetta was not good. It was bland and the bread had this weird orange color to it. I ordered a pan sized personal pizza and the size was perfect for me and I had half the pizza leftover. I ordered pepperoni with basil. My pizza was burned AND I really hate it when the basil is cooked with the pizza. Fresh basil should not be cooked in my opinion. The delicious taste of it goes away. It didn't taste fresh by any means :(Overall, someone said we had to try it so we did. I'm not upset about it, I don't regret it, I may go back, but it didn't blow my mind.
The best pizza! Love this crispy cheese heaven. The wait is long, but always worth it.

As good as it gets! I have gluten and dairy issues so I don't eat pizza very often, but when I do, I prefer Pequod's over everything else. I used to go here after concerts and they'd be slammed, but I'd wait an hour anyway!
Pizza was wonderful. A little tight quarters but who cares the service was great. Great place to sample Chicago pizza!  Here after a wedding rehearsal.

Really like this place. The crust of this pizza is the best thing ever. The pizza tastes really fresh but sadly takes 45 minutes to make! I would suggest coming here right when Pequod's opens BEFORE everyone files in for the football game happening that weekend. Another thing, if you're really into cheese, Pequod's is not the cheesiest of the deep dish places. So, if you're looking for something like that, I'd either get the cheese pizza (or ask for more cheese) or check out Lou Malnati's or Giordano's.

Best Pan Pizza I've had in Chicago (so far). Real good flavor, nice crust, even a bit light (for pan pizza).  Rest of the menu was okay.  Nothing special, bit definitely worth the trip (and probably wait) for the pie..

Pizza tastes good but it's too much bread and not enough cheese. Salads are fine but the apps are below-bar-quality. The bathrooms are disgusting but I guess this is really more of a sports bar with pizza than a restaurant. Service is uneven which I suppose is understandable given what a madhouse this place usually is. Have not tried delivery because I don't want to wait that long.

I loved this place.  We went last night and the pizza and service were outstanding.  I'd like to give a particular shout out to the management, who, upon hearing that I (like an idiot) dropped my phone behind the booth, came out to help me at the end of our meal by deconstructing the booth and using a broom handle to Macgyver my phone from its hiding place.  I was mortified, but the staff was so kind and patient and never made me feel bad.  Also, though I offered an extra tip for their help, the manager refused to take it.  The willingness of Pequad's to go above and beyond the call of duty has earned them my lifelong loyalty.

The lines to get into this place in the evenings are insaaaaane. That's probably the one reason why I felt like I had to get in here b/c I was too afraid I'd be missing out on the Chicago deep dish experience (having already been disappointed by Giordano's and Lou Malnati's).When I finally got my pan pizza (Sausage, Spinach, and Mushroom) admittedly it looked awesome and when my slice was served, the stretch on the cheese could've gone across the room, but wow the pizza was...bland! The sauce wasn't intensely flavored and they were pretty stingy on the sausage. Not only that the pizza pie dough itself wasn't very flavorful; didn't have that yeasty quality you'd expect. They advertise the caramelization on the side of the pizza, which they delivered on, but ultimately that flavor didn't penetrate into the rest of the dough, which left for a less than amazing experience.For better deep dish pizza...Art of Pizza.

OMG.... Go late so you don't have to deal with as crazy of a wait. We stopped in around 11PM; and still had to wait. When the place was pretty empty. *scratches head* that didn't make sense... and the hostess had all sorts of weird excuses about why we had to wait.Anyway... we got the bbq chicken wings with ranch and an order of their to die for pizza.Absolutely. Amazeballs. Usually with deep dish pizza, the first slice has the perfect balance of crunchy outside crust, with fluffy insides, balanced with tomato sauce and toppings and gooey cheese. Second slice is usually soggy and not so fantastic. Pequods still kept its texture and crunch when I tackled the second slice! That is something that's never happened before.... This whole in the wall looking restaurant that's not located in downtown Chicago had the best deep dish pizza I've ever had.Definite must for any trip to Chicago!
I like it, it's unique, beats all the other deep dish in town but the flavor does get boring after awhile and it's really expensive to add toppings
LOVE.  Different style than other Chicago pizza, so expect different but carmelized cheese on crust can't be beat.

Incredible deep-dish. My friend was visiting and had never been to Chicago, so this was a great introduction into Chicago style pizza. We loved the sausage and the consistency, I would definitely order the pizza again--but only for take-out. We had been warned about the wait which was crazy, but the sheer noise from inside the bar when we went in to pick up the pizza was overwhelming. There is no way that you could eat or have a conversation comfortably--take out all the way!

Any time we have family/friends visiting from out of town, this is where we get their deep dish fix! Expect to wait to get in (a few spots around you can hang out at) and it takes about 45 minutes to cook the pizza. This is not bad service, it's typical so just be prepared. Their appetizers are really good --- the cheesy bread is super delicious. The place is nothing fancy but is the best deep dish pizza in Chicago. Their crust is what makes it!

Don't fall for the hype....A great surprise, my boyfriend and I walked in expecting to wait over an hr for a table but got seated immediately. We were so surprised I even asked the waitress if this was peqouds lolol. So, yay for that. Now onto the important stuff, the pizza. My boyfriend and I ordered a customized pan pizza and it was disappointing. It was a very average pan pizza, I have had better. Usually I will scarf down pizza but last night I only ate a slice because I was so disappointed I didn't want to bother anymore. So there you have it- not all that great. Their crust is way too much, the pizza is literally 80% crust 13% tomato and cheese and 7% toppings- I need less crust and more tomatoes, cheese and toppings please Won't be coming back

Whoever said real Chicagoans don't eat deep dish is a liar. Pequod's is my go-to at least once a month. That caramelized crust is what dreams are made of. I recommend getting your pie with extra sauce, as I find the leftovers are better that way.

I don't get it.  People die for this sort of pizza.  Its not that good.  I can understand that people who love that cracker bread pizza like Lou's would really like this place, but I was not a very big fan.
Great pizza!! Service was really good! Definetly will be craving the deep dish very soon!
If Jesus Christ himself were resurrected in these times, his first stop would be here for the Pizza.

This is my favorite deep dish spot in the city- bar none. Plus, I love that it's located right next to the Webster theatre- makes for the perfect post movie lunch or dinner. I usually stick with the classic pepperoni, but sometimes will opt for sausage, green peppers and onions. The later can be a bit messy with all the toppings but it's always delicious none the less.
Great pizza! I take all my out of town guests here when the visit. Its a laid-back bar atmosphere, not too loud, and always busy.

I only make it to Chicago every couple years and try to find a new pizza spot each time.  This is easily my new favorite place.  Pizza takes a little while to cook but they tell you this and it's expected.  Prices are easily worth inline and I recommend doing their online "call ahead".  The cheese that melts and chars around the edges really makes it!

I had the pleasure of trying this joint not too long ago, and it was pretty good. We ended up going around dinner time on a Saturday and yikes...the wait was three hours for a dinner table! However, to get your pizza-to-go it was only an hour and so we settled. Our pizza was topped with spinach, garlic, and Italian sausage (those three go great together). The crust was something different from what I'm used to, it wasn't bad but I don't know if I absolutely loved it. I'd definitely return on a less busy evening to review on service, but I definitely think you should give it a try!
Best Pizza in Chicago. Go to: mushrooms and meatballs Deep Dish (meatballs are super underrated there, but really good).
Favorite pizza anytime I come to Chicago. Hands down what Chicago deep dish is made famous for
By far one of the best deep dish pizzas in Chicago! I love that you can add lots of different toppings and that it's not too doughy. It's a must for all tourists visiting Chicago!

Stinky. Saw my waitress 3 times. Walked in and the wait for a pizza said 40 minutes. Only bright side was sitting down immediately, however we waited over hour for pizza after we ordered. When the pizzas got there, one pan pepperoni and one thin crust cheese, it was mediocre. The only highlight of the pan pizza was the amount of pepperoni, which you could taste.  The cheese was barely there and was baked into the crust, with the rest of it tasting like cardboard. The thin crust stunk, wanted to get it off my plate. No flavor at all. To top it all off, we missed the first couple minutes of the Bulls game to see the Red Wings and the Flyers. Very disappointing as a Chicago lifer. The hype isn't worth it, find some other place to dine.
Awesome lunch special. One of the best in the  city. And the pizza is excellent. Does get packed. How can you beat that price though?

So on my road trip to Notre Dame I had to sample Chicago Deep Dish pizza. I have tried several and if I rate those a four I have to rate this place a 5!!!!  Secret to going to these top pizza places is to go on off times and early. This place luckily takes reservations but it is small inside and a tavern feel vs other places that are true restaurants. We sampled the thin crust (which in my mind is still thicker than most pizza) and the traditional Deep Dish. If I were to come back again and I will it is deep dish hands down. The crust and sauce are melting with flavors all around. This place is truly amazing. Again small place, tavern feel but of course kids are allowed.  Also if you are stopping by before a Cubs game and score parking Uber or Lyft to game.

Hands down, unequivocally the best deep dish pizza period. There is no equal, I have eaten and eat a lot of pizza and nothing on this planet compares to a Pequod's pepperoni deep dish pizza. The caramelized cheese is amazing!!! Fun to eat inside, the place has character. You may wait a bit for your freshly made, delicious caramelized crust pizza, but it is worth every second. Great tasting bubbly fountain soda awaits to refresh your palate.

His place has the best pizza in Chicago hands down. What makes this place different is the way they make pizza. The sauce is amazing and full of favor. They caramelize cheese on the crust which captures the flavors amazingly. I have ate pizza from several locations and I have yet to find something as good as this location. Some advice:1. If you are coming on Friday or Saturday night, you will have to wait up to an hour to get in. This may seem like a long time, but there is a reason people wait. You can call ahead and have priority seating, which can shorten your wait. 2. My personal opinion, the more ingredients you place on the pizza the soggier it will get. Less in this case is more. 3. If there are any major Chicago sporting events, it will be packed. 4. Parking is rough at times. Drive on the street behind, there are more chances of finding parking there.

Oh my Quod, buckle up for what may be the most ridiculous food experience I'll ever have.7p - Called in a delivery order for a small deep dish and bruschetta. Told it'll take about 90 minutes.8:45p - Called back to inquire and sat on hold for five minutes. Never a good sign. They say the pizza will be out the door in ten minutes and we're promised some kind of discount on the check (card was already charged). Aka the order was lost and they just put it in. We didn't expect it to actually be out the door in ten minutes, but nonetheless proceeded with that thought.9:30p - Call #3. My apartment is about 3 miles/15 minute drive from Pequod's, so it should have been here about 9:10 if their previous timeline is to be believed. Turns out the driver had the wrong number and couldn't get ahold of us so they drove back. Gave them the number once again and waited, wondering if death was nigh.10p - If the driver was headed right back out with our order, they should have been here by now. We get the same answer as before, which we're quick to shoot down since 10 minutes ago was 20 minutes ago. The entire charge has been voided, thankfully.10:45p - Call #5 (!!!!!!!) At this point we kind of just want to go to bed, but know we need to eat. We're finally given the manager again. This is only the second time we've spoken to him, the first being a brief apology during call #2. He apologizes profusely but you can tell he's basically at a loss for words at this point (can't blame him). No idea what happened to our order but he's going to put another pizza in. He also takes down our information and we can get a free order in the future (don't think that'll get used).11:30p - The driver finally arrives. For those keeping score at home, it took 4.5 hours to get our order. Of course, this happened when I had less than zero food in the house so we had to commit to waiting this out.Here's the worst part after all of this - it wasn't good at all. The pizza was predictably terrible since it probably went through the oven at a billion degrees to get it out. It's probably decent in normal form, but not better than the other deep dish places. Disappointing given all the rave reviews I've heard.Never, EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEVER (shout out to Chris Jericho) order the bruschetta. It was actually kind of hilarious. Uncooked bread slices that had been oiled and a salsa cup of what was basically pico de gallo. Chopped tomato and onion with no seasoning. Sad panda.Clearly Pequod's has earned many fans over the years, but maybe your best course would be to tread lightly.

I have been dying to try Pequods, and I finally did.  First of all, I prefer thin crust but everyone said I would love this deep dish.  Yes, it is probably the better of the deep dishes I have had but I was really disappointed in their sauce.  The sauce was super bland and lacked seasoning and spice which kind of ruined the whole pizza for me because it wasn't very flavorful.  I did really enjoy the caramelized crust; it was the best part

This is my favorite pizza in Chicago, hands-down.  It is light and fresh, without the greasy crust most chains have.  I also love the atmosphere; it is very casual and friendly.  It does have long wait times, but it's worth the wait!

Man, this place is kick ass. It has a real, local feel from the exposed brick walls to the staff and people inside. Nothing fancy or hip bit feels like a place where real deep dish pizza is made the same way they've been doing for decades (could be wrong). The service was really great. Not overly attentive or anything but a casual sense about it. Three guys total, after a night out, we split a medium deep dish with Canadian bacon, pepperoni, spinach and sausage. 6 slices total and 2 slices each and the waitress was absolutely correct-totally enough. Proved us wrong when we thought of doing two pizza pies. The pizza was absolutely savory and delicious. Thick and heavy with a crunchy harder exterior and a chewy soft doughy bread on the inside and amazing toppings. Not the kind you grab with your hand and bite in 3 goes. Definitely a knife and fork sitch. Also, great value for the yums - $30 for a medium with five toppings. Left very satisfied.

Terrible service and food. I ordered deep dish for delivery. I asked for Italian beef as a topping and when it was delivered it was sausage. I do not eat sausage so I called to ask for a new pizza. At first the lady said sorry there's nothing they can do about it as the receipt says sausage. I specifically said Italian beef. They sent a second pizza after 1.5 hours and it was soggy and gross. Frozen grocery store pizza would have tasted better than this! So disappointing...especially because I had guest in town and this totally ruined their Chicago pizza experience.

New favorite pizza place in the city! Although the wait times can be lengthy around lunch time the wait is completely worth it! The lunch special is a wonderful deal and pequods offers a nice selection of drinks and desserts. The only downsides I can think of the is the long wait time for the food (pan pizza takes a long time to make) and the low light. Will be back soon whenever I'm in Lincoln park!

Absolute best pizza in Chicago!!  The caramelized crust proves that mistakes can yield amazing things - it's what sets their pizza apart from all the competition here!  And it's definitely worth the wait (to sit down b/c they're always busy, and for the pizza itself!).  :-D

I hate deep dish. I don't care for it. I don't like all the cheese, the sauce, and the bread. BUT, Pequod's is THE ONLY place I will eat deep dish at. They do it the best!TIP: If you're going on a Saturday night, make sure you get there early, we got there around 5:30pm and we still waited about 20-30 minutes for a table. The environment is loud and busy, so if you wanted a "romantic quiet sit down," this is not the place for you. Anyways, the pizza is made fresh and will take about 40+ minutes until you get it, but I must say IT IS WORTH THE WAIT. I shared a small with another person, and it was enough since I personally don't eat much. I had 1.5 slices and I was quite full. Their service is amazing as well, our waitress was super nice and attentive even though it was so busy inside. LOVE LOVE LOVE Pequod's. BEST deep dish in the city, hands down!

Best deep dish in the city. Hands down phenomenal and amazing. The crust, the thickness and the sausage are everything. I'm a tough critic when it comes to pizza but this is thee best deep dish I've ever had. The only deep dish I eat and forever the undefeated deep dish champ. So much yes

Winter is coming, and what better way to prepare for hibernation with a delectable dairy dish! The deep dish pizzas are worth the wait at this hole in the wall sports bar in Oldtown Chicago.These heaping mounds of sauce, cheese, and your choice of toppings are definitely not what the Italians envisioned when they invented the first pizza. Order your choice of a small, medium, or large platter either to share or devour yourself. But beware, this decadent dish packs a punch. I've seen many a ill-fated customer loosen 1 or 2 belt buckles after trying to conquer these savory behemoths.What I recommend you to do is gather 2 of your most lactose tolerant friends, order yourselves a medium deep dish with sausage, green peppers, and of course, Pequods own freshly grown Chicago basil and prepare for a scrumptious dish.

We absolutely love the food (and convenience) of this place! However, we gotta be real. The pizza is good, but it's not like, g o o d like everyone says it is. And the waitstaff has continuously been so incredibly rude whenever we are there. We live 500 ft away, so we'll go back, but it's never our first choice.

Food was good but massive mess up the one thing I was adamant about was that there was no cheese on any of the salads what was there to much cheese for my vegan girlfriend to notice. Good going guys. Also pineapple is not a veggie it's a fruit.
Excellent deep dish, a bit like Lou's but cheesier and the cheese is carmelized on the sides of the pizza. Great first impression!

This is my absolute favorite pizza joint in Chicago. They use only the best ingredients. I love the bread and caramelized crust. The sausage is the best. The sauce is outstanding. Just the right amount of everything. Be sure to order just enough to get full and take some home for lunch the next day.

In a nutshell: Chicago deep dish in Wicker Park.Came here with family, as it was highly recommended and we were driving through the area. Pequod's is located caddy corner to a fairly new shopping center, with a movie theatre, Barnes and Nobles, etc.Parking 3/5Fairly easy. Found street parking a couple blocks down. There is lot parking across the street, but we didn't want to have to pay.Ambience 3/5The place essentially looks like a long sports bar (yelp.com/biz_photos/pequ…). Bar on the left as you walk in, and most or all of the tables are stool height. Restrooms are in the back across from the kitchen and are pretty clean for a sports bar.Service 4.5/5Actually really good. This earned them the fourth star for me. Our server was really nice, and checked in with us pretty regularly. There was a mix up with our order (I'll get to that later), but she fixed it by giving us half off our food bill. She didn't have too, but the fact that she did was pretty awesome of her.Wait time 1/5Seating - BWaited about 20 minutes for seats. Not badDrinks - AOrdered a pitcher of 312 of the menu (yelp.com/biz_photos/pequ…) and this came out quick.Food - FExpect to wait longer for deep dish, but this time there was a mix up with our order. The tables around us all got their food before us. We ended up not getting our food for almost an hour and a half. By the time it showed up we were hungry and grumpy. However, we were not as grumpy as we could have been, as the server told us beforehand that she would take half off the price of food for us.Food 4/5Jalapeno poppers - 3/5They didn't suck and they tied us over.....kind of.Large Pepperoni Sausage and Onion (yelp.com/biz_photos/pequ…) - ABomb. Very comparable to Lou Malnati's. I'm a huge fan of deep dish, since I don't eat it very often. I'm not a big fan of pepperoni in general (shame on me), but everyone else wanted it.Small Sausage Mushroom and Basil (yelp.com/biz_photos/pequ…) - A-Very tasty but the crust was a bit burnt. Not enough to make it a crappy meal, but then again we had been waiting for over an hour for this. Overall 4/5Food was good, and the service staff did an amazing job trying to make us happy despite of the mix up in the kitchen. Sometimes $h!t happens, but it's all about how they react to it that sets them above other restaurants. Happy with the experience, and I would definitely come back here.

One of my favorite places for pizza. Deep dish. Thin. You name it. It's freakin' delicious.Whenever someone is new to Chicago and asks what place is good for pizza. Say Pequod's.I love the buttery crust.. the edges are nicely caramelized and crispy..The wonderful cheese to sauce to topping to dough ratio is just right.Their selection of craft beer is great to go with your hearty pizza too.It's Hawks season so when you go here on a weeknight expect it to be busy.I love this place. It's always satisfying.
Bar none best pizza in Chicago! The Skokie location is cash only, but so worth the hassle!

What a fun and lively place to go out to eat for some classic Chicago style zaaa!I arrived with a group of 4 on a Tuesday night. Pequod's was busy (as to be expected). We were able to get our first round of drinks from the bar while we waited to be seated. I was very content with the speed of the service from the bartender.Once we were seated, the waitress greeted us promptly and helped us with the menu a bit. She was quick and efficient. Over all the service was immaculate for how busy the restaurant was. Well done. Now on to the food.We ordered bruschetta, wings, and a 12" traditional style pizza with spinach, onion, green pepper and onion. The bruschetta was buttery and light. The wings had a killer buffalo sauce that I would like to purchase to my own use at home. The deep dish pizza was to die for. The crust was super crispy but the dough and cheese in the middle was warm and gooey. Perfect for a cold winter night. Something about their recipe just screams true Chicago deep dish. I would recommend this place to anyone who's got a craving or wants to show some out of towners how Chicago does pizza.

The lunch special available on weekdays -- $5 cheese pizza with choice of pop -- is the best. I visited Pequod's with a family member and we weren't disappointed. Friendly wait service. You may have to wait for it to cook, but it's worth it.

This place is deservedly well known for its pizza, I've never had a better deep dish pizza crust. Which is why I gave it two stars instead of one. That said, there are MAANY issues in this establishment which will make me and many of the other customers who gave up and left that night never come back. First off, the management of the way this place is run is absolutely horrible. People were waiting 2 to 2 and a half hours and being told it would be an hour and a half. Then, people who called in got bumped ahead of everyone else who had ALREADY been waiting for a ridiculous amount of time. Everyone was upset, there was a small uprising, and it made for a very stressful environment. Managers, get your staff and yourselves organized because that was a mess.Second, the place is completely understaffed. There was one hostess for hordes of people trying to ask questions and get their names down. Waitress were given so many tables and people to attend to that they had just enough time to drop your plate and run to the next table, so we could barely get in questions about getting more drinks or more food. The staff were extremely stressed and overwhelmed.The stressful and frustrating experience is not worth it. The pizza is good, but not good enough for that to be ok.
