Yes. Yes. Yes. Yes. Yes.You want legit Chicago deep dish? Come here.  Take it from me, a hot babe with 30 years of deep dish experience.  Bypass any and all appetizers/salads/pointless fillers. You don't need them.  Pequods did not gain fame from spaghetti or hot wings.  You should save room for their delicious, piping hot, physics defying pizza.  HOW they get the bottom so perfectly crispy and the inside so delectably tender is beyond calculation.  It's perfect.  Here's the real key though: limit yourself on toppings.  You don't need a 5-thing pizza.  Keep it to 3 added ingredients, tops.  Even better?  Keep it simpler.  Chicago pizza is not meant to have 10,000 toppings.  1-2 keeps it simple, keeps it perfect.  I'm very sad I didn't have one of the tasty looking cookies though.  Trying to watch my carbs.
I got a deep dish with sausage and pepperoni.I loved every bite I had. Garlic bread was meh for me but my husband loved it.The chocolate cake and cookies so freaking great can't wait to be back!!!

Within an hour of my poor review, the manager put a credit on my account, havent checked to see if it is actually there, but giving him credit for the fast response. I still love their pizza no matter what.

Best Chicago style pizza I ever had, but I'm not a local, so my experience is quite limited.  Staff was friendly and attentive and the pizza was outstanding!  I don't think they do reservations, but you can call ahead and try your luck.

Great deep dish pizza. On a Saturday night, 1 hour wait to get the pizza (the hostess informed the estimated time, so there was no surprise). Caramelized crust and flavorful toppings. Great service too and good beer selection
It was very good. I'm more of a "stuffed pie" guy than a "thick crust" guy, but better than Malnati's.

My fiancée and I were staying in Chicago and got hungry around 11:00 pm. We looked up delivery places in the area and this place showed up. We figured we would give it a try and get it delivered to our hotel. Horrible idea! We placed the order at 11:25 pm. We ordered a meatball sandwich, half order of wings, mozzarella sticks, fries, and a slice of cake The food didn't arrive until almost 1:00 am. Here is the worst part, they completely forgot the meatball sandwich! No sandwich at all. We called back and we were offered a "partial refund" not even sure for how much yet as the refund hasn't went through on my credit card just yet. We were then told the meatball sub would be right out. It didn't arrive until 2:00 am and we had to get up at 7:00 am the next morning. In the meantime waiting we tried the rest of the food. The mozzarella sticks obviously sat for quite awhile. The fries were extremely soggy and just barely cooked. The cake had a very odd refrigerator smell to it. The only thing decent enough were the wings, but you don't get much of them.  When the meatball sub arrived the delivery guy offered us a free pineapple and jalapeño pizza because "he couldn't deliver it". We didn't want it but just said okay with no real intentions of eating it. We opened it up just to see and as I predicted the pizza was burnt! Basically their apology was a burnt pizza someone else didn't want. $38 for some of the worst food I have ever eaten. Absolutely horrible! I would never eat from them again even if the food was free. Just disgusting. They should of refunded the entire order. The free burnt pizza was really offensive and only annoyed me further. The worst service ever!!!Edit: I got my refund today. Only $9.16 which I guess was for the meatball sub. The way the woman over the phone made it sound was that I would be at least getting half the order refunded for their mistake. Oh well. Cheap company that I would never order from again. If you want burnt pizza and bad customer service eat here!

Make your own pizza joint. We ordered 2 and after trying several poorly prepared toppings and burnt crust I'd never come back. However if you like a plain pizza with lack of unique style check it out :)
Always delicious even though it takes 50 years for a pizza. But how else are they going to get the crust so perfectly crispy?? Love Pedquod's.

People always talk about how Pequod's has awesome pizza and based on the reviews on Yelp, my boyfriend and I ordered a large pan pizza for delivery last night. I was expecting a little piece of heaven in my mouth, but it wasn't there. We ordered a large pan pizza with pepperoni, sausage, and green peppers for delivery. After tip, it almost came out to $40, and what a waste of $40 that was. I love the caramelized cheese on the crust and the sweet sauce, but the bread on the pizza wasn't good. It lacked seasoning and didn't taste like anything. It wasn't buttery, it wasn't salty, it wasn't... anything. In my boyfriend's words, it's like they stacked a whole bunch of tortillas on top of each other and then created a pizza with it. Maybe Pequod's isn't good for delivery. I might give this place another try, but I'll definitely dining in.. If I have another $40 to spend on a pizza.

I won't be calling it my favorite pizza... I prefer the stuffed "more cheese less dough" pizza, but that being said it was stupid good pizza. So glad we took up the guy from the apple store's recommendation to give it a try.  Be prepared to wait 50 minutes for your pizza, but when it comes out you will know why.  We loved the caramelized crust!

You will not taste anything else like the crust. Cripsy, buttery, and thick with carmerlized cheese... it may make you faint. If you go to Chicago, you have to come here. Even if you don't like thick crust pizza, this place will turn you into a believer. No brainer 5 star.Also- if you are staying downtown, it is really easy to take the redline down to this part of town and walk there.

Went in a week night. It's small store front but large on the inside. It wasn't crowded when arrived but it gradually picked up the pace. Overall the pan pizza was good. The service was basic. The lightening was dim. The noise volume was loud. They reserve the booths for parties of 3 or more. This is where they lost a star. Honestly it should be first come first serve.

By far the BEST pizza in Chicago!!!  Thick caramelized crust, choose your toppings.  It does not get any better.  This pizza place was recommended to us by a local so we went there.  It's north of most of the  downtown activities but so worth the extra time it takes to get there.  We went twice during out time there it was sooooo good!!!!

I don't get the hype for pequods. No cheese, and way too much dough. I get that it's deep dish but all of that bread is not necessary with no Cheese to compliment it. Just a crunchy outer crust, doughy pizza with sauce. Sorry but Lou malnatis all the way!!

This place is always packed and there are always people waiting to be seated. It's up to you to decide if that's a good thing or bad thing. I love the pizza here both pan and thin crust. There is a reason they are so busy.

Many call this the best deep dish in Chicago. I have only had 2 or 3 different ones so I can't say for sure, but Pequod's is absolutely amazing. Beware, we came on a Monday after 1pm and had to wait over 2 hours to get seated and get pizza. We were very hungry so I cannot give this place 5 stars for time of service alone.

This place is overrated. The crust of pizza was hard but the toppings were legit. I heard a lot of people say top 5. I have to disagree. I had their thin crust too was okay I give that 3.5 and their wings I give a 4 star. Try it for yourself and be the judge. Also not disability friendly took me and my friends to the second floor with a open table on the main floor hostess gets a 1.0

Amazing deep dish pizza! Always the freshest veggies (and LOTS of them). The carmelized crust is so unique! ...I actually look forward to eating the crust when we order from here! Pricey but worth it! LOVE

Wow, I've always heard people say good things about Chicago deep dish pizza, and finally I've experienced it for myself! So just what did I think? Well.... (**channeling Antoine Dodson**), what they say is definitely the truth--Chicago deep dish pizza does indeed rule!  So why did I choose to try Pequod's instead of one of the cliché Chicago pizza joints like Pizzeria Du, Pizzeria Uno, Lou Nalnati's, or Gioradano's on my first visit to the windy city? Well, my boyfriend lived in Chicago for a year and swore up and down that Pequod's was the best. So, being the good partner I am, I took his word for it.  And, he was right-- Pequod's did not fail me... it was awesome! Their deep dish pizza was everything I hoped Chicago pizza would taste like!  Thick, soft-on-the-inside and crunchy-on-the-outside pizza crust.... abundant creamy & bubbly mozzarella cheese... tangy, delicious pizza sauce... and fresh toppings!  Heavenly indeed!As for the atmosphere at Pequod's, it was nice, too! The restaurant is housed in an older building that's been cleverly updated to have a modern industrial look and feel. So, you know immediately that the place is casual, but it's still warm and inviting.
Food: 4Decor: 3Ambiance: 4Service: 3Value: 4An hour wait for a table. An hour wait for the pie. Why can't they combine those two waits? Otherwise, great food at a good price.
A friend of mine introduced me to the spot. Good pizza place! I absolutely loveeee deep dish pizza, but I prefer their thin crust over their deep dish.

My husband  LOVES  their personal pan pizza's -  I just was not a huge fan. I am sorry.  but you know with things  like Burgers  and  Pizza - everyone's  taste  is different.  So many people  LOVE  this place -  I must be the odd man OUT!

This place turned out to be amazing,  I have never been here before but the deep dish pizza was without a doubt one of the best pizzas I tasted in Chicago so far,  the somehow burned crusted made it so special and tasty,  and the serves was very attentive... My new hangout place for pizza

I love this place. We have ordered from Pequod's many times, but this time we actually went to the pizzeria. Our reservation was lost (I think our main guy was late and they gave it away), but we eventually were sat upstairs. It took a while for our pitchers of beer to come to the table, but the place was packed so it was understandable. We know the drill with Pequod's that it takes a while to cook the deep dish pizzas, so we placed an order of apps along with the pizza. The combo appetizer plates were delicious and just what we needed to hold us over. Again the server took his sweet time checking on drinks and filling our waters, but we didn't come here for the service. We did, however, decide ordering out was the best way to go when it comes to Pequod's. Pizza was standard delicious and we were on our way! Tip: Get it delivered.
Newcastle on tap in a frozen mug and the best pizza in the area!

Best deep dish in Chicago I think. Everyone has a preference but the carmelized crust sets this one on top for me. I love a pepperoni, mushroom, basil version and limit myself to 1 every month or so.The crust is so delicious it literally melts in your mouth. Toppings always fresh and did I mention the crust yet?AWESOME!

If you're like me, you won't even read this review because it's more fun to read a 1 or 2 star novel length review from someone who broke up with a significant other whilst on a date at (insert establishment name here). Those type of reviews make me feel like I'm an alright and easy going person, you know?This pizza is delicious. Deep dish is not everyone's favorite, but if you like it, try this place. Best I've had in Chicago after 15 years. And if you can't take a complete stranger's recommendation, perhaps Yelp is not your thing.Do your visiting friends and family a favor and bring them to the local's pizza joint.

BEST deep dish pizza in Chicago! The marinara sauce is extremely flavorful and tastes fresh! Place is loud and a bit dingy and service is REALLY slow which cuts off major points from the review but the pizza is worth going for again and again!

I disliked everything about this place and probably more so because everyone I talked to mentioned how amazing this place was. Our server was a young college kid (like everyone else here) that must've forgotten she was waiting tables because she sat and talked another group of people for 15mins before she took our order. My beer came late and warm and my water was never filled.I don't eat meat, my other two dining mates do, and we each wanted something different from the menu, so we went with personal sizes. First, the prices are offensive. Second, I hate minced garlic from a jar and when I asked if they freshly mince or use it out of a jar, our server rolled her eyes at me and said she didn't know. I never found out the truth because she never offered to find out for us.Look at my burnt pizza: yelp.com/user_local_phot…It was super dry and the red sauce was too tart.

This place was an outstanding deep-dish pizza place that scored well all round.It's a neat old place that has character and thankfully plenty of room since it has upstairs and downstairs.  The deep dish pizza was outstanding, hot with a crispy crust, lots of flavour, cheese, sauce, etc., and the crust was rather caramelized on the edge.  Salads and appetizers were good.  Mozzarella sticks and fried zucchini were great, too.  Pasta (ordered for the one kid who does not like pizza) was good.  Beer selection had some great beers on it but unfortunately lacked darker/red/amber beers that I find to be best with pizza.  Service was great.

Amazing Chicago style pan pizza!! Perfect cheese, perfect sauce, cooked just right. I wanted to keep eating more but I was so full, couldn't even finish the small size. A little far out of the downtown area but worth it to avoid the chains

Loved the pizza here! The burnt cheese edges make the pizza. I'm not a huge fan of a "burnt" taste, but this is more like caramelized. Loved both the sausage pizza (looked homemade) and the cheese. It does take quite a while for them to make it (one hour for us) but we just called ahead and picked it up. So happy we followed the advice of our friend from Chicago!

Unique spin on deep dish. As others have said, it's true the crust is thicker than some other interpretations, but it is fresh, soft and very chewy. I can understand why some feel cheated that they're paying so much for what is essentially focaccia bread, but it has great texture. I think you get plenty of food for the money, so I don't get complaints about price; a large slice (essentially one serving) probably comes in at between three and four dollars and is definitely a meal's worth. Two slices and you'll be stuffed for the rest of the day. Three slices and you'd better be ready to commit to a food coma.On the plus side, they pile the cheese and sauce all the way to the edge and there's barely any sort of crust handle, so that thick bottom is offset by the fact that there isn't much crust at the outside edge of the slice.The trademark "caramelized" crust is really more of a char, giving it a nice smoky flavor like something that came off the grille, a pretty distinctive signature that sets them apart and adds a nice finishing touch to the slice.The sauce tends toward sweet as opposed to savory, however their toppings leave just a bit to be desired. I'm a sucker for Italian sausage, but their sausage seems pretty tame to me. Honestly reminded me more of Italian meatballs and despite the fact it has fennel in it, it doesn't seem to have that distinctive punch I'm used to in authentic Italian sausage. I think it needs a little more zip.You can't go wrong here and I would never turn down Pequod's, but the overall flavor profile just seems a bit simple in contrast to some others I've had. That isn't a dealbreaker, but if you're looking for a more complex mingling of flavors in your tomato pie, there are certainly other options around town. If they amped up the flavors in their sauce and toppings just slightly to give it a little more pizzazz, I'd probably give them a solid five stars.

I don't get the love for this place. Our pizzas lacked flavor, were terribly under-seasoned, and required a large portion of the dried Parmesan found on the table next to ours. The sauce is basically tomato sauce, which also isn't seasoned. The dough with the cheese on the side just tastes like burnt nothing. I don't understand how this is the "best" deep dish in Chicago?! They could honestly learn something from Little freakin' Caesar's about how to do burnt cheese crust. That's how average I find their pizza.
We just threw a surprise party and this place pulled it off perfectly. Such a great experience and of course, the pizza is incredible.

First, let me say I'm going to try this place again and eat there. We got delivery today, one pan pizza and one thin. The meatball on the pan was disappointing too thinly sliced and overcooked, dried out. Not at all worth the premium price for this topping especially since there was so little of it. The caramelized crust was delicious, but there was way too much sauce for my taste. The thin crust was a soggy mess. It wasn't very thin. It wasn't crisp or chewy. Just wet, maybe just doesn't deliver well. The Italian sausage on the thin crust was actually bad - no flavor and a mushy texture. It didn't taste like Italian sausage at all. The staff on the phone and the delivery guy were so nice. Hoping it was a fluke and they were having an off day.

Only 5 years in Chicago and I had not heard of this place. Upon arriving early for a movie (across the street), we decided to give it a try. Thought it was just a little pub that had pizza.It's much larger than it appears (multiple levels). While walking to our table, we notice that every single table had deep dish (normally not a fan), so, we chose to fall in line. WOWWWW. Holy cow. Do not miss this pizza. Insanely good.

I wish I could have negative stars. So disappointed that my friends visiting Chicago had to suffer the disappointment of this place. In short, service and food were so terrible. The two pizzas took an hour and a half to get onto our table. Appetizers took were spaced thirty minutes between each other.If we got her attention, the waitress forgot waters, drinks and extra place settings multiple times. She was nice but just not attentive..In the span of an hour, they messed up my salad three times? All I asked for was no dairy/gluten and even offered to just take it off myself. They insisted and came back all diff variations of cheese and crouton mixes.. In the end, we cancelled it because people were done eating.Management seemed so exasperated and talked about how they messed up our table right next to us?Above all, the pizza was terrible and bland. As hungry as we were, just couldn't stomach that crust they're famous for. It was foamy and bland. Little chunks of caramelized flavor but not enough to offset the rest.We waited to talk with management, but they were so busy and not to be seen.Currently at protein bar cuz im so hungry.
Got thin crust here, it was decent for late night drunk food but nothing special. Great service though!

Was staying at the dana hotel on a business trip, which happened to be within the delivery zone of this number-one-friend-recommended deep dish pizza place in Chicago. Fortunately, I remembered that deep dish takes MUCH longer than the quick-fires that I'm used to, so I ordered about an hour ahead, which was perfect because, with delivery, it took 1 hr 10 min. WORTH IT!! I ordered the personal size (7") with meatballs, mushrooms, and pineapple (toppings are charged per, btw), and man was it delicious!! Their cheese and toppings are so yummy, and that caramelized crust is omgtodiefor. I are the whole thing. It's probably enough for two people of my size (5'6" 125 lbs) to eat, but there was just no way I wasn't going to down every bite of that scrumptiousness. Seriously, I don't care how small you are, get at least a medium if you're sharing or tell whoever you're with to get their own! nom nom nom!!

We have been to many pizza places in Chicago. This is by far the best of the best. It's the crispy, cheesy crust that makes this pizza so unique. Every time we visit, we order a large to go, and freeze when we get home. Heats up very well.

After craving this pizza joint what seemed like forever, I finally had the chance to order for delivery. The deep dish pie primarily consists of bread, which took forever to chew and swallow. However, the caramelized crust was on point, and it's probably the best darn crust I've had in my life.
Incredible pizza. All that needs to be said. Call ahead and they'll get your order started because deep dish/pan pizza takes a while.
Their pizza is unique and heavenly.  We had good service and nice facility.  They are always busy but with good reason
By far the best deep dish pizza in Chicago. This IS THE PLACE to go if a local, tourist please ignore this .

This pizza is the bomb. I'm not a fan of deep dish, but this pizza is an exception. It. Was. Fantastic. They're famous for their "caramelized cheese crust" and for good reason- it was amazing. They have an awesome lunch deal- for $5 you get a fountain drink and a personal sized cheese pizza (you can add extra toppings for an extra charge, but they recommend sticking with cheese only for the best flavor). I got half cheese and half sausage. The sausage was great but I actually enjoyed the cheese half the bestOf note: the pizza takes a solid 30-45 minutes to come out, so don't come here if you're in a hurry

Second favorite pizza in the city (Lou's is #1) but is very close to the best.  The downfall for me is that there aren't many peaquods and its a haul from the south loop.  Their crust is amazing and I'm a big fan of their sauce.  Prices are extremely reasonable.

For my money, this is the best deep dish pizza in Chicago.The sauce and caramelized crust set it apart from the stiff competition in town. Also, definitely get the sausage!As good as the pizza is, it is a bit bready compared to other options around town. I'm totally fine with that, but if that's not your thing, take note. Also, their salads and appetizers are not at the same level as Lou Malnati's and Giordanos. But I like the pizza better - it just barely beats Lou's in my book - which is why you come here anyways.Pro tip - THE LUNCH SPECIAL.

I really do not like deep dish Pizza of any kind. I don't want to hear about how Chicago it is to have deep dish. i don't know how that even started but i guess nowadays you have to be into deep dish to be ChicagoanPequods changed my life forever as far as deep dish goes. it is literally the only Deep dish ill eat and every time i have feasted there (over 5 a t least) i have cleared the plate.Not to mention the staff was awesome, crowd was loud and TVs had sports on. so all in all Pequods is the Bomb!!!!Cant wait to go back!

this is definitely a chicago staple.  I live not too far from here so I go a bit. It takes about an hour n some change for a pie when its busy (evenings and sunday nights) so plan ahead. Honestly get the much reccomended pan pie, their thin crust is lacking
SO GOOD, pricey though thats the only thing keeping me away.
Hands down best pizza in Chicago.  It's what I recommend to every out of towner.  Forget Lou Malnatis, forget Giordanos, forget Gino's East.  If there is one place to eat pizza here, it's Pequod's.

I'm in love. I always hated deep dish pizza but now I realize how wrong I was! The combination of their crust, sauce, and overflow of toppings makes this place delicious.The only thing that kinda stinks is the wait. This place is poppin and gets busy right at 11. I got a little anxious waiting for my heavenly personal pizza.

One of the top places to get Chicago-style pizza in Chicago.  For me the only hard question is whether Pequods is merely "one of the top," or is "the best."  The ring of carmelized cheese and the crunch crust are both trademarks and in my view they are both excellent touches.  My only complaint is that the bottom crust is sufficiently thick that there's a slightly higher ratio of bread to toppings on this pie than there is in some of Pequod's competitors.  For some people this last factor is not a complaint at all, and in any event Pequod's is in the very top tier.

We went on a Friday night and this place was SUPER packed. The doorbell from people leaving and entering was literally going off every minute or so -- that's how popular this place is! The wait wasn't too long though,  we waited for 30 minutes to get a seat. We got a medium deep dish with spinach on the whole pizza, pepperoni on one half and sausage on the other. We've tried our fair share of deep dish pizzas and this one was quite delicious. And the crust is amazing! Price-wise, it's interesting because all their default pizzas are only cheese and you have to pay ~$2 for each topping. So it's cheaper if you only get cheese, but if you end up getting toppings like us, it comes out to about the same as other deep dish pizza places.

So great going here every time I'm in this city. I always manage to take home 3 personal pies for the flight home. BEST deep dish around, don't be fooled by all the advertisement and billboards throughout the city.

When a friend of mine mentioned Pequod's as her favorite deep dish in Chicago, my curiosity was definitely piqued.I'm here all night, folks.Eating at Pequod's is a great experience.  The place is just an unassuming bar with a good amount of TVs to just hang out and wait for a delicious pizza to be brought to your table, served right in the pan, no less.Not gonna lie, I miss early 90's Pizza Hut so bad.The service is attentive; two of us at the table were having coffee for lunch (it was a long night) and they kept the pot filled for basically just the two of us.  So onto the pizza.  We got a sausage/mushroom/spinach pizza and a meatball/peppers pizza.  You got big hunky pieces of topping with a yummy sauce and a nice crisp crust to go with it.  Our two pies varied pretty greatly in crust thickness, but either way, both were great.  The biggest negative, however, is that they fall into the trap of soggy veges.  If you have too many veges in your pie, it's just leaving a ton of moisture on there leaving everything a slippery mess and even worse when reheating it.  There are definitely a couple different things they could do to avoid this, like chopping them into smaller pieces, ensuring that they're on the top to let moisture escape, using a salad spinner after chopping, etc.We had some leftovers and because of said sogginess a lot of that cheese just oozed off, which is unfortunate.  Also, the crust got pretty saturated too, so even with a pizza stone, the dough was still pretty soggy.So yeah, for now I would say avoid having too many veges on your pie and avoid taking it home.  It's just not a very good experience.However, despite all of that, I might like this better than the big three...

Overall it was ok pizza. Almost a focaccia crust-yummy, but a lot of bread. Loved the crispy cheesy cast iron outer crust. Not what I would consider "deep dish". Reminded me of Jets.....unfortunately.
The carmelized crust is as good as they say... but the rest of the pizza is only good.  For my money, I prefer their thin crust.Beware LOOOOOOOOONNNNNGGGG lines to get in

For the last three weeks I have been in Chicago working, during that time I have been on an amateur food tour of the city. This place is the only review I have made, it's absolutely incredible. Best deep dish I have ever had, the Carmelized crust is out of this world. Sauce is homemade and wonderful. Can't wait to come back
Easily the best deep dish in Chicago. I don't recommend the sausage on their pizza, though.

It's the CRUST!!!! and all the stuff on top of it. I love this place. I always take out of town visitors here. Pick your toppings, and go for it. The downside is for some reason here I always go for that extra slice that puts me over the edge of fullness. So good!

Really great. My first Chicago pizza, and it did not disappoint. Service is a bit slow, but I hear that's typical of the Midwest, and totally understandable for a deep dish. I'd go back again and recommend it to anyone who visits.

Been here a few times since friends have wanted to go. Basically, this place is a bar that serves inconsistent pizza. Good for the 20-something crowd who don't mind having to yell their conversations because the whole place is so loud. Service is good. Last time they messed up our order but gave 50% off without having to ask. 2 hour waits for popular times so be sure to contact them 24 hours in advance to get the priority seating which will cut your wait time in half.

I have just found my new favorite Chicago-style pizza place. The winner goes to Pequod's Pizzeria.This place has the most variety in terms of appetizer selections. I believe appetizers are important for deep dish pizza-serving restaurants largely due to the expectation that these pizzas take longer to make than thin crust ones. In addition, the Pequod's salad is pretty decent (the creamy garlic sauce is clutch). As for the pizza itself, I was astonished. The crust, including the bottom, was crispy and solid. This is difficult to come by. I've always experienced softer/soggier bottom crusts due the way that deep dish pizzas are made in general. In addition, I'm a huge fan of their sausage topping. I definitely think they use a better grade of sausage than other pizza places. The most impressive thing I noticed at Pequod's is the relatively short amount of time it takes to bake the pizzas. I daresay it was the fastest I've seen a Chicago-style deep dish pizza come out. Service is great, the pizza is superior, and prices are relatively cheaper than those at similar restaurants. I haven't taken advantage of this special yet, but if you dine in for lunch (Mon-Fri 11AM-3PM) at Pequod's, you can get a 7" pan pizza with a soda or beer for $4.95.

We often go to Pequod's with another couple prior to going to see a movie at the Webster 11 across the street.  This is one of our favorite pies in the city.The Good:The pizza.  Both the deep dish and the thin crust are exemplary.  The other item we really enjoy are the Jalapeno Poppers; they are filled with cheddar cheese instead of the typical cream cheese and it makes for a very delicious appetizer.  I would encourage anyone to try the sampler as well.  This place also has some great beer selections; I'm personally a big fan of the Half Acre Lead Feather.The Bad:Occasionally they will overcook the pizza, usually the pan.  A couple times I've had mine come out with a burnt bottom, which doesn't ruin the meal but is rather disappointing.Also, if you order a Pan Pizza it will take over an hour... not necessarily a bad thing but definitely something to keep in mind.The Ugly:Make sure you call ahead for seating, the host stand is a hot nightmare.  Everything is done old school with pen and paper and everything is very disorganized.  My wife and I once had to eat at the bar because we had been told we had an hour and a half wait after having waited for an hour and a half already (I think the host got his sheets of paper out of order and was seating people who had just showed up while we continued to wait).  I understand it's not easy to deal with a restaurant when it is as small as Pequod's and gets as busy as Pequod's does, but the people at the host stand are often overwhelmed and nowhere near up to the task.That said, this place is a Chicago staple for a reason, and a definite must-eat for anyone trying to sample the city's best pizza.

I have had many, many deep dish pizzas in my time and then I moved to Chicago from the suburbs and heard about the secret known as Pequods. I had to try it for myself. The virdict... one of the best pies in the City. The toppings are fresh and largely cut, the crust is a blackened delicious Joy. This is a must visit restaurant hands down. You must try this out.

Best deep dish in Chicago. Hands town. Got introduced to this pizza by my college gf and fell in love and haven't looked back. I like to call it cake pizza though - I can eat for about five days afterward if I order a large. Sooooo worth it though.Also - would argue that the actual place is far better then ordering out though. Great beer, good vibes, great service.

5 star pizza- 3 star service. Really good pizza. Went on pizza tour and fell in love with the pizza. Went back our next trip to Chicago and the pizza was great again but the service wasn't the best. Didn't mind waiting an hour for pizza but the waitress seemed like they could care less if they we were there or not. Constantly had to wait for soft drink refills. Will come back for the pizza but wishing for a five star experience next time.

So after I wrote my first review, the owner contacted me privately and apologized and asked what he could do to. I responded to that message and he never replied. So it makes me feel like he was being insincere. I definitely will not be returning.

Born and raised in Chicago, my boyfriend and I are both Gino's fans. Like Lou's too. Went to pequods for the first time last week and it seemed like the crappier combo of those two. Crust kinda reminds me of Lou's, sauce and cheese of Gino's (if you can even consider what they put on it to be sauce). To be honest, the crunchy burnt cheese or whatever it is on the crust was gross. In addition, the pizza had no taste. My boyfriend said the leftovers were disgusting. The Caesar salad was also weird; I've never had one with mixed greens before. It honestly seemed like a house salad with Caesar dressing but I guess that's how they do it. The Chicago location is a dump, one of the dirtiest establishments I've ever been in. I sat down and had sauce on my shirt and a dirty mushroom on my leg cause the table was dirty. People who think this is the best in Chicago or even represents Chicago are insane.

Literally the rudest people ever work here. Grey haired man at the door a jerk from the moment we walked on. Empty tables not being sat while people are waiting an hour and a half. Don't waste your time.

A friend asked me for a recommendation for Chicago pizza last week. I would have sent him to Burts Place, but he was just driving through the city. Pequods is the first joint that came to mind. Being back in SoCal, I really miss the Chicago deep dish pizza.

Holy Deep Dish, this place is amazing! I'm from out of town, and I've had the usual suspects for "famous" Chicago style pizza. They were good, but nothing like Pequod's. There is something about the crust; it's light and crispy and flavorful. We just did pepperoni and sausage. We were warned not to overdo it. Between the two of us, we got a small pizza (two pieces each), fried zucchini, and a pitcher of beer, and it was perfect. Totally worth the wait.
So delicious! Chicago style pizza at its finest. Delicious tomato sauce, super crispy and flavorful crust. Great beer options as well, several local craft brews.

When coming to Chicago with 4 other friends, one thing was decided. We must stop for deep dish pizza. Off a recommendation from a friends brother, we ended up stopping at Pequod"s.The place has two floors and i like the upstairs a bit more. They have a fair selection of pizzas but since 5 people couldn't agree on any 2 toppings, we decided to go with personal one. I had the mushroom and meatball. I thought it was pretty good, for Chicago pizza. Doesn't compare to the pizza parlor i eat at, at home. Where the guy is from Italy with a heavy accent but i still liked it. Also if they ask you for appetizers because it take 5 minutes to make, you heard them wrong. It takes 35 minutes to make. Our waitress said it right but we just didn't hear it. Get an app if your hungry. While i prefer my normal pizza to deep dish, if you have never had it, Pequod's is an awesome place to go. Also the upstairs bathroom has a big Gandolf face painted on the wall that watches you pee, Kinda freak but worth seeing in itself. From second had information the woman's bathroom has something with arewn.
This is THE best Chicago style pizza.  The pan pizza is just the best, I think it would win next to any other Chicago style pizza.

I have been going to Pequod's from about 15 years. I don''t lie in the area, but try to make it out there every now-and-then.They char the edge of the pizza crust topped with cheese making their already delicious pizza so much better. It is truly unique and really tasty. The location is your standard pizza joint, nothing fancy, but last I was there they were quite family-friendly. The staff is also diner-friendly, some friendlier than others.
My favorite pizza in Chicago.  The pan pizza crust reminds me of Quatro's back in Carbondale.  Pequod's can be pretty busy, so be prepared!

Just a couple hours after wolfing down that burger at Aria, I was off on a group pizza tour of Chicago that my company was hosting for our clients. First up was Pequod's. This was my favorite pizza of the night but not my all-time favorite Chicago pizza (see Lou M's). The sauce was a touch on the sweeter side and the cheese was very sparse. yelp.com/biz_photos/pequ…There were however two standout qualities of this pizza that stuck in my head; 1) the meats were above par, especially the sausage and 2) the outer crust was phenomenal. It had a nice crisp layer of baked on cheese that was just incomparable. Toward the end of the meal I was just picking at the crust, all while knowing I had a lot more pizza to eat. yelp.com/biz_photos/pequ…Overall, not bad at all and I would not mind going back.

All right lets get right into the nitty gritty!!!!!I've been eating pequods for some time now. The pizza is always second to none. No issues here. And the crust.... :)I know a few farmers from downstate Illinois who harvest every vegetable the seasons allow. If they knew, that the drec a la drec was being served at this restaurant, they would cancel all outbound veggie shipments to this place. I'm talking of course about the Pequod salad. Whoever prepares these awkward collection of dried lettuce, mediocre toppings, and dressing that has enough oil to start a forest fire, should go pound salt!!!!!! I know it's a pizza business but for Christ sake - STAY AWAY FROM THE SALAD - GIVE THE 9.99 TO A PEDDLER ON THE CORNER!!!!!

FINALLY made it out here - let me preface this by saying I don't normally like deep dish pizza. I know, I know - I'm a Chicago traitor.  I usually find deep dish to be too clunky and heavy, when I get pizza I want to eat four or five slices at least, and you just can't do that when you're eating deep dish.. unless you have the appetite and stomach capacity of a sumo wrestler.We split a medium deep dish pizza topped with sausage, giardiniera, and onions.  While it does take a bit of time to bake (they need time to make that great crispy crust) - the wait is well worth it.  I've never had such a flavorful and well cooked deep dish crust.  The balance of sauce, toppings, and cheese was also on point.  Will definitely be coming back when I'm having substantial pizza cravings.Check out my full review and pictures at thehungrynoodle.weebly.c…
Good was decent it was a 30 min wait but it was decent waitress was really nice.... Pizza  was decent appetizers was OK
Can't beat that crust on the pan pizza! And the sausage is top notch! Try adding garlic for the final kick.

We ordered two pizzas we were on a pizza crawl. Thin sausage came burnt ate it anyway. We did not complain because it was our first time there and didn't know if it was suppose to be burnt. All the hoopla over this place how and why would they serve a burnt pizza right? Ordered a deep dish sausage also. It looked burnt but was told by the waitress it was suppose to look like that. I only asked because the waitress was wrapping our thin crust for us to take home and pointed out to us our thin crust was burnt. lol lol lol lol. She adjusted our bill. I don't understand the appeal of this place. Sausage tasted like allspice. Not a fan. As far as the staff at the door they are not welcoming and really lack any hustle. They seated us pretty fast but I had to ask for a server after ten minutes.  We arrived at 4:30 on a sunday afternoon. While waiting for our pizza we observed at least 25 people waiting to get a table. I wont be back not my taste or atmosphere.
This is seriously the best deep dish pizza I have ever eaten.  Blows Ginos East out of the water.Great service, great atmosphere.

Yeah, this is pretty great pizza. Unique to their deep dish is the bit of burnt/carmelized cheese around the edges. It sounds crazy to describe something burnt as good, but it is. The sauce is so rich in flavor, the sausage is homemade to perfection, and the crust is crispy at the bottom while the insides are cooked just right. Because it takes a long time to cook (30-40 min.) give them your pizza order as soon as you can. Their onion rings are out of this world but the Pequod house salad is unremarkable. They are always packed so come early. They don't take reservations but you can get priority seating if you call ahead. I want to withhold a star because it is nuts to go there on the weekend and with tons of people it gets really loud but the pizza is just so good.
The wait is awful, but all is forgiven when the pizza arrives. Amazing pizza and the crust is super yummy!

Best Pizza in Chicago. We recommend eating a late  lunch and then walking to Wrigleyville for some baseball or shopping, the walk shows off the great qualities of Chicago Neighborhoods. Takes just under an hour. Do the Deep Dish with sausage and then go from there!

Always excellent pizza. We just booked the private party room upstairs for our wedding rehearsal and are so excited! Sean is the best and the space is great. He gets right to the point in the emails when responding to book the private room and no time is wasted. Very flexible. Good draft beer list also included in the package. We can't wait!
Sooooooo disappointed! Ordered extra cheese & barely got any on a 16" Thin. 6 tiny pieces of sausages? What is up with the "hype" on this pizza? No real taste yo the sauce & too much dough.

This place has the feeling of a typical neighborhood trendy bar. Nice enough, nothing surprising, nothing bad. When I went with my friends it was packed to the point we had to wait 2 hours to be seated.... despite some "reserved" seats being available for nearly 90 minutes while we were standing around waiting. I can't really blame the establishment for holding a reserved table, I guess, but maybe I feel like I want to.More importantly, the pizza is not really deep dish. I guess I would describe it as a regular pan pizza with extra sauce. It wasn't rich and hearty like Giordano's and wasn't loaded with fixings either. It was just a thicker pan pizza.I got nothing to hate here, really. Just nothing to rave about either.

Saw this of the food network and made it one of my must go to places when I visited Chicago. Waited 50 mins for medium deep dish pie which was perfectly fine with me and it was worth the wait. This pie is beautiful and a work of art. Oh yeah, it Tate's good too. Love the cheesy crust. It is also really good while cold for breakfast since this pie a huge even for 2 people.
Amazing, amazing, amazing. True Chicago-style deep dish pizza. Crust is filling, but not dense. Sauce is light and and very tasty. Stellar pizza.

Best Chicago style pizza! Skip all of the other touristy places and head up to Pequod's. They have the best lunch deal! For less than $5 you can get a personal cheese deep dish and a drink. Don't miss this!You know this a good place when Chicago PD is eating there.
4.5. Loved the sauce and the sausage. Good pepperoni too. A small was enough to be comfortably full. Could have eaten another slice but would have hated myself.

My husband and I love this place so much!!! Yesterday we went to get our favorite pizza and of course there was a huge line like always but, we were happy to wait! Luckily across the street this wonderful book bar just opened a few months ago called The Kibbitznest and we were able to have a nice drink there while we waited with our clicker. We even got a discount on beer and wine because we had a clicker!! It was fantastic! The bar tenders at the Kibbitznest held onto our clicker while we explored the beautiful place and came to get us when it buzzed to eat our favorite pizza!!! Couldn't have asked for a better night that began at the Kibbitznest and ended at Pequods!

Initially I was planning on going to another pizzeria, but everyone in the office (ALL FROM CHICAGO) began telling me about this place... Truly the best pizza I've tried in Chicago.  A solid #2 overall.  I'm sure there's enough people telling you about the details, but if you're going for pizza in Chicago, skip the tourist attractions, go for this place and get the pan pizza.
Best pizza in Chicago hands down. Crust is perfect, toppings are great and they use real tomatoes instead of some canned sauce for toppings. Absolutely delicious.

Came here today for lunch and had a personal pizza with pepperoni and sausage. As someone who makes their own pizza from scratch several times a week, I thought this pizza was ok. The toppings were very fresh and the wait time wasn't as long as lou malnati's.  If you are used to your large chain restaurant pizzas such as pappa johns and pizza hut you will probably think this pizza tastes amazing.

Been here a few times and love the place. This offers something a little different to Lou's. The atmosphere, the drinks and the sports bar feeling. This place can fill up quickly on weekends and get a little noisy but its worth the wait.I'm torn between Lou and Pequod's as to my favorite all time Pizza. However, I do love the rustic pans, caramelized base and crust. Service is with a smile. This place is dang cheap and services great food

I eat A LOT of pizza.  In my world, there is no such thing as bad pizza.  Hands down, this is the best pizza I have ever put into my body.  And there has been a lot of pizza in this body.I had it 11 hours ago, and I'm considering a trip up there for lunch.

Food: Love, love, love this place! This is the best deep dish pizza in Chicago and I don't care if I have to wait for it. Love the crunchy cheesy crust and the sauce is amazing! Try the meatball, pepperoni and green pepper combo. Yummmmm! Oh but I tried the salad once and it was just okay but hey, you come here for the pizza right?Service: Always on point! The waitresses are cheerful and fast. That's saying a lot considering how busy and how tightly packed it is on the first floor.My husband and I have decided that Pequod's will be our last meal should we ever move away from Chicago.

Wow, expected a lot!!!  Actually just expected people to get my order right.  Sent me the wrong pizza after waiting an hour and a half for delivery.The wings tasted terrible and had weird texture.  Skip them!The garlic bread was over buttered and over seasoned, couldn't even finish them!Honestly, the pizza was good, but how do they get the order completely wrong? Luckily I wasn't allergic to green olives because they added those.** Asked for meat on one half.... they put it on the entire pizza.  My girlfriend is vegetarian.  She couldn't eat,  ruined her night.  Real upset I spent $35 on what I did not want.

Awesome spot with great food and beer, as the wait times for a table during peak hours can attest. I've had both the thin crust and the deep dish pizza and both are amazing - although I'm a bigger fan of the deep dish pizza. The crust is perfectly crispy, thick, and buttery. Pequod's definitely doesn't skimp on toppings, either, so each bite of pizza is the perfect combination of crust, sauce, cheese, and toppings. Definitely one of my favorite pizza joints here in Chicago. If you come without a reservation, don't let the long wait time turn you away - the pizza is definitely worth the wait!

I visited the Morton grove location which is the original and it is no comparison to the Clybourn location. It was still good but it was no match for Clybourn. The Clybourn location has more and bigger toppings and even the cheese is cheesier. This will always be my favorite pizza place.

My family and I stumbled upon this great pizza place by accident. My dad and I signed up for a 5 mile race down town and had to pick up our packet at Running Away Multisport that is a few doors down. Being from the suburbs we were unfamiliar with the area and decided to walk down the street to find something to eat for dinner. As we walked past Pequod's the smell of their great pizza literally stopped us in our tracks. The Pizza smelled so good we did not look any farther and went in.When we walked in the place was very busy and we were greeted by the hostess who informed us that we would have a fairly long wait ahead of us. It was a Friday night so we expected a wait. She said if we would like we could wait at the bar area. The bartender took our orders and told us that if we like we could look at a menu and place our order ahead of time or wait till we go to our table. We opted to wait till we got to our table and they had no problem with that. For being as busy as they seemed I expect to be rushed but this was not the case. Restaurants make money through a high turn over but our waitress didn't mind letting us take our time to enjoy the experience.Since this first experience we have braved the weather and Chicago traffic from the suburbs several times to go back for their awesome pizza. If you are in the area and looking for some deep dish pizza with crust you probably haven't had before (caramelized) give Pequod's a try.

I was new in town this past weekend trying to compare NY style to Chicago style. Went to 4 different places, the names everyone mention, and was not impressed. A cashier from the Laguanitas Brewery on W 17th St really recommended this place. The last night I was in town I had to give deep dish another try before knocking it and I have to say this is the absolute best deep dish I could find.

Great deep dish pizza for a steal. Service was good, pizza (pepperoni) was tasty, and there wasn't much of a wait (granted we did get there kind of early for a Friday night). Their pizza is a bit more doughy than cheesy, so although we did feel like fat kids afterwards we weren't in a food coma as can sometimes happen. Definitely would come back.

In my humble opinion, best pizza in town. Not going to get into the debate on deep dish vs. pan vs. whatever-the-fuck but have a couple slices of this and tell me that crust isn't the standard bearer for deliciousness. Fun, noisy atmosphere. Great for a bite before the movie or with a group for a birthday. Grab a cocktail at Drinking Bird while you wait!

I am not a huge fan of deep dish BUT I am a huge fan of Pequod's deep dish!!! That has to mean something right?! Don't get sucked into the hype with Lou Malnati's because Pequod's is significantly tastier, and it's so much more well made! I never thought I'd see the day when I would be craving deep dish. :) Thank you so much Pequod's!!

The carmelized deep dish pizza here is second to none in the Second City! Great for take out if you live nearby and keep the pizza hot and ready for eating! So many different toppings to create mouth-watering pizzas. I particularly like having pineapple with bacon on mine.The location in Morton Grove is great and very handy for north suburban residents off of I-94. It is located in a charming little woodsy building that is intimate and fun. If you haven't tasted Pequod's, check it out. It is a top-notch Chicago deep-dish pizza experience.

Maybe we went on an off night, but I wasn't really feeling Pequod.  Here are my thoughts:1.  Not really a deep dish pizza, but more of a pan pizza.   Think thick crust like Pizza Hut.2.  Tomato sauce, pepperoni, cheese and sausage were good and of high quality.3.  Sauce to cheese ratio was completely lacking.  There were sections when I honestly could not find ANY cheese.I left the meal feeling pretty underwhelmed.  Paying $30+ to eat thick bread with a smear of tomato sauce, cheese, and 2 pieces of sausage per slice.  Again, maybe we went on an off night, considering all of the other great reviews.

They have thin and thick crust and a range of apps, so there's something for everyone (who's not a vegan or health nut, I'd say). The thick crust was good, probably as good as any I've had. It took a good while to come. The restaurant feels like a local place. It's a bit dark inside. The staff is friendly, although not super attentive.

Oh, Pequod's. I travel to Chicago quite a bit, and each time I need to either make a stop here or have them deliver, that's how obsessed I am (and I've had them all-- Giordano's, Malnati's, Uno's, Pizanos)!In a nutshell, it's the best deep dish you'll find in the city-- the blackened crust is amazing, and the fillings are always incredible. The pizza is always on point, but their delivery service is something that lives much to be desired; the couple of times I ordered it delivered, they delivered it without pre-slicing it, and even though I requested paper plates and napkins and they said they would bring them, the driver never brought them with our order (something that made eating the pizza a bit of a challenge).Also, be wary of asking them to deliver to hotel rooms-- the last driver we had called repeatedly to complain about having to deliver to the room and asked us to meet him down the street. An hour of phone tag later and we finally got our pizza. Dude, next time just park in front of the hotel!!Five stars for the food, two and a half for delivery.

As a lover of Chicago pizza, I was anxious to try Pequod's deep dish with caramelized crust.  The pizza has a copious amount of rich sauce with a thin layer of cheese and large chunks of meat.  All of the ingredients made this one of the freshest pizzas I've had in Chicago.  Clearly they don't skimp out on the quality.  What proved to be disappointing for me, however, was how thick and chewy the dough is.  I understand the concept of deep dish but this was almost pure bread with a very very thin topping smothered in sauce.  Overall the pizza is fresh and high quality, but far from my favorite in Chicago and certainly not worth the hype.  Service wise, Pequod's deserves a full 5 stars for their attentive wait staff.

Let me start by saying, I absolutely LOVE pizza. So, when I came to Chicago, I made it my mission to find the best. After several recommendations for the best pizza, we ended up at Pequod's off the late night. We were seated right away which was great because we were starving. I'm giving this place only  because of the wait.  Took about 15 minutes for our wings which is normal but an HOUR, maybe a lil more (no exaggeration) for my pizza.  Not sure if this is the norm but if so, don't go there starving because you'll have an attitude.My review of the pizza, "a good regular". Crust was great!  Sauce/flavor was lacking a bit. Guess I was expecting nothing short of heaven because of how long we waited to get our food.Do I HAVE to go back? No. Especially if I'm super duper hungry.

Pequod's is consistently delicious!  When I moved to my condo, it took at least a year and a meeting in the elevator with the delivery driver to learn that Pequod's delivers to my building!  What a pleasant surprise! Delivery is speedy and hot!  The restaurant is a very nice little spot with an upstairs and comfortable seating.  Staff is always pleasant, even during high capacity times and it's always a pleasant experience.

After hearing a lot about this place from friends, my wife and I decided to finally give it a try. And what do you know: it's now one of our favorite pizza spots. Located in a good area with lots of shopping and even a movie theater across the street, this place starts off great. You walk in, there is always a line up so you put your name down and stand with the crowd with a pager in your hand. In the mean time, you can order your pizza so that when it's time for you to be seated, the pizza won't be too long. Since this is a sports bar as well, it is very crowded but lively. Don't let the place fool you because there is another floor upstairs with lots of seating room. We sat upstairs both times that we visited. The appetizers are also fresh and tasty. But let's talk about the thick crust pizza: it's NOT like pizza UNO, like Giordano's, or any other deep dish pizza you might think of. This is in a class of its own. The deep dish pizza is covered with the toppings you want which is one thing I like to see...more toppings than cheese. As you bite into, or cut into the pizza, you notice that even though it is thick crust, it's not too soft or too hard or full of dough. Somehow, the thick crust isn't as dough-like as you would think and therefore, not as filling as you would think. It's perfect! The outer crust area on top has their special touch to it: it is burnt cheese all around the top which gives it more of a different flavor when added to the pizza takes the whole experience to another level. Overall: one of our favorite pizzas in Chicago. For a regular pizza outing, I would choose Pequod's over any other "deep-dish" Chicago pizza.

It's our tradition, following a hard weekend at Renegade Craft Fair to hit up Pequod's for delicious pizza. It's always so delicious and worth the wait. This review is mainly about the service received. We sat down, party of 5, and requested waters right away - it was a long long day. Server comes back, no waters, takes our drink order (including mentioning waters again). Returns with beers, no waters. We ask one more time for water and she hears us as if we had never asked before.  5 waters are then brought to the table and the final one was dumped, ice bucket challenge style on my friends sitting on the end. They were shocked out of their mind.  I never heard her, but others said she said sorry at that time, but it was so much commotion that it didn't come across. She brought over napkins and then that was it. My poor soaking friends took it in great stride. We know accidents happen, we just wish there had been some sort of apology. Some remorse over the fact that they had to sit in the super A.C.'d upper level with a huge puddle at their feet and freeze as we waited for our pizza. Pizza arrived, delivered by someone one else and she lost control of the scalding pan and it slid on the table right towards my friend who received the brunt of the water. Thankfully the server caught it before it could burn the crap out of my friend, but seriously, the only torture we expect pizza waiting is from our grumbly stomachs, NOT the waitstaff. Again, TOTALLY get accidents happen. We have all been servers before, I just would have handled that situation so differently. I would have apologized more than once, I would have come back to see if we were comfortable, I would have offered to move us so we didn't have a puddle at our feet, and I would have talked to my manager to see if there was any sort of compensation that could be provided. That's basic customer service. We were all kind of appalled to see that not even the ice tea was comped. Perhaps it's entitlement, but I can't remember the last time I was at a restaurant and a mistake went unacknowledged like that. Now here was the hardest part. As check was delivered, and again, no apologies were ever made outside of the drop we had to contemplate tip. Some would say none, the service was terrible. Some would say the regular 20%, accidents happen. I kept going back and forth, again being a server... what if this was the worst day of your life and this happened to you.  But again, if it was me that would inspire me to take great care of a table and show them how sorry I was. I wound up tipping 12% .... and we are most likely taking our tradition somewhere else next time.

My review might be colored by the fact that the pizza at Pequod's was the very first deep dish I'd had, but I absolutely loved it!I was in Chicago for the holidays, to visit friends, and someone suggested Pequod's for proximity reasons. Although I did get to have deep dish pizza again during my stay, and from a different place, there's no way I can compare that and Pequod's.How do you describe deep dish pizza? Let me just say that I understand why it's called a "pie" now. In fact, that's how I can best describe it - a very tomatoey, very cheesy, very meaty pie, with a hot, crisp crust!We went for a medium sausage pizza to be shared by 4, and underestimated how large and heavy it will be. It took 45-50 minutes to prepare, but two slices, and I was done!Don't get there when you're extremely hungry, because in all likelihood, there's gonna be a line when you get there, and then the wait for the pizza. But MAN the pizza is amazing!

I always just get mine to go, so I can't say anything of the service here. However, the pizza is always fantastic! It's also great that they're open so late. Definitely a must try for anyone looking for something new!

Best pizza place in the city, they don't do standard chicago deep dish. I think that's a good thing because nothing kills the night faster than a stomach full of cheese and sausage. The caramelized crust is something unique, the toppings are plentiful and service prompt.
One of my fav Chicago deep dish pizza places. Sometimes hard to get a seat as there are long lines but worth it!

Oddly enough, despite my preference for NY style pizza, my friends ordered from Pequods last evening (I had Lou Malnati's at work during the day..check out that review from same day)No 'thin crust' this time just the deep dish with a pound of mozzarella and lots of sauce...For what it is, it was okIf you're looking for which is better Lou's vs Pequods I vote Pequods

The staff was great & so was the atmosphere. I had the individual pizza & it wasn't very good. It was really doughy & dry/over cooked with skimpy toppings.  I can definitely see the charm of the place even w/the less than average pizza.

Had to check out this historic spot. Great atmosphere. Long wait on a Friday at 1 for a table.  We opted for the bar and had no wait. It's first come first serve.  Pizza was great picture is of a small pizza for two. Staff was nice.

Meh. Pizza was just ok, nothing special, nothing to rave about. Although we are from Vegas, we wanted to try real Chicago pizza and a lot of people told us about this place.We searched high and low for this place and of course there was a huge wait by the time we got there, but that's ok, we don't mind waiting. When we finally got the pizza, it just didn't taste as fresh as we had hoped, the sauce was basic and it smelled like Pizza Hut  maybe we set our expectations too high or maybe we should have gone here first before trying other pizzas. Not my first choice.

Standard LP faire with great pizza and a bar vibe.  The pizza is what you go for, not the ambiance (which is like a college bar), not the location (on a boring intersection on Clybourn).I love their lunch specials and the place is not crowded at that time either.  Try it and you will love it.

Well. After recommending this place to everyone I know who visits my hometown, I'm thinking my endorsements may have been a mistake. I defend this place A LOT against warnings of insufferable service and bad crowd control. I am willing to cut them a lot of slack for their pizza. It is an attraction for which a bad personality is sometimes forgivable. And I've been coming long enough that I know better than to expect reliable service on a Saturday, or to attempt a table during the NBA playoffs. But on a Tuesday night, in the summer offseason with zero sports, you'd think the expectation of actually getting to eat the pizza you called in 20 minutes prior that was put in 'right away' is reasonable. Yeah?We order at 6:30. We get there after a cross-town trek. We think we're fine, since there's no wait when we called, and the order went in awhile ago. We go to check in amid largely vacant tables... and are told it'll be a 40 minute wait JUST to sit. What?Pequods, I get it. Your justification makes sense, it's just not very good. I work in customer service, and I know there's 'technically' no responsibility for you to update patrons (who already ordered and are headed to your restaurant) that an influx of HUGE parties has added 40 minutes to your previously nonexistent wait, but when you are bitchy about it on arrival, and act like it's unreasonable to be taken by surprise by this development, that's what stops fans from endorsing you. Did you have to call? No. If you had? You would've saved your loyal customers $20 in cab fare, a shitload of traffic, respect, and a wasted pizza. My life isn't your problem, I get that, but there's a courtesy in not springing this on a party for whom you've already told you're cooking food for. That's how you become a restaurant whose patron recommendations start carrying warnings.I've happily put up with the unpredictability on weekends or during sports events, but as a loyal recommender of this place, I'm really disappointed. I don't whine. I just want whoever monitors this to know that it's becoming a reputation people are listening to. Also, there were a ton of open tables given parties of 40 and 25 were supposedly occupying the bulk of the place, but given everything else I guess I'm not shocked we have a difference in logic. Pizza's the best in chicago if you can deal with the side of shit. Up to you.
This is the best deep dish pizza I have had. If you got a taste for pizza try this place it will be worth it.

The gnats walking all over the wall probably didn't help me enjoy this restaurant. I've been here twice, hoping I'd understand why the lines are so long to get in, but I haven't.  I don't find the dough or sauce particularly tasty; the crust and sides tend to get burnt in the cooking process, which I think is their "thang" but there's not enough of it on the pizza to really enjoy it. Mixed experience with service.  I ordered pickup once from their Morton Grove location and I'd rate the pizza there a 3.

This is MY FAVORITE pizza in Chicago when it comes to deep dish. There is nothing like it and it's worth the wait if you come during dinner. All of my experiences with staff have been extremely pleasant and the pizza, drinks and appetizers are always what I expect-DELICIOUS! I want Pequods now! Soooooo gooooood! Keep up the excellent work!!
The pizza is bomb. Theres something about sausages on chicago pizzas... its way better than the sausages on pizza in california. They have alcoholic root beer here. I was a happy camper.

My beloved Pequod's, how I miss thee. I still fantasize about your delicious, cheesy, caramelized crust and your crispy, spicy pepperonis. Oh, and your amazing, flavorful sauce. When my husband asks me what I want for dinner, I still answer Pequod's, even though that is a long lost dream.  I miss being able to order your deliciousness until the wee hours of the night when the craving would hit.  I miss the excitement I would feel when the buzzer in my apartment would go off and how my husband and I would get the Pequod's shrieks when we knew you were coming up the steps.  I miss how I would open the box and say every single time, "Ohhhhhh, this is a good one!  Check out that caramelization!"  I miss drafting pizza slices based on the amount of crust carmelization with my husband.  Pequod's, you have ruined all pizza for me.  I can't eat other pizza without thinking of you.  Nothing will ever come close to comparing with your greatness and nothing will ever replace you in my heart.   I can only hope that we will meet again soon.   Fondly yours,Kristy
Sauce is just a tad too sweet for me personally, but this is still really good pie.It does get busy so if you plan to dine in, get here early!
You can find better deep dish - the burnt crust pizza style doesn't taste very good.I would recommend trying other deep dish

While visiting my aunt she suggested we try one of her favorite pizza spots. We started with mozzarella sticks that were best out of a box and baked and the cheese was so stiff I almost gagged. I opted to get a personal pan deep dish cheese only and the family got a medium pepperoni and sausage deep dish. Be prepared to wait 45 minutes or longer for your pizza to arrive. The pizzas are cooked and served in a cast iron pan. For me the pizza lacked flavor even with cheese only. The crust was thick and bland. The rest of my party seemed to enjoy their pizza but I was not impressed.

HOLY HELL!I think I have died and gone to Pizza heaven.For serious.It seems my fellow yelpers are again correct in saying this is the BEST pizza in Chicago! WOW! Here's the breakdown:P = Popular beyond belief...and now I know why! It's the perfect place to grab a bit & a brew while watching Sunday night football :) Thankfully, they have 3 whole stories to accommodate all of their fans! E= Exceptional beers! Tapping into my inner local [pun intended!] we sampled various IPA's, Pale Ale's and various cocktails on the menu! They have everything :)Q = Quantity is massive! Being newbies, our party ordered apps, and 2 pizza's leaving us with hands full of to-go boxes and full bellies the next day! perfect!U = Undoubtedly the best crust ever!! Not only do they douse your pizza in cheese, but they add some extra on the crust for a nice crunch! mmmm!O = Orgasm to the mouth. Not even kidding.D = Drains the wallet a bit, but 100% worth it! :)'S = a STAPLE of Chicago!!

Bartender was cool, and for my first deep-dish experience, pizza was awesome.  The sauce was a little on the tangy side, which I wasn't a HUGE fan of, but everything else was great.  I got the small sausage & pepperoni and had half a pizza left to give to a homeless guy on my way to the train.  I would've kept it for later, but I felt guilty not sharing.Will return when I'm back in Chicago, but admittedly have not tried Malnati's, Giordano's or others yet.

May be good pizza just don't plan on having a party of more than 15 people no room in this tight neighborly joint. The service was slow the food was ok and the count was off! Tried to charge for 23 people when only 19 people in our party! 1 whom was 18 , we never got got asked if everybody arrived in party and count. When we asked them to view camera for count the lady manager said she was calling the cops for interrupting her! My friends came over to buy my son a shot for his birthday and must have got counted in group. When she attempted to show her bill that she paid the manager said enough your ganging up on me! They need organization and proper arrangements for counting! We came all the way from Indiana and ordered platinum package! I even left cake because I was so upset!

Quality pizza, one of my favorite deep dishes in the city and I love the caramelized crust.  They just don't have good service on a consistent basis and deliveries take awhile.  I think they have a great product but suffer from poor management (I have heard stories), high turnover and being busy.  For instance, Tuesday I took my 3 little cousins to see the 5 o'clock showing of Guardians of the Galaxy, I pre ordered 3 pizzas to be ready at 7:15, knowing they take awhile and I wanted to get the kids home to Beverly by 8:30 or so.  They "lost" the ticket number and pizzas were never even put in till about 7:45 and we didn't get out of there till around 8:45.  Nonetheless, a great place to hit if you have time.  Lunch special is good, you get a beer and a personal pizza for about $7.

I LOVE PEQUODS! This is my favorite pizza place and I always have had an amazing time there. great food and my family will forever order from this place. This is great Chicago pizza and I think that this is some of the coolest food we have in the city.

5 stars without hesitation. My chicagonian friends recommend this as THE best in town, so we stopped in to cap off the weekend. It's definitely the best deep dish pizza I've ever had. Ill also add that I'm not easy to please. You should just come. That is all.

Visiting from Orange County. Looking back, I don't know why I waited 2.5 hours for pizza. It was good, no doubt, but by the time your pizza comes you're ready to eat the table. Ordered the deep dish with ground beef, spinach, garlic, and jalapeno as well as a caesar salad. They don't have an extensive list of toppings, especially non-pork options. The bar next door must make bank.

"Call me Ishmael" - First line of Moby Dick The restaurant is named after Captain Ahabs ship in the novel. The place is huge and it was packed when we went. There was a sign that pizzas were running 50 minutes. That is a long time. You might as well read Moby Dick while you wait for your pizza. Good thing I didn't have to be anywhere and I was with great companyWhen the pizza finally came out it looked and smelled delicous. It was definitey worth the wait. I was stuffed after 1 1/2 pieces. It was very heavy. I am a New Yorker and I know pizza. Deep dish isn't my favorite but Pequod's is the place to get deep dish in Chicago. I suggest ordering an appetizer while you wait. "Then all collapsed, and the great shroud of the sea rolled on as it rolled five thousand years ago." - Last line of Moby Dick.

What the? I'm not exactly sure what all the hype is about.  SERIOUSLY.  I went here a couple of years ago and didn't like it,  but decided it give it a second chance tonight with my cousin from out of town. ..Holy overrated! First of all, our waitress was wack...I mean,  she could've just been having a bad day so whatever. Secondly, the menu is outdated and they really should invest in a drink menu or drink specials. The food?  No bueno. The burnt crust aka 'caramelized' crust on the 'deep dish' that everyone raves about was just awful. The pizza was bland and the sausage was gross. I mean, honestly I don't understand all of these elite reviews,  are we eating at the same place?! I love pizza, I really do & I guess you should give it a chance...I guess. Will I be going back?  Negative.

My party of 8 dined here for lunch on a Saturday . We used the website to request seating a few days in advance . We were seated right away. The food was amazing. We ordered the appetizer combo, everything tasted fresh. We also had a sausage and cheese thin crust pizza, it was really good. A few people in my party thought the sausage tasted weird or like it came from a box. I do not eat sausage so I wouldn't know. I would come back

I have eaten at about 5 Chicago pizza places now and I must say that this is the best pizza in the city. Came here mainly because I have heard so much about it and I just had to give it a try. When you first walk in, it looks like a bar and grill with an upstairs, not to mention the small size menu. For starters, I went the buffalo wings, which were really really good. As for the pizza, I went with a sausage, pepperoni, and garlic. The pizza is simply greatness. The sausage is on point, they give you a lot of pepperoni and the garlic blends in greatly. The slices are big (got a medium with six slices for two but should of just got a small) and the addition of the legendary caramelized crust takes the pizza into a unseen stratosphere. Their beer (at $6 a glass) is even at a decent price. Overall the only pizza place I haven't ate at in Chicago is Lou malnati, but if it's anything like Pequod then lord help us all.

Too many excellent places for pizza in Chicago to waste time and money here. Have ordered twice from their take-out location at Chicago and Dearborn and both times they got the order wrong. Very expensive to boot. Employees seem clueless and preoccupied with their own cell phones when you arrive. Not sure it's smart to keep old credit card receipts by the take-out door either.
Yumme yumme yummee!!! One of my favorite places when I visited Chicago. Ordered the large deep dish pizza and 3 orders of wings. Both were delicious! I am a pizza lover, this place didnt dissappoint.

Pizza preferences are usually based on where you're from, so let me start this by saying that I'm from Cincinnati. I like thick-ish pan pizzas with slightly tangy sauce and a chewy, stringy mozzerella topping. I like to eat pizza with my hands, and I like to eat more than one slice (lookin' at you, deep dish). Overall I like a balance of the sauce and cheese that, in my opinion, neither NY style nor Chicago style have a lock on (NY: too much cheese, Chicago: too much sauce). So Pequod's: great or the greatest?? Lemmie break it down for you: Sauce: Killer-diller. Not too sweet and not too tart.Cheese: Mozzerella--chewy and delicious. Weirded out initially by the cheese on the crust, but it gives the pizza a nice crunch at the end. Crust: Oh god so good--this is the mother-of-all pan pizza crusts. Thick, but solid and not incredibly doughy like Chicago deep dish. Crunchy and crusty at the bottom so that you can actually eat a slice with your hands without it bending down. Sauce-to-cheese ratio: Almost perfect! A little heavy on the sauce, but way closer to my ideal ratio than any other pizza joint in the area. Toppings: This is the only thing that threw me. The garlic topped pizza was fantastic, but the sausage on the sausage-topped pizza was too chewy for me--almost seemed over-cooked. Verdict: Sausage-less Pequod's is my true-heart's desire. I can't speak for the in-restaurant service, since I got it delivered. Pequod's pizza all day, every day, now and forever, amen.
Pequod's is where you go to get your comfort food- deep dish pizza. My fiance loves Pequod's and I've learned to love it as wel. :)

Personally, my favorite pizza in Chicago! Living in the city, we've had our fair share, but nothing compares to this! And SO IMPRESSED that they deliver all the way downtown to us! Thanks, Pequod's! Best pizza in Chicago delivered right to our door!! YUMMMMM... (also, the ONLY pizza I'll cheat on my diet for) :)

Decent.  Deep dish just doesn't seem to do it for me like thin crust does.  Way too much dough.  Was hoping there'd be a little less. I ordered the personal pizza with sausage and meatballs.  I did like how the cheese was burned into the crust.  The wait was a little longer than I would have liked...Someone came in after us, was seated after us, ordered a larger pizza, and got his first.  Overall decent but nothing blew me away.

Best. Pizza. In. Chicago. If you have never been here before, be prepared for the burnt cheese crust. You won't be disappointed. Also check out the weekday lunch special. $5.99 one topping personal pan pizza and a soft drink. Great neighborhood gem.

I have never dined at the restaurant, only ordered delivery.  It will be a minimum 90 minute wait to get your delivery so order early.  The individual pan pizzas are great, I am a big fan of the spinach as it is fresh and not frozen.  The Pequods salad is awesome although the big chunks of raw yellow onion are overpowering.

Always a great meal here! My boyfriend and I don't eat dairy and they always make our cheeseless pizza and it never fails to disappoint! We also had the wings here and they are very good too! Just go here, it's always good and the service is good too.

Called ahead on a Sunday and was able to get a table for 5 without a long wait; I was happy about that and I recommend calling ahead.Once we sat down we ordered 5 beers and 2 pizzas immediately, knowing that it was going to take awhile.
